loans.name: Francilia Abel

texts.pt:
Francilia Abel S. nasceu na Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique é viúva, mãe de uma rapariga de 15 anos de idade que vai a escola. Vive na casa do estado e responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em Boane enviando lhes 500.00mt por mês. 

 Francilia começa trabalhar na Cruz Vermelha como Servente, mas devido a sua dedicação ganha uma bolsa e faz um curso na Ação Social primeiramente enquadrada na Província de Nampula a Norte de Moçambique onde junta se com seu falecido marido. Devido a perda do marido ela pede uma transferência e é enquadrada no Distrito de Namaacha como Técnica no Serviço Distrital de Saúde Mulher e Ação Social, onde trabalha ha mais de 10 anos. Recebe 3.324.00mt por mês e também presta serviços no Município do mesmo distrito, como membro da assembléia Municipal a mais de 1 ano auferindo um valor mensal de 5.314.00mt num contrato de 5 anos. Este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt foi usado para comércio e habitação (legalização do seu terreno). 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir mais ainda para poder concluir a sua casa e sair da casa do estado onde vive atualmente.
texts.en:
Francilia was born in the Maputo Province, in South Mozambique. She is a widow and mother of a 15 year old girl who is in school. She lives in government housing and takes care of her parents who live in Boane by sending them 500 meticais every month. 

Francilia started working for the Red Cross as a janitor. Due to her dedication she earned a scholarship to take a class at Social Action. She was first assigned to Nampula Province, in North Mozambique where she met her deceased husband. After her husband's passing, she requested a transfer and was assigned to the Namaacha District as a technician at the District's Women's Health Services and Social Action where she has been for more than 10 years. She earns 3,324 meticais per month and has also been rendering services to the City in the same District as a member of the City's Assembly for more than a year, earning a monthly salary of 5,314 meticais under a 5 year contract. She spends her earnings with household expenses and manages to save some in her savings account. 

She never had loans with other banks. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. With this loan, in the amount of 25,000, she plans to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, iron and others) to continue her construction. The previous loans were for 5,000 and 20,000 meticais and were used for commerce and housing (to legalize her lot of land). 

She is confident she will pay ahead of time and request even more to finish her house and leave the government housing she currently lives in.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, sand, iron and others)

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula S. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She has a retail business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for three years and works seven days a week.  She sells her charcoal from home.

Zula has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her main business challenges include the rainy season and transportation of bags of charcoal from the market to her home.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.

Zula lives in a home that she owns; she does not have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Evelyne Akinyi

texts.en:
Evelyne is married and has two children whom she and her husband support.

Evelyne was introduced to KADET by a client who is already in a group and a member of KADET.  She is requesting her first loan and has not joined any other microfinance institutions.  Evelyne has been in the business of selling waste paper for three years and has a good income.  She plans to use her loan to purchase more waste paper.

Evelyne's business is located in a busy open-air market; the population is large, so there are many customers.  She will use her extra profits to start a paper-recycling factory.

She hopes to become a prominent businesswoman and describes herself as enterprising and outgoing.

loans.use: To purchase more waste paper

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
J. Nabi is 55 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising and selling sheep and large livestock at the local market.  Every year, he buys young heifers and sheep from farms in adjacent villages.  He raises them with the help of his sons and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Nabi is thinking about expanding his business because the income from his present herd is not sufficient to provide for his family.  He plans to purchase more young cattle.  To do so, he needs to invest an additional 6500 somoni in his business.  In order to obtain this amount, he has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan has a rich history.  It hosted a key post on the Silk Road and marked the extent of Alexander the Great's empire.  It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.  The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hikmatoy

texts.en: Hikmatoy devotes herself to the production of vegetables on her land. For this reason, she has remained as long as possible on her land, dedicating herself to the care and fertilization of her fields. With all this effort, it has been possible to obtain good harvests and sell the products, and to offer her two children an education and personal development appropriate for their age. This hard work also makes her think of opening a grocery store in her house, thus providing a larger share of income for the family’s kitty. However, this will require a larger investment, so Hikmatoy is asking for your help in obtaining a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man and the father of one young child. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a home electrician from the past 10 years. He works on a freelance basis upon the request of his clients. He is the main income provider for his family. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new tools. These tools are needed because he has employed two part-time employees and he needs to augment his business tools to take on more projects. He expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Rizo

texts.en: Z. Rizo sells perfumes and detergents in the central marketplace of his small hometown. Small ventures like Rizo’s become the main source of income, as for his family of parents and brothers. Rizo has been in the trade for five years. His business is characterized by stability and positive performance. The inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwasher detergent, perfumes, laundry soap, shampoo and other household chemicals. Rizo wants to see his business grow in the future which is why he is requesting a loan of $3000 US to increase his turnover capital. He is hoping to boost further development of his business with this additional assistance. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for four years and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk through Kenya Cooperative Creameries. She also earns income from running a shop. She recently repaid a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her children. Her major challenges have been lack of enough water and animal feed, especially during the dry season. In five years' time, she would like to have at least four pure dairy breeds.

Juliana is 40 years old. She is married and has been blessed with four children who are between the ages of 3 and 20. Three of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: James Mutua

texts.en:
James is single and he supports his family. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a member of KADET. He is applying for his first loan from KADET.

James has been in the business of repairing electronic machines like computers,laboratory machines, for six years and makes good profit. James business is located in town where there are all types of people in the society and, indeed, he has many customers. With this loan he will purchase more stock of spare parts for the computers that needs to be maintained for this will improve the services he offers to his customers. James will use the profits to plough back into business to grow and have stable source of income. James believes that he is hardworking.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Afeef

texts.en:
Afeef is a Palestinian National Authority employee from Jineen who was recently able to purchase a house. Afeef has a two-year-old daughter. His parents own a piece of land where they plant olives and he helps them work in the field. Afeef needed to cover the costs of some home appliances, therefore he came to FATEN for a loan to help him purchase them.

FATEN helped the couple cover those expenses; Afeef and his wife Mariam have a good reputation.
Afeef appears in the picture here in FATEN’s office

loans.use: Purchase home appliance

loans.name: Catherine Kipsilgich

texts.en:
Catherine Kipsilgich C., 53, is married to James Kiptoo. They have five children aged 32, 30, 28, 26, and 22 respectively. They live in Kipkaren Eldoret, Kenya. Catherine has been in the kitchenware business for the past six years, and earns her monthly income of KES 12,000 primarily from selling utensils. 

Catherine was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She paid off her first loan successfully, and is now applying for a second loan of KES 20,000. She plans to expand her stock by purchasing dozens of sufurias (cooking pots) to sell. She hopes to operate a large shop and open other branches in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of sufurias to sell

loans.name: Conjesta

texts.en:
Conjesta is 47 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 5 school-aged children. She has been practicing mixed farming for ten years in Kitale town, in western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces milk and beans, which she sells locally. She depends on the income from her farming activities to meet her family’s basic needs. Her major challenges in farming have been the high cost of dairy feeds and low market prices for her milk.

Conjesta has requested a loan of 36,400 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of the cow’s milk will help her to meet her family’s basic needs. She hopes to be able to increase her milk production and adopt zero grazing practices in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is married with four children.  This hardworking and focused lady used to practice horticultural farming, but for the past five years has been a dairy farmer.  She supplements her income by rearing poultry.  She has employed one person in her business.  

Serah has requested 85,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.  She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the training they provided her in proper business record-keeping practices, which has enabled her to run her business well.  She sees herself adding more cows and chicks to her farm in the next five years.  She also hopes to provide her children with the highest level of education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Everylyne

texts.en:
Everylyne has a mixed farm which produces milk, vegetables and maize. She sells all her products to the local market. She has been farming for the last ten years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, vegetables and maize which she sells to the local market. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her biggest challenge is disease which affects her production. She wishes to have a chaff cutter for cutting straw or hay into small pieces and also to buy four dairy cows in the next five years.

Everylyne is 44 years old. She is married with 5 school-aged children.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for the past 15 years. Her farm produces maize, beans and vegetables which she sells to the local market. She is also a food vendor in the same region. Her biggest challenge in farming has been fluctuation in the market prices of her products.

She has requested this loan of 36,400KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her improve her business and take care of the basic needs of the family. She hopes to acquire more dairy cows in future.

Eunice is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children who are between the ages of 2 and 15. Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emily Chepngetich

texts.en:
Emily Chepngetich S. is a hardworking lady of 41 years, married to Nelson Lagat who is a teacher. Together they have five children, aged 17 years, 15 years, 12 years, 10 years and six years. They live in Kapsoya Eldoret, Kenya. She has been farming (poultry Farm) for about five years and she earns a monthly income of Kshs.5,000.

When she learned about KADET LTD she has no history with any other MFI. she has applied for her second loan of Ksh. 30,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to buy supplies of poultry feed and more chicks to rear and sale later at a profit. She will also have more eggs to sell to her customers .She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to buy a dairy cow.

Emily hopes to grow her business and become the leading local business in poultry farming in the area and to see her children realize their dreams in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy supplies of poultry feed and more chicks to rear and sale

loans.name: Lucy  Kalumu

texts.en:
Lucy is married and they have three children whom they support.

Lucy is acquiring a first loan from KADET. She is hoping to pay it successful. Lucy was introduced to KADET through group members. 

She operates in a densely populated area with a lot of construction going on, hence. a good business with many customers. Lucy has been in the hardware business for three years with good income every month. With this loan she plan to purchase gallons of paints and paint boards.

With the extra profits, Lucy will save to expand her business and open a new branch. She hopes to open many branches and offer employment to many Kenyans. She believes she is ambitious, hardworking and always ready to meet new challenges.

loans.use: The loan will be used to add supplies of paints and paint boards.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 50 year old married lady.  She has four children who have completed school.  She is a hardworking lady who sells vegetables and fruits.  She has done this business for two years.  She also rents out houses to earn additional income.  

As a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been trained on financial management.  She has also benefited from the MFI because she previously took out a loan.  She has noe requested  a loan of 80, 000 Kenyan shillings.  With the loan, she will purchase a piece of land and rooms for renting.  She sees herself becoming financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land and rooms for renting

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 35 years old. He is married with three children who are between the ages of 3 months and 6 years. His eldest child is currently attending school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years. His mixed farm produces vegetables, milk and cereals which he sells locally. He also earns income from his shop and rental houses in the same region. His biggest challenge in farming has been the fluctuation of market prices and stiff competition in the market.

Gabriel has requested this loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry project and build a dairy unit. The extra income from this loan will enable him to improve the well-being of his family. In the future, he hopes to increase the number of his dairy cows and expand his poultry project.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project and build a dairy unit

loans.name: Antony Mwangi

texts.en: Antony has been in the auto spare parts business for seven years. He is single. His business is located in a highly populated area and he serves many customers. Antony joined KADET through contact with existing group members. He is receiving his first loan as he has not joined other MFIs yet. Antony will use the loan to add more stock to his business. With the extra profits, he wants to grow his business. Antony hopes to own a big shop, as he believes he is hardworking and humble.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a member of Upendo Group of Faulu Kenya. He operates a butcher shop to earn a living. His business is located in a very competitive environment with most of his customers being people from his area. Having been in the business for eight years, he hopes to open other outlets. He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a refrigerator and an energy-saving cooker so as to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and an energy-saving cooker

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina (pictured with her dairy cow) has a mixed farm on the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces eggs and milk which are all sold locally. She is 50 years old and married with four children who are between the ages of 16 and 31. Three of the children are currently attending school. Currently one of her children is at university. 

Paulina has requested this loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farming. This loan will help her purchase more stock of chickens and build a poultry shed. Being the sole provider of her family, the extra income from this loan will assist her in paying school fees for her children. Her major challenge has been diseases which are extremely expensive to treat. She intends to increase the number of her dairy cows to five in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en: Silvester owns a retail shop. He had a previous job before he went into this business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya's financial support, he has expanded the shop by adding shelves on one side and stock. This has led to increased sales. He is hardworking and committed to succeeding in his business. He has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bags of cereals such as rice, beans, maize and peas. He also wants to buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. He hopes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. Her main products are milk, maize, vegetables and eggs which she sells at the local market. Esther is 38 years old. She is married with six children who are between the ages of 3 and 14. Five of the children are currently attending school.

Esther has requested this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. She hopes that the extra income from this project will help her improve the well-being of her family. Her biggest challenge has been poultry diseases. In five years' time, she hopes to have expanded her trade to become the major supplier of locally produced eggs at the market.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Paul Wambua

texts.en:
Paul is married and supports three children.

Paul was introduced to KADET through a credit officer. He is on his first loan and has not joined any other MFIs yet. Paul has been in the hotel and general store business for eight years.  With the loan he will add stock in the hotel, buying more tables and seats, and re-stock the general shop.

Paul's business is located in a busy open air market. The population is large so there are many customers. With the extra profits from this loan, Paul will open a restaurant and build a makuti garden.  He hopes to open a big hotel as he believes he is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To add stock for the hotel (e.g. tables) and more stock for the general store

loans.name: Patrick Musyoki

texts.en:
Patrick is married.  He and his wife have three children whom they support.  Patrick describes himself as hardworking, honest and trustworthy.

Patrick has been in the clothes-selling business for two years.  With this loan, he plans to add more to the stock of clothes that he has for sale so that he can satisfy his customers with a variety of choices.  Part of his additional stock will includes baby clothes, as these are greatly in demand.   Patrick's business is located in an open air market, thus he has access to many customers.

With his extra profits, he desires to be able to provide for basic needs for the family.  In the future, Patrick hopes to grow his business and build rental houses and own a matatu.

He was introduced to KADET by group members, and he is acquiring his first loan.  He has never borowed from any other MFI.

loans.use: To add to the stock of clothes he has for sale

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor K. is married with two little children. He has been managing his business since 2005. The family lives with Grigor’s pensioner parents. Grigor sells shoes from a rented trading booth in Malatia market. The household’s main income comes from this business. Grigor has applied for this loan in order to purchase new shoes for his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old married man. He is blessed with a four-year-old child who goes to school. He is a hardworking man who runs a retail shop. He also has a motorbike transport business to earn extra income. He has been able to improve his business using loans that he gets from Faulu Kenya. He has also learned how to save his money. With this loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings, he will add stock of cooking fat, soda and maize flour. He hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of cooking fat, soda and maize flour

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old and married with two children, ages 2 and 4. Both children attend school. He is a dairy farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for the last two years. He employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk which he sells to the local market including hotels. He also earns income from his motorbike transport business.

Peter has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him with the education of his children. His biggest challenge has been disease which is costly to treat. In five years' time, he would like to increase his land from the current 0.5 acre to 5 acres to enable him to increase his dairy business. He appreciates the fact that Juhudi has put him a step closer to owning a dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: John Mbindu

texts.en:
John is married and has three children whom he supports. He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

John joined KADET through the recommendation of other group members and is acquiring his first loan; he has not dealt with other MFI's yet. John has been in the water distribution business for three years and makes a good profit. With this loan, he intends to obtain more means of water storage to be able to distribute water widely.

With the extra profits, John will purchase more household items. John hopes to be an international business dealer.

loans.use: To obtain more means of water storage

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka P. is 25 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children who do not go to school yet.

Nyoka is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start building a house.

loans.use: To stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Charles Kioko

texts.en:
Charles is married and has two children to support. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years. Charles’ business is located in a highly populated area, so there are many customers. He is hardworking, outgoing and honest.

Charles was introduced to KADET by group members. He is servicing his second loan and repaid his previous one successfully. With this loan he will increase his stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

With extra profits, Charles plans to enlarge his business and tend to domestic and household requirements. He hopes to start juice extraction as part of his business.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 40 years old. He is married with three children, aged 15, 10 and 7. For 10 years, he has been practicing dairy farming. He was previously rearing pigs. He also runs a transport business using a van. He has been able to manage his resources well.  

He has requested 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow and a chaff cutter. He hopes to open up a ranch with high yield cows and become a major supplier of milk.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and a chaff cutter

loans.name: Kiko

texts.en:
Kiko J. is currently in the business of selling bread at home and is requesting a loan to stock baking flour to make the local Sudanese bread to sell.  

Kiko is 28 years old and married to a driver. She has four children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: Stock baking flour to make local Sudanese bread to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria M. is currently in the business of selling beans and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour and sorghum to sell.  

Victoria is 42 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock maize flour and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet operates a cafeteria where she sells chips. She has two employees in her business. She also depends on her husband for financial support.  

She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to get capital for her business, which has been running for five years. She wants to own at least two cafeterias in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shilings to buy potatoes for cooking chips.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for cooking chips

loans.name: Hovnan

texts.en:
Hovnan A. is married with three children. They are all living together with Hovnan's parents. The main income for the family comes from farming. All family members combine their efforts to make the farming business successful. The wife and mother milk the cows and every single family member is involved during grass collection. 

Hovnan's elder son is a student, and for his high marks (grades), he has been allowed to study free of charge. While Hovnan's two other children are still of school age, Hovnan is willing to increase the family's income to be able to send his younger children to the university too, since in the future, there will be no option of free university studying. 

Hovnan is planning to increase the cattle on the farm and buy two wheels for the tractor. The photo was taken after a heavy rain.

loans.use: Buying cattle and two tractor wheels

loans.name: Omusee

texts.en:
Omusee has been farming for the last eight years in Kitale town, western Kenya, and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, eggs and vegetables, which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Omusee is 68 years old. He is married with eight children who are all adults.

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that this loan will enable him provide for the basic needs of the family. His biggest challenge is transportation of eggs to the market. 

He wishes to acquire five more dairy cows in the future and be the main milk supplier to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries in his region.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Susan  Pose

texts.en:
Susan is married and has four children. She was introduced to KADET by World Vision ADP. She is requesting her first loan. Susan has been selling clothing for two years. With this loan, she plans to increase her inventory of clothing textiles.

Susan's business is located in a busy open-air market. With the extra profits, she wants to start a textile factory. She hopes to become a prominent business person and a wholesaler. Susan describes herself as a dreamer.

loans.use: To increase her supply of clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cover house expenses

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 26 years old and runs a food stall where he prepares doughnuts. For ten years, he has been running the business with two employees. He supplies the doughnuts to the nearby area. He hopes to expand his market niche in the future. He has requested a loan of 40, 000 Kenyan shilling to buy wheat flour, sugar, charcoal ,and firewood.  He sees himself opening a bakery in five years.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar, charcoal, and firewood.

loans.name: Kisajon Ene Kolila

texts.en:
Kisajon is married and has three children. She was introduced to KADET through a credit officer, and she is requesting her first loan. 

Kisajon's primary business is selling beads. She also buys animal fats to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for about ten years. With the loan, she will enlarge her business by purchasing more beads, clothes, decorations, and animal fats to supply to  her customers and to the people who run the shops near her.

Kisajon's business is located in a busy open-air market. Kisajon hopes to become a big trader and to supply tourist products.

loans.use: To purchase beads, clothes, decorations, and animal fats

loans.name: Soso

texts.en:
Soso J. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables such okra and cabbages. She is requesting a loan so she can stock fish to sell. 

Soso is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has five children who are all in school.  With the profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon. He has driven a taxi since 2005. His main route is between his village and its surroundings. He works hard to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to replace the van engine. He says that he will be able to attract new customers after making this repair. His income from his taxi business is vital for supporting his family. In the future, he hopes to purchase a new car so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To replace the van engine

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a member of the Wema group in Faulu Kenya. She runs a grocery shop to earn a living. She also sells charcoal in a stall made of iron sheets. Her husband also supports her financially. She was previously running a retail shop before she went into this business.    

She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy charcoal and groceries.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and groceries

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida A. is 58 years old and is married to Dickson Okach. They have three children. They live in the Nyamasaria area on the outskirts of Kisumu city. 

Leonida runs a tree nursery and has been doing this business for the past 15 years. Her business has really grown through the years and she has managed to create a huge clientele. 

She is applying for her second loan and she intends to use the money to buy more trees to add to her nursery. She has a good credit history with KADET, having paid well her first loan. Her monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

Her hope and dream is to expand her business in such a way that she is able to employ one person to help her run her business.

loans.use: Buy trees for the nursery

loans.name: Marcos Rosendo

texts.es:
El señor  Marcos Rosendo M.  V. tiene 26 años y vive en la ciudad de Tarija, en calidad de casero. El cliente por ahora no tiene hijos y solamente se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros (taxista) a la vez el forma parte de un grupo folklorico llamado "embajadores del  rey" en donde el toca el violín", esto le permite a el tener un ingreso extra ya que el solo va a tocar cuando el grupo tiene un contrato. 

Marcos nos comentaba que el formar parte de este grupo le ha  permitido viajar al exterior (Argentina), con su grupo, yendo a eventos en donde fueron contratados, además que estos viajes le favorecen económicamente porque su remuneración es más alta. Marcos dice que con el crédito que sacara lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su auto, como ser suspensión, llantas, arreglo del tapiz, etc.  Además Marcos sostiene que conoce muy bien su actividad que realiza ya que desde hace tres años se dedica al mismo, como también a la de músico (tocando el violín).
texts.en:
Marcos Rosendo M. V. is 26 years old and lives in the city of Tarija where he is taking care of a property. He does not have children yet. He works as a taxi driver as well as playing the violin in a folk group, which gives him some extra income on the side as he only plays when the group are hired to play. Mario is now very familiar with both of these activities as he has worked as a taxi driver and musician for the last three years.

Marcos tells us that being part of this group has allowed him to travel abroad to Argentina, going to events where they were hired to play. These trips have also been beneficial economically as they have brought in higher earnings. 

Marcos says that he will invest this loan in the maintenance of his vehicle, which will include suspension adjustment, tyre replacement and carpet cleaning.

loans.use: Purchase of artefacts to repair and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Kipsang

texts.en:
Kipsang is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last five years and employs two farmhands. He is also a businessman.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income from this loan will enable him to provide for the basic needs of his family and pay school fees for his children. His primary challenges are lack of enough animal feeds and water. He hopes that in the future, he will acquire a dairy cow that produces at least 40 liters of milk daily.

Kipsang is 36 years old. He is married with six children who are between the ages of 2 and 14. Five of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Twezimbe Women's Group Buikwe-Lugazi

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Azzidsa N.'s food-selling business in Lweru-Lugazi generates 200,000 shililngs a month. Azzida is a single, hardworking mother with six kids. Her business has now lasted 20 years. 

Being an agriculturist has been invaluable in many ways, principally the fact that she hardly runs out of food to sell. The kinds of foods she sells are popular all over Uganda. Foods such as bananas, cassava, maize, cabbages, pumpkins and sweet potatoes are mostly what she sells. 

With this loan, she is looking at rejuvenating her business with the bulk purchase of staple foods like bananas, cassava and beans to resell. Azzida is anticipating that she will be able to make more than enough profits after she resells most of what she will buy. She also hopes to keep more in reserve. Azzida is part of the Twezimbe Women's Group - Buikwe, Lugazi.

loans.use: The purchase of staple foods such as bananas, cassava, beans, etc., for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married woman living with her husband in Lebanon. She has owned a poultry shop in her town since 2008. With her business income, she helps her husband who works as a driver with the family expenses. She is thankful for her decision to establish her own business and she feels independent and supportive. Her shop is well known in the region because she always offers a good quality of chicken to her customers. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her purchases, her sales and her income.  In the future, she is planning to continue expansion of her business,  enlarge her shop and start presenting chicken sandwiches for sale.

loans.use: to increase her purchases

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario  se dedica desde hace ya quince años a la producción de leche y derivados, su familia esta compuesta por el, su esposa además de sus dos hijos, cuenta con doce vacas lecheras tipo holstein además de sus crías, las cuales son atendidas por don Mario  su esposa e hijos desde muy tempranas horas del día, entrega diariamente la leche a un complejo muy conocido de la ciudad de Cochabamba, con el dinero del credito comprara 2 vaquillas que le estan ofreciendo a buen precio y no quiere dejar de pasar esta buena oportunidad, cuenta con terrenos propios donde tiene sembrado alfalfa para la alimentación del ganado, es una persona muy trabajadora, y esta muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Mario has worked in the production of milk and other dairy products for over fifteen years. His family is comprised of himself, his wife and his two children. They own twelve milk producing Holstein cows and their offspring, which are cared for by the family. Mario gets up in the early hours of the morning to deliver the milk to a very well known organisation in the city of Cochabamba. Additionally, Mario also has his own land where he has planted alfafa to feed his cattle. 

With the loan that he is applying for, Mario will buy two heifers that are being offered at a good price, to take advantage of this great opportunity.  He is a very hardworking person and is very grateful to Emprender for the confidence they have placed in him in granting him this loan.

loans.use: Purchase of two heifers

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been farming for the last 36 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk, eggs, maize and beans which are sold locally. He also earns income from his pension pay. His biggest challenge in farming has been the high cost of dairy feed and sometimes diseases which are too costly to treat.

Michael has requested this loan of 41,600 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from the sale of milk will improve his economic status and also enable him pay school fees for his children. He plans to add two more dairy cows in future that will increase his productivity and help him be self sustainable.

Michael is 58 years old. He is married with 10 children who are between the ages of 12 and 32. Five of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sulma Dansi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Sulma Dansi; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes platos y los vende en forma independiente llevando a las instituciones de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia quiere tener un restaurant para que pueda vender la deliciosa comida que prepara. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y también vajilla como platos y cubiertos.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra Sulma Dansi belongs to the SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY Community Bank which is located in the town of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

A widow with three children, Selma is 54 years old. As well as her usual household chores, she runs a business selling food. She prepares different dishes and takes them to institutions in Cusco where she sells them. Selma would like to have a restaurant where she could sell the delicious food she prepares. She is asking for a loan to buy cooking ingredients and also crockery and cutlery.

She is grateful to those who contribute to her dream by making donations and promises to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients, crockery, and cutlery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Roland

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 34 ans, celibataire et pere d'un enfant dont l'âge est ans,il commence ce commerce en 2008.En moyenne il vend environ 20000 à 85000frs par jours

Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente, ses clients sont les entrepreneurs, les fonctionnaires qui sont entrain de construire des maisons.

Avec le prêt qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer son activité en achetant des mecanisme wc, des sanitaires,des meetiger, des coudes wc,des ventous.

A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise au Cameroun, Nigeria et Dubai 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
This 34-year old man is single and a father of a child who is …years old. HE launched his business in 2008. His sales average between 20,000 and 85,000 West African Francs per day.

In order to overcome [financial hardship] and to support his family he started his hardware business. He has a number of selling strategies. His clients are entrepreneurs and governmental employees who are in the process of building houses. With this loan he plans to bolster his business in purchasing WC mechanisms, toilet bowls, mixer faucets, elbow pipes, valves etc.

In the future he plans to become a wholesaler, and  save enough in order to open a large store and be able to travel to stock up in Cameroon, Nigeria and Dubai. He is very serious about his work and also hopes to be able to offer college education to his children.

loans.use: Purchasing faucets, toilet bowls,  lightbulbs etc

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
El Señor Rufino Fernández T. tiene 41 años, el vive en concubinato y es padre de siete hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, por lo cual tanto su hijo mayor como el trabajan para sustentar a toda su familia,   El cliente se dedica al servicio de moto taxista en la localidad de Ivirgarzama hace mas de 6 años, el está afiliado al sindicato de moto taxista "CARRASCO", y su hijo trabaja como ayudante de albañil como unos 2 años, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio. 

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, para que su hijo mayor trabaje en el sindicato y puedan mejorar la calidad de vida que lleva y la de su familia.
texts.en:
41-year old Señor Rufino Fernández T. lives with his partner and has seven children to support and provide with education. Both he and his eldest son work to provide for the family. Rufino has worked as a taxi driver for more than six years in the area of Ivirgarzama with the Carrasco taxi service. His son has worked for about two years as an assistant to a bricklayer. 

The company that Rufino works for has taxi ranks and shifts for each of its drivers in different places in Ivirgarzama where people can go to find a taxi. It's a well-paid job as he provides fast and efficient service to his many customers.

This is the first time that Rufino has sought a loan from our institution. He plans to use it to buy a new motorcycle so that his oldest son can join the taxi company and they can improve their family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mario; el tiene 51 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de panadería y también trabaja prestando servicio de taxi, el trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de panadería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  materiales para preparar el pan como harina, azúcar, leche y manteca. 


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mario belongs to the SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY Community Bank which is located in the town of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name. He is 51 years old, married, and has three children. He has a bakery and also runs a taxi service. He works from 6 am to 7 pm.

Mario wants to improve his bakery business and plans to use the loan to buy ingredients for making bread such as flour, sugar, milk, and lard.

He is grateful to all those who contribute to his dreams by making donations, and he promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables which he sells locally. He also earns income from his employment as a nursing officer.

Alex is 54 years old. He is married with 6 school-aged children.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 62,400 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that his income will increase with the additional sale of milk and this will enable him pay school fees for his children with ease. His biggest challenges have been diseases and fluctuation in the market prices of milk and sometimes unreliable labor. In future, he would like to set up a zero grazing unit and also own a high quality breed of dairy cows.

He comments that Juhudi is definitely out to empower him and others economically and things will never be the same for all the members of his group.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de sogas para diferentes usos que se les pude dar, ella vende las sogas en forma independiente en la pla za de armas de la ciudad de Cusco, ella vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un puesto donde pueda vender las sogas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sogas al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Alejandrina, a member of the Banco Comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” (“Lord of Muruhuay” Communal Bank). The communal bank is located in the Cusco department, province and district.

Alejandrina is 33, and she lives with her partner and her 4 children. She alternates her daily chores and her retail activity selling a variety of ropes for different purposes. She is an independent merchant and she works in the Plaza de Armas, in the town of Cusco, from 8 am to 6 pm; she would like to own a place where to sell ropes, and she is requesting a loan to buy ropes at wholesale price.

She is thankful to those that will help her achieve her dream through this loan, and she commits to comply with the repayments of her dues in the set time.

loans.use: To buy ropes at wholesale price.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya where he has been farming for the last 30 years. He has employed one farmhand from his community. His farm produces milk, maize and beans which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family. 

Stephen has requested this loan of 52,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The increased income from the sale of milk will enable him pay school fees for his children and their nutrition will be taken care of. He faces the challenges of diseases which is too costly to treat and the high cost of animal feeds. He however intends to expand his farming in the future by buying a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production and earn him more income.

Stephen is 47 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are between the ages of 1 and 32. Five of the children are currently attending school. He is happy to have joined Juhudi and wishes that Juhudi could organize seminars for them.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
El señor Juan David B. C. tiene 49 años, vive en la zona de Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.
El señor Juan David no ha podido estudiar porque la situación económica no se lo permitía, pero siempre es optimista esperando mejorar en un futuro. 

El se dedica a la agricultura, siendo esta su principal actividad, el cliente cuenta que para que le pueda ir bien en su actividad, un factor muy importante es el aprovisionamiento de agua para riego, y normalmente eso depende de que llueva. Pero estos últimos años su producción es pequeña porque no dispone de agua para regar sus plantas. Lo cual generado una preocupación en todos los comunarios.
El tiene el objetivo de cambiar esta situación y quiere incrementar su plantación de alimentos para lo cual necesita asegurar la provisión de agua. 

Es por esta razón ha solicitado un crédito para ser socio de un pozo de agua que le permita regar sus plantas y mejorar su economía. Al ser socio de un pozo de agua, muchos vecinos incluyendo su persona serán accionistas de un pozo común que les permitirá a todos abastecerse de agua de forma segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan David B. C. is 49 and he lives in the Cochabamba department, in an area of the Quillacollo province called Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe.
Even though Juan David’s economic condition did not grant him the opportunity to have an education, he keeps on being optimistic and hopes to improve himself in the future.
He engages in agriculture, which is also his main activity: he says that a key factor to guarantee prosperity to his activity is the supply of irrigation water, that is normally provided by rain. However, during the past two years his production has been low because of the lack of water to irrigate his plants, something that is a major concern for all the members of the community.
He aims to change this situation, and he needs to assure himself of water supply as he wants to increase his food plantation.
The reason why he has asked for a loan is to become a shareholder of a well: this will permit him to irrigate his plants and thus improve his economy. By joining the well, many of his neighbors and he himself will become shareholders of a community well, and this will give them all the chance to provide themselves with water in a safe way.

loans.use: To buy shares of a community well to get water to irrigate his plants.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eva María; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de platería como aretes, pulseras y collares, ella vende en forma independiente en la plaza de armas desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un puesto donde pueda vender la platería. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Eva María, a member of the Banco Comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” (“Lord of Muruhuay” Communal Bank). The communal bank is located in the Cusco department, province and district.

Eva María is 35, livign with her partner and her 3 children. She alternates her daily chores and her retail activity selling silversmith’s craft such as earrings, bracelets and necklaces. She is an independent merchant and she works in the Plaza de Armas form 8 am to 6 pm; she would like to have a place where to sell silversmith’s craft.

She is thankful to those that will help her achieve her dream through this loan, and she commits to comply with the repayments of her dues in the set time.

loans.use: To buy materials to make jewels.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years. Her farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables which are sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the basic needs of her family. Her primary challenges in this business have been diseases and fluctuation in the market price of milk.

She has requested this loan of 46,800KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of her children. She hopes that, in future her milk productivity will increase and she will be able to open an agrovet shop. She is grateful to Juhudi for empowering her economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Larissa  Sandrine

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 25ans universitaire et célibataire sans enfant. Vu ses études qu’elle devait payer après la mort de ses parents, elle débute son acticité dès l’âge de 15ans avec un capital de 25000. Ses revenus journaliers sont de 80000 à 150000frs.

Grâce à ses épargnes qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de payer ses études, elle veut devenir une grande commerçante dans l’avenir  ainsi que finir ses études universitaires et fondé une famille afin d’offrir une bonne éducation à ses enfants. 

Avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant des sacs de charbon.
Dans son quartier elle est beaucoup encourager pour ce qu’elle fait ainsi que pour son courage.
texts.en:
25 year old, single, childless young woman studying at university. As she had to pay for her studies after the death of her parents, she started her business at the age of 15 with a capital of 25,000 francs. Her daily income varies from 80,000 to 150,000 francs.

Thanks to her savings, she can support herself and pay for her studies. In the future, she aims to become a successful businesswoman, finish her university studies, begin a family and offer her children a good education. 

With this loan, she wants to strengthen her business by purchasing bags of charcoal. In her neighborhood, she is greatly encouraged for what she does as well as for her courage.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Clodomiro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Clodomiro; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, el socio quiere mejorar la tienda de abarrotes. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos  como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Clodomiro, a member of the Banco Comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” (“Lord of Muruhuay” Communal Bank). The communal bank is located in the Cusco department, province and district.

Clodomiro is 55 years old, he is married and has 6 children. He runs a grocery shop where he works from 6 am to 7 pm, selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. He would like to improve his shop, and is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

He is thankful to those that will help him achieve his dream through this loan, and he commits to comply with the repayments of his dues in the set time.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Chopotrer Group

texts.es: Doña Gabriela Z. O.,es madre soltera, ha cursado el Cuarto grado primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales   siguen a su cargo, ella se dedica al agropecuario crianza de animales, tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Chipotrer, el grupo cuenta con Seis  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, Artesanía elaboración de playeras Camisas  y blusas,  y crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de animales para la crianza de  estos animales  y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en Asdir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela Z. O. is a single mother.  She finished fourth grade.  She has two children still in her care.  She raises cattle.  She’s been in this line of work for 15 years.

With enthusiasm and the support of a few neighbors they formed a group to request a loan.  The communal bank is called “Chipotrer” and it has six women members who are engaged in a variety of activities among which we can mention: raising animals, crafts, shirt and blouse making, raising domestic animals.

The loan will be used to buy animals to raise thus increasing sales.  One of the difficulties of being the business owner has been the lack of capital but, with help from her children and from the Asdir loan she is asking for, she hopes her business will be bigger and more productive.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years and employs two farmhands. His farm produces maize, beans, milk and tea all of which are sold to the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He is also employed as a teacher in a private school in the same region.

Bryan is 29 years old. He is married with two children ages 4 and 6 who both attend school.

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 KES and has requested this loan of 60,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him increase his asset base by acquiring another dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will enable him pay school fees for his children. His biggest challenges have been lack of enough capital to purchase farm supplies especially during the planting season and the fluctuating weather patterns that affects his production. He plans to expand his farming in future by leasing land and planting more crops.

He comments that Juhudi's loan processing system has improved unlike the past and would like to request it to introduce interest on savings.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elaine; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos para moto que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, ella junto con su esposo tienen este negocio de venta de repuestos de moto y sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para las motos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elaine belongs to the community bank Richhary Anteña, located in the district of Izcuchaca which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Elaine is 35 years of age and married with three children. She alternates her daily tasks with her business selling spare tyres for motorcycles, working from 8am until 7pm so that she and her husband can raise their children. She would like to expand this business and so she is applying for a loan to purchase spare motorcycle tyres.

Elaine is grateful to everyone whose contribution makes her dream a reality and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: Purchase spare motorcycle tyres

loans.name: Berclin

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 35 ans,célibataire et pere d'un enfants dont l'âge est de 12ans ans,il debute son commerce en 1996 quand il perd son travail lors de la faillite de lusine ou il travaillait.En moyenne il vend environ 15000 a 35.000frs par jours

Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente, ses clients sont les entrepreneurs, les fonctionnaires qui sont entrain de construire des maisons.

Avec le prêt qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer en achetant des mélanger lavabo et beignoir, des colle gebajoint,des robinets, des floteurs bache à eau,des fusible.

A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise au Cameroun, Nigeria et Dubai 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
This young 35 year old is unmarried and has a 12-year-old kid. He started his business in 1996 when the factory he worked at went under. He makes, on average, 15,000 to 35,000 francs in sales per day.
To alleviate his situation and to support his family, he started a hardware business. He has various sales strategies, and his customers include entrepreneurs and civil servants who are building houses.
With this loan, he will stock up on a mix of sink and bathtub parts, some Gebajoint glue, faucets, float valves and fuses.
In the future, he is thinking of going wholesale. With his savings, he plans on opening a big store, and going and getting his merchandise in Cameroun, Nigeria and Dubai. A serious man, he also plans to send his kid to a good school.

loans.use: Purchase of faucets, glue, float valves and fuses

loans.name: Rosini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Rosini; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller mecánico para carros  y tractores que queda ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca que atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para los carros y tractores.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosini belongs to the community bank 'Ricchary Anteña', located in the district of Izcuchaca, part of the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Rosini is 40 years of age and lives with her partner and three children. She alternates her daily tasks with her work in a mechanic workshop for cars and tractors in Izcuchaca, working there from 7am until 8pm. As she would like to expand her business, she is applying for a loan to purchase spare tyres for the cars and tractors.

Rosini is grateful to everyone who contributes to her dream through Kiva and she promises to repay her installments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of spare tyres for cars and tractors

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya where he has been farming for the last 10 years. His farm produces maize, beans, bananas, milk and tea which he sells to the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also owns and operates two posho mills (used for grinding maize into flour-as pictured )in the same location.

Douglas is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children who are aged between 7 and 17. All the children attends school.

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 KES which was used to purchase a posho mill. He has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow and a posho mill. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children. His major challenges have been dishonest employees and the fluctuating weather patterns that affect his crop production. In future, he plans to have at least 3 posho mills strategically placed in his local market.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and a posho mill.

loans.name: Olgamaria

texts.es:
La  Sra. María de 44 años de edad, casada,  se dedica  a la artesanía de ao po’i realiza, camisas, blusas, manteles, individuales, y otros, todos realizados en forma artesanal con bordados y encajes.
 Desde muy joven realiza esta actividad aprendió de su madre y es un trabajo que practica mucha gente en la comunidad. 
 Solicita dicho préstamo para la compra de telas, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de manteles.
 Uno de sus mayores anhelos es llegar a ser una artesana reconocida de la zona y contar con un local comercial. Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada de acceder a un préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years of age and married. She works with the artesanal fabric of ao po’i, a fine cotton cloth that she uses to make shirts, blouses, tablecloths, placemats and other items, all of which are handcrafted with embroidery and lace.

Maria has been involved in this craft from a young age, having learnt from her mother, and now works with many people in her community making garments. She will use this loan to purchase more fabric as she has many orders for tablecloths.

One of her greatest desires is to become a recognised artist in her area and set up her own store. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity which she has received with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase of artesanal ao po´i fabric

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marivel; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos como quinua, lenteja, maíz y tallarines, ella los lleva a lugares como Anta y Quillabamba y los vende, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos secos en algunas oportunidades vende también verduras y papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marivel belongs to the community bank 'Ricchary Anteña', which is located in the district of Izcuchaca, part of the province of Anta and the department of Cusco. 

Marivel is 36 years of age and is a single mother to two children. She alternates her daily tasks with her work selling dried products such as quinoa, lentils, corn and pasta. She takes these products to places including Anta and Quillabamba and sells them there. In the future, Marivel would like to have a store where she could sell her dried products. At times she also sells vegetables and potatoes, but this loan will be used to purchase dried products in bulk.

Marivel is grateful to everyone who contributes to her dream through Kiva and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: Purchase dried products in bulk

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces tea, maize, bananas and beans, all of which are sold locally. He also earns income from his matatu (minibus) business, posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into maize flour) and a pension. Johnstone is 59 years old and married with 6 children who are all adults.

He has requested this loan of 80,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a van for transporting farm products to the market. This loan will enable him to reduce the costs of transporting his products to the market. He, however, faces the challenges of diseases which affects his dairy business and dishonest employees. In future, he aspires to expand his dairy farming and transport business and if possible purchase a truck for transport.

He is requesting that Juhudi introduce interest on savings and, if possible, to look for means of coming up with seminars for members.

loans.use: Purchase a van for transporting farm products to the market.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es: El señor Lazaro soltero agricultor de 44 años de edad nacido el 11 de febrero en Valle grande hoy tiene su casa en la localidad de Puerto Rico y trabaja en San Pedro distante a 5 Km de la carretera. Cuando no es época de siembra el se dedica a la albañilería para el sustento de su vida cotidiana y pagar su crédito, en esta ocasión necesita el  crédito para la contratación de mano de obra para el preparado de la tierra y también para la compra de semillas, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable, tiene todavía la esperanza de formar una familia y tener hijos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Lazaro is 44 years of age, single and works as a farmer. He was born on the 11th of February in Vallegrande. He has a house in the town of Puerto Rico and works in San Pedro, 5km from the highway. When it is not sowing season, Lazaro works as a bricklayer to cover the costs of his daily life and to repay his loans. On this occasion he needs a loan to purchase seeds and also to hire labourers to help him prepare the land. 

Lazaro is a hardworking and responsible person who still holds the hope of creating a family and having children. He is very grateful to Emprender for the support they offer him and the loan he has been granted.

loans.use: To burn off land and plant corn and rice

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de restaurant que queda ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca provincia de Anta, ella atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas para el restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “RICCHARY ANTEÑA” cooperative bank.  The bank is located in the Izcuchaca district, which belongs to the Anta province of the Cusco department.
