She is Mrs. Maruja, a 39-year-old single mother with 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities in her restaurant, located in the Izcuchaca province of Anta.  She tends to the business from 9 am until 7 pm.  Through this enterprise, she helps her children get ahead.

The member would like to improve her restaurant, and requests a loan in order to buy tables for her business.  She thanks everyone who takes part in this dream of hers via this medium, and commits to making her payments in the time allotted.

loans.use: To purchase tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
El señor Juan David R. tiene 40 años, vive en la zona de Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor R. es una persona sencilla y humilde, no ha podido estudiar porque la situación económica no se lo permitía, es soltero pero espera formar una familia en un futuro cercano. 
El se dedica a la agricultura, produce alimentos, como maíz, cebolla y zanahoria, en pequeña cantidad porque no tiene suficiente agua para sembrar mas plantas. Además que en estos últimos años no ha llovido mucho y necesita disponer de agua en forma segura, para que no se sequen sus plantas.
 
Tiene el objetivo de cambiar esta situación y en un futuro cercano  asegurar la provisión de agua. 
Es por esta razón que ha solicitado un crédito para ser socio de un pozo de agua que le permita regar sus plantas y mejorar su economía, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan David R. is 40 years old, and lives in the Mallco Rancho zone – Sipe Sipe, province Quillacollo in the Cochabamba department.

Mr. R. is a simple and humble person who was not able to get an education because the financial situation would not allow it.  He dedicates himself to agricultural activities, and produces food such as corn, onions and carrots in small quantities because he doesn’t have enough water to establish more crops.  In addition, in the past few years, it has not rained much and he has to be cautious with his water use so his plants do not dry out.

His objective is to change this situation, and in the near future assure his access to a water source.  This is the reason why he is requesting a loan, so he can become a member of a well that would allow him to water his crops.  This, in turn, would improve his financial situation and, therefore, his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase access to a well to water his crops.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya, which produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables. She has been farming for the last twelve years and employs one farmhand. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater to the needs of her family.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. The extra income from this loan will help her improve the livelihood of her family.

Margaret is 34 years old. She is married with 8 school-aged children. Her major challenges in farming have been poultry diseases and low market prices for her products. She hopes that in five years time she will have expanded her farm in terms of the number of chickens she will be owning.

Margaret has been pictured with one of her cows since it was not possible to get a picture of her at her poultry farm.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosalbina; ella tiene 54  años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artículos de librería, ella reparte libros, cuadernos y útiles de escritorio a las diferentes librerías en forma independiente, la socia quiere tener una librería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices y todo lo que es útiles de escritorio.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “RICCHARY ANTEÑA” cooperative bank.  The bank is located in the Izcuchaca district, which belongs to the Anta province in the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Rosalbina; she is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She carries out various daily activities related to her business selling bookstore items.  She sells books, notebooks, and writing utensils independently to the various bookstores.  She would like to have her own bookstore.  The member is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as books, notebooks, pens, pencils, and all types of writing utensils.

The member thanks all those who take part in this dream of hers via this medium, and commits to making her installment payments in the time allotted.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as books, notebooks, pens, pencils, and all types of writing utensils.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years. Her mixed farm produces maize and vegetables which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her business of selling clothes to the local market. Her major challenge in farming has been unpredictable weather conditions and lack of a solid market for her products.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her improve the livelihood of her family. She hopes that in future she will be a major breeder and supplier of dairy and poultry products to a wider market.

Hellen is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children ages 3, 16 and 17. Two of the children are currently attending school. She hopes that Juhudi will diversify its products to other ventures like school-fees loans and general business loans.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta pan y también trabaja en la municipalidad de Anta, ahora que se acerca una fiesta de     la socia vende coronas y también vende pan llamado pan wuawua (es un acostumbre), la socia quiere tener un puesto para poder vender los panes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, manteca y mantequilla para preparar el pan.


 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the Ricchary Anteña community bank. The bank is located in the Izcuchaca district in the province of Anta in Cuzco.

Mrs. Gladys is the group member. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children. She has two jobs. She works selling bread and also works in the Anta area. Since a holiday is approaching she sells coronas and wuawua bread (a traditional bread). She wants to have her own stall for selling breads. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, lard, and butter to prepare bread.

She is thankful for those who are part of making her dream come true through a loan and promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: Flour, lard, and butter for making bread

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos M. B. tiene 47 años, vive en la zona de Mallco Rancho, provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.
Esta casado y tiene 4 hijos es una persona sencilla y trabajadora, se dedica a la agricultura y cría de chanchos. 
Por factores económicos solo ha logrado terminar el nivel básico y quiere a través de su trabajo dar mejores oportunidades a sus 4 hijos, haciendo que estudien por lo menos hasta salir bachilleres.
 
Pero por falta de agua para cubrir sus necesidades en la agricultura, el Sr. M. ve que año que pasa va disminuyendo su producción de alfa alfa y maíz los cuales son vitales como alimentos para la crianza de sus animales. Es por esta razón es que ha solicitado un crédito para poder ser socio de un pozo de agua que le permita regar sus plantas, tener una producción estable en los próximos años y así poder alimentar a sus animales en forma adecuada, venderlos con facilidad y mejorar su situación económica, y otorgarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida, y poder cumplir con sus deseos de que sus hijos estudien y logren alcanzar el bachillerato.
texts.en:
Carlos M. B. is 47 and lives in the Mallco Rancho area in the province of Quillacollo in the Cochabamba department. He is a simple hardworking person with 4 children who makes a living through agriculture and raising pigs. Due to economic factors he has only a grade school education but through hard work hopes to see his children have greater opportunities and at least finish high-school. 

Due to a lack of water Mr. M. has seen a drop in his production of alfalfa and corn which are vital to raising his animals. For this reason he has requested a loan to become a partner in a well that would allow him to irrigate his crops. This would allow him to have a more stable crop in the coming years and so feed his animals well and sell them more easily. This in turn would improve his economic situation and give his children an improved lifestyle and so fulfill his wish that his children study and finish high school.

loans.use: Purchase stock in a well to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: Doña Crecencia Margarita H. O., es casada, es  una persona analfabeta, tiene 6 hijos los cuales, 2 están casados y el resto  están a su cargo, ella se dedica a la Artesanía (bordado  de blusas ) tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina San Antonio, El grupo cuenta con 4  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar,   Agropecuario  crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de materia prima  para su negocio  y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en Asdir.
texts.en: Doña Crecencia Margarita H. O. is married and is illiterate.  She has 6 children, 2 are married and the rest are still dependent upon her.  She has worked in the handicrafts business (embroidering blouses) for 15 years.  With a lot of enthusiasm and the help of some neighbor ladies, a group was formed to ask for a loan.  It is called the Grupo Solidario (Solidarity Group) and there are four women who are members.  They work in varying businesses including fishing and raising domestic animals.  She will use the loan to buy supplies for her business and increase her sales volume.  One of the challenges of being a business owner is the lack of capital, but she has overcome this difficulty with the help of her children and she wishes her business to be bigger and more productive with the help of the loan she is asking for from Asdir.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es: Leyla tiene 45 años ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta muy contenta de su actividad que es una pulpería. Su hijo le ayuda con la atención a los clientes, ella ha tenido cierta experiencia con créditos pues ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente, pues siempre se preocupa por abonar en tiempo y forma. Tiene muy buena demanda por sus clientes que siempre le solicitan productos básicos para su hogar. Este crédito es para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, pan entre otros.
texts.en: Leyla is 45 years old and she is a very enterprising woman who very much enjoys managing her grocery business. Her son helps with the customer services. She has had some experience with past loans and she had demonstrated herself to be an excellent client, always making sure to be on time with her payments. Her store sees a good demand from her clients, purchasing basic products for the home. This loan will be used to purchase basic cereal grains, soft drinks, and juices among other merchandise.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Shirley Magda

texts.es: La Sra. Magda vive en la Urbanización el Toborochi lugar en la cual viven hace muchos años, la Sra.se dedica a la venta de pollo al spiedo en su mismo domicilio con la ayuda de su hija que tiene 24 años y esta en la universidad, además sus ventas son darías, la Sra. por la mañana se va al mercado a realizar sus compras para la preparación del pollo en la tarde además ella genera trabajo a una muchacha de 16 años a quien le paga de forma mensual por su ayuda en el negocio, lo que hay que rescatar de este negocio es que es el único mas cercano en los alrededores y la Sra. Magda ya es conocida y muy querida en el lugar, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Magda Necesita comprar insumos para la preparación de sus riquísimos pollos y también refrescos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Magda lives in the Toborochi colony and she has lived there for many years. She sells roasted chicken from her home with her daughter’s help. Her daughter is 24 years old and she is in university. In advance of her daily sales, she goes to the market in the mornings to make the purchases necessary to prepare the chicken for sale in the afternoons. She also employs a 16 year old young woman for help in the business. She is paid on a monthly basis. Her business is the only one of its type in the neighborhood. Magda is well known and much loved in her community. Magda will purchase soft drinks and ingredients to prepare her delicious chicken with the funds from this loan. She is very grateful to the organization for the support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make roast chicken.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Teofila; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta y compra de carne de vaca y cordero, ella vende en el mercado de Izcuchaca desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados y corderos al por mayor.


 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the community bank named "Ricchary Antena". The community bank is located in the district of Izcuchaca of the province of Anta in Cusco. 

Teofila is 39 years old and she is a single mother of 3 children. Her business is the buying and selling of beef and pork meats. She sells in the market of Izcuchaca from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is able to support her children through this business and she wishes to expand it. She requests a loan to purchase livestock in wholesale. 

She is grateful to all of those who will contribute towards her dream and she is committed to the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase livestock in wholesale.

loans.name: Erusmus

texts.en:
Erusmus is 63 years old, married and blessed with six adult-aged children. One of his children is currently attending school. He is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been farming for the last 30 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk, coffee, french beans and bananas, which are all sold locally. He also depends on his pension pay to provide for his family's basic needs.
Erusmus has requested a loan of 63,600 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this dairy cow will improve his family's income through the sale of milk and this will improve their livelihood. His biggest challenge has been the lack of a sustainable market and fluctuating milk prices. He hopes to improve his dairy farming by buying three quality dairy cows in future.
Erusmus comments that through Juhudi's projects, the farmers will be able to grow their businesses. With this trend, the creation of wealth will be a possibility and not a faraway dream.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Aurora Group

texts.es: Don  Hilario G. Ordóñez, es casado, es  una persona que ha cursado el sexto grado, tiene 5  hijos los cuales, todos estan a su cargo el  se dedica a la Artesanía elaboración de artículos de madera  tiene 18 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina AURORA, El grupo cuenta con Cuatro integrantes  mujeres y un hombre, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar,   Agropecuario  crianza de animales domésticos,   El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de material de su trabajo  para su negocio  y así incrementar  el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser el dueño de su negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicitar.
texts.en: Mr. Hilario G. Ordonez is married. He has a grade six education and he has 5 children who are still in his care. He has been an artisan for the past 18 years, making wood crafts as a business. With enthusiastic energy he and some of his neighbors have organized a group to request a loan. The group is named Aurora. There are four members in the group, three women and one man and they all have various businesses including farming and agriculture. The loan will be used to purchase materials for the business to improve the sales volumes. One of the challenges has been a deficit in capital funds. But he has pulled through with the help of his children and he hopes that his business will grow and become more productive, with the help of the loan he has requested.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maricela; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta y compra de carne de res y cordero, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de Anta donde vende las diferentes carnes desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne de vaca y cordero al por mayor.


 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maricela is a member of the community bank named "Ricchary Antena". It is located in the district of Izcuchaca in the province of Anta in Cusco. 

Maricela is 44 years old, she is married, and she has 4 children. Her business is the buying and selling of beef and pork meat. She has a small stand in the market in Anta from where she sells various types of meats from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is able to support her children through this business. She wants to expand her business and to this end she requests a loan. She will purchase beef and lamb meats. 

She is grateful to all of those who will contribute towards her dream and she is committed to the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase beef and lamb meats in wholesale.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR DE HUANCA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Libia;   ella tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia es natural de Calca y se dedica a la atención permanente de su pequeña tienda abarrotes; La socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella compra mercadería para abastecer su negocio y continuar con la venta de los diferentes productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, harina,  leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería e implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Libia belongs to the “Señor de Huanca” (Lord of Huanca) communal bank, located in the Calca district, Calca province, department of Cusco.

Libia is married, 56 years old, and is a widow with 3 daughters. She is a native of Calca and  is permanently dedicated to her little grocery store. She has to buy merchandise to resupply her business and continue selling different products, such as, for example, rice, sugar, beans, wheat flour, and milk. Libia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and expand her grocery store.

Libia appreciates and values the loan made available by this means and, at the same time, she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE AND EXPAND HER GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Elena Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena Emperatriz; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene terreno de cultivo donde cultiva papa y maíz y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias y también tiene cría vacas, la socia quiere mejoras las tierras de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para las tierras de cultivo.


 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elena Emperatriz belongs to the Ricchary Anteña Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Izcuchaca district, which belongs to the Anta province, Cusco department.

Elena is a 70 year old single mother, and she has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and farming.  She has land where she grows potatoes and corn.  She later sells her crops at different fairs.  She also raises cows.  

Elena wants to improve her fields.  She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm land.

She is grateful to those who are making this dream possible, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm land

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hija, que es mayor de edad; juntas se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 10 años, instaló en su casa una tienda de comestibles donde ofrece variados productos de primera necesidad. Se despierta todos los días muy temprano y empieza a trabajar a las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche. Le gusta mucho atender su negocio porque lo realiza en la tranquilidad de su casa, además cuenta con la ayuda de su hija. Su tienda es la más surtida de la zona por donde vive, lo que le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten mantener su hogar sin que le falte nada. Esta muy satisfecha, pues poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante, todavía recuerda, cuando empezó con solo algunos comestibles; hoy hasta vende gas por galones a sus vecinos. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene pensado  ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, además de surtirla de mayor variedad de productos. Es el tercer  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere defraudar a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una vitrina y una congeladora que necesita para implementar mejor su negocio, así espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María, age 41, lives in her own house with her adult daughter.  They put forth great effort every day in order to get ahead.  Ten years ago they established a food store in their house.  They sell various basic needs products.

She gets up very early every day, and she starts work at six in the morning.  She works until eleven at night.  She likes tending to the business because she can do it from the tranquility of her house.  Also, she has her daughter’s help.  Her store is the best stocked store in the area where she lives.  It generates regular income, which allows her to support her household with everything they need.

She is very pleased because, little by little, she has managed to get ahead.  She still remembers when she started with only some groceries.  Now she even sells gas by the gallon to her neighbors.  As an enterprising woman, she plans to expand her store’s facilities in the future.  She also plans to stock it with a greater variety of products.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who make this loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working in the pursuit of progress.

María will use the requested loan to buy a display case and a freezer that she needs in order to improve her business.  This is the way she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a display case and freezer for her business

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR DE HUANCA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Paulo;   él tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo,  El socio es natural de Calca,  Él socio trabajaba como obrero en la carretera interoceánica, terminando de ejecutar el tramo Cusco Puerto Maldonado ruta a Brasil; El socio ahora con lo que ahorro compro sus primeras 4 motos para la venta el ahora solicita el préstamo para comprar pintura y aceites para mantener las motos y venderlas, de este modo el socio se dedicara a este negocio de manera permanente. Él socio solicita el préstamo para comprar aceites y otros para el mantenimiento de las motos para la venta.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Paulo belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank.  This communal bank is located in the Calca district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Paulo, age 33, is married and has one child.  Paulo is a native of Calca.  He worked as a laborer on the inter-oceanic highway, finishing the section of the Cusco Puerto Madonado route to Brazil.

Now, with his savings, he has purchased his first four motorcycles to sell.  He is requesting the loan to buy paint and oil to service the motorcycles and sell them.  This way he will work in this business in a steadfast way.  Paulo is requesting the loan to buy oil and other things for maintenance on the motorcycles in order to sell them.

He is grateful to those who are making this dream possible, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy paint and oil to service motorcycles and sell them

loans.name: Bernaldina

texts.es: La señora Bernaldina  ingreso a la institución el año 2008 como crédito individual, vino por recomendación de sus parientes que ya estaban en la institución, se dedica a la venta de condimentos en la localidad de Caranavi, comenzó con esta actividad como siete años en tiempo de fruta se dedica a la producción  y venta de frutas puesto que ella tiene huerta en su pueblo de Sapahaqui. Ella vive en la casa de sus suegros ubicado en la zona la Portada su esposo tiene la actividad de transporte y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar y con la educación de sus tres hijos. Ella indica que quiere comprar una casa para su familia y así de alguna manera independizarse de sus suegros. El crédito lo destinara para compra de condimentos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Bernaldina joined the organization in 2008 with an individual loan on the recommendation of her family members who were already part of the organization. For the past seven years she has made a living selling seasonings in Caranavi. During fruit season she sell these as well since she has an orchard in her home town of Sapahaqui. She lives with her in-laws in the Portada region. Her husband works in transportation and helps with household expenses and their children's education. 

She says that she would like to buy a home for her family and be independent from her in-laws. The loan will be used to buy seasonings. She is very thankful to the organization for the support she has received.

loans.use: Purchase seasonings like cinnamon and garlic

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Giovanni de 48 años y de su hija que es mayor de edad, además es independiente;  juntos se esfuerzan cada día por continuar adelante en busca del progreso. Cada día se despierta con mucho ánimo, pues no piensa dejar de trabajar hasta que termine de concretar los proyectos que tiene en mente. Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la preparación de menús (comidas diarias) para los trabajadores de una empresa  de la zona donde vive; además prepara buffets cuando le piden para diferentes eventos sociales. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues lo puede realizar desde la comodidad de su casa y esta muy contenta porque su hija le ayuda  durante sus ratos libres. Es así que el fin de semana vende diversos platillos y postres en una feria que se instala cerca de su casa, en ese lugar vende junto a otras damas trabajadoras como ella. Gracias al negocio que tiene, recibe regulares ganancias, con eso ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un restaurante, donde pueda ofrecer comida en un lugar fijo y cómodo. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una olla arrocera, además de implementos nuevos de cocina que necesita para continuar cocinando sin problemas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
50-year-old Lina lives in her own house along with her 48-year-old husband, Giovanni, and their grown daughter.  Together they strive to move forward every day, looking for progress.  Lina wakes up every morning with a lot of energy.  She doesn’t think about stopping work until she’s made all the projects in her head a reality.

For the past six years, Lina has prepared daily meals for the workers at a business in the area where she lives.  Additionally, she prepares buffets for different social events when asked.  She really likes her work, especially since she can do it from the comfort of her own home.  Her daughter can help during her free time, which makes Lina very happy.  During the weekends, Lina sells various small plates and pastries in a market near her house.  There she sells alongside other hard-working women like herself.

Thanks to her business, Lina makes a regular income, which she uses to help her husband with household costs.  Being an entrepreneurial woman, she plans to open a restaurant in the future, so she can serve food in a place that’s established and comfortable.

This is Lina’s first loan with MFP, and she promises to complete her quotas punctually because she doesn’t want to look bad to the people who are providing her with the money that allows her to continue working in the search of progress.  Lina plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a rice cooker as well as other new kitchen tools she needs to continue cooking problem-free, which she hopes will help her increase her earnings.

loans.use: Buying a rice cooker and other kitchen supplies

loans.name: Carla Lilian

texts.es: La señora Carla es cliente antigua la actividad a la que se dedica es la comercialización de prendas de vestir, específicamente la de compra y venta de pantalones poleras y chamarras las mismas que las adquiere de la ciudad de Santa Cruz y las distribuye en varias zonas de la ciudad de la Paz, entrega su mercadería a crédito. Ella vive con sus dos hijas las cuales se encuentran en etapa de estudio.  El destino del crédito es el incremento de mercadería por mayor la cual en época de navidad sube de precio, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carla is an old client of Emprender.  She buys and sells clothes, specifically pants, shirts, and jackets.  She buys the clothes in Santa Cruz and distributes them in various zones in La Paz, making money off the merchandise.  She lives with her two daughters, who are in school.

She will use this loan to grow her inventory since the prices raise during the Christmas season.  Carla is a young hard-working woman.  She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support they’ve given her.

loans.use: Buying clothes to sell

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
La señora Ema  vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la zona de Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz; esta casada y  la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de cereales en un taller que instalo en su casa; el esposo trabaja como empleado en una fabrica donde percibe un salario mínimo.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos (quinua, soya, etc.) y seguir elaborando los cereales ya que esta actividad es la que le genera mas ingresos.

Es  cliente de Impro desde el año 2006 con un historial de pagos  bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ema lives in her own house along with her husband and sons in the Gran Poder zone of La Paz.  She works making cereals in a workshop she built in her home.  Her husband works in a factory where he receives minimum wage.

The loan Ema is requesting is to buy raw materials (quinoa, soy, etc.) and continue making cereals, since it’s how she generates the most income.

Ema has been a client of Impro since 2006 and has a good history payment, which is why she can request another loan.

loans.use: Compra de insumos como quinua y soya para la producción de cereales.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: Doña Ana P. D. treinta y dos años D. edad, curso el sexto grado D. primaria, tiene 5 hijos D. diferentes edades el mayor D. 14 y la mas pequeña D. 2 años, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y ella se dedica a la Crianza D. Animales y venta D. Helados en la escuela D. la aldea ya que cuenta con 5 años D. experiencia con estas actividades, y D. esta forma obtiene ganancias para poder colaborar con los gastos D. su familia. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. unas vecinas  y compañeras D. un programa D. agricultura organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina AMISTAD, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 19 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza D. animales, venta D. Helados, Consumo Diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. Cerdos, y D. esa forma incrementar su Producción y así generar más ingresos. Ya que el sueño D. ella es que su producción crezca, pero por falta D. capital, no ha podido, y considera que con este crédito crecerá su producción y generara mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y sobre todo familiar.
texts.en:
Ana P. is 32 years old and has a sixth graD. education.  She has five children ranging in ages from 14 to 2.  Her husband works as a mason and she raises livestock and also ice cream treats in the village school.  She’s been doing this for five years and this provides her an income so that she can contribute to the household expenses.

With her enthusiasm, desire to get ahead, and the help of some of her neighbors and friends from an agricultural program, they formed a group so that they could apply for this loan.  The name of their communal bank is “AMISTAD” (Friendship), and they decided on this name together.  It is maD. up of 19 ladies who are involved in various business activities; among them are livestock, frozen treat sales, daily consumables, and clothing.

She will use the money from this loan to buy hogs so that she can increase her production and income.  Her dream is to increase her production, but has not had the money to invest.  This loan will allow her the opportunity to grow her business and her income, and help with her personal development and, most importantly, that of her family.

loans.use: Hogs

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe S. D. A. tiene 46 años, vive en la zona D. Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento D. Cochabamba.
La señora S. es una persona trabajadora, que ha sufrido la pérdida D. su esposo en un accidente y tiene 3 hijos que cuidar. 
Al estar viuda, ella se dedica a la agricultura, cría vacas y chanchos en poca cantidad para mantener su familia.  

Al ser la agricultura su principal actividad económica, la Sra. S. ha visto la necesidad D. tener más agua porque este elemento vital ha ido disminuyendo en los últimos años.
Esto le ha perjudicado bastante y sus ingresos han disminuido, teniendo problemas para alimentar, educar y vestir a sus 3 hijos. 
Es por esta razón es que ha solicitado un crédito para poder ser socia D. un pozo D. agua que le permita regar sus plantas incrementando su producción cada seis meses y haciendo que tenga mayores ingresos para alimentar, educar y vestir a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe S. D. A. is 46 years old and lives in the Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe zone of the Quillacollo province in the Cochabamba department.

Mrs. S. is a hard working woman who lost her husband to an accident and who has three children to care for.  As a widow, she raises cattle and hogs in small numbers to support her family.

Because agriculture is her primary economic activity, Mrs. S. needs to have more water because it is a vital resource that has diminished in recent years.  This has affected her income substantially and she has had problems educating and dressing her three children.

For these reasons she has requested a loan so that she can join a community well that will allow her to water her crops, thereby increasing her production and income every six months.  This will help feed, educate, and dress her family.

loans.use: Join a community well

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
El señor Edson vive en casa de su padre en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero, no tiene hijos y trabaja como empleado en diseño grafico en una imprenta.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina de impresión ya que como es diseñador grafico quiere independizarse y poder generar mayores ingresos. 

Es  cliente de Impro desde el año 2009 con un historial de pago bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Edson lives in his father’s house in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz.  He is single with no children and works in graphic designer at a printer’s.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a printer so he can become an independent graphic designer, which will allow him to make more money.

He has been a client since 2009 and has a good payment history, which is why he can request a new loan.

loans.use: Buying a printer to begin his graphic design business.

loans.name: Maria Calixta

texts.es: María Calixta tiene 53 años, pues esta no es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento para su negocio. Ella es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por mantener a su familia además de esto ha pasado grandes desafíos como es la competencia pero ella ofrece buena calidad de productos y además sus clientes están acostumbrados al buen servicio que ofrece. Se dedica a la venta de tortillas, frijoles y leña.  Por lo que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio ya que así obtendrá nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
María Calixta is 53 years old. This is not the first time that she has had a loan for her business.

She is a woman who has always fought to support her family. In addition, she has faced great challenges, such as competition, but she offers good quality products, and her customers are accustomed to the good service she provides.

She is engaged in the sale of tortillas, beans, and firewood. She is applying for this loan in order to purchase raw materials for her business since this will allow her to obtain new customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, D. 51 años, vive en su casa propia a lado D. su esposo Luis D. 53 años y D. su última hija, pues los 2 mayores son independientes. Para esta empeñosa mujer no hay nada imposible, es por esta razón que logró sacar adelante a sus hijos y construyó su amplia casa D. material noble. En la actualidad alquila habitaciones y departamentos, por lo que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Siempre esta en la búsqueda D. nuevos negocios y comercializa ropa, zapatos, carteras y todo tipo D. accesorios para dama. Ella misma se considera una “mil oficios” pues manifiesta que en esta vida el que se queda no progresa, y por eso no deja D. laborar en lo que se le presente, pues desD. muy joven fue emprendedora. Para el futuro ya tiene planeado instalar una tienda D. venta D. ropa y calzado en algún centro comercial D. su zona y calcula que obtendrá generosas ganancias. Es el 14 avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. cantidad D. mercadería en ropa para dama que necesita pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir y espera aumentar sus rentas.
texts.en:
Juana, age 51, lives in her own house along with her husband Luis, age 53, and their youngest daughter. Their two oldest children live independently.

Nothing is impossible for this tenacious woman. This is the reason that she succeeded in helping her children get ahead and in building her own solidly constructed house.

Currently, she rents out rooms and apartments, through which she obtains regular earnings that allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. She is always on the lookout for new businesses and sells women’s clothing, shoes, purses, and all types of accessories. She considers herself as having “1000 skills” since she declares that in this life she who stands still does not progress. That’s why she doesn’t turn down any work that presents itself to her. She has been enterprising since she was very young.

For the future, she already has plans to open a clothing and shoe shop in a commercial center in her area and estimates she will obtain generous profits. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her installments on time since she doesn’t want to disappoint the people who have maD. possible the investment which will permit her to continue working on progressing. Juana has plans to invest the loan in the purchase of an inventory of women’s clothing that she needs since she has several pending orders to fill and hopes to increase her profits.

loans.use: To acquire more clothing in order to fill pending orders.

loans.name: Grisel

texts.es:
Grisel vive en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es soltera-estudiante, y solo recibe ayuda de sus padres para poder cancelar sus estudios, 
El crédito será destinado para el pago de estudios, pago de pensiones y elaboración de tesis para licenciatura, en la carrera de Derecho de la Universidad Católica Boliviana.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. 
Con este crédito podrá terminar sus estudios y comenzar a trabajar.
texts.en:
Grisel lives in La Paz’s Irpavi neighborhood.  She is single and a student.  The only support she gets from her parents is tuition costs.

The loan will be used to cover educational expenses: meals and thesis writing costs for graduation in Law at the Boliviana Catholic University.

This is her first loan request to Impro.

This loan will make it possible for her to complete her studies and start to work.

loans.use: To pay for meals and thesis writing costs at the Catholic University of La Paz

loans.name: Nancy Sagrario

texts.es: Nancy Sagrario hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a una venta de mercadería en general, tiene 1 hijo menores de edad a su cargo, sus clientes llegan a buscarla a su vivienda en donde tiene una buena parte de mercadería, ella también sale a vender todos los días  temprano,  ella es muy humorista y reconocida por su gran carisma que ofrecer. Para Nancy el tener un negocio le ha representado el fortalecimiento de su independencia para su hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de faldas, vestidos, trajes, camisetas, pantalones y shorts entre otras.
texts.en:
Nancy Sagrario has sold general merchandise for over 5 years.  She has a minor son in her care.  

Her customers come by her home where she keeps a good part of her merchandise.  She also goes out to sell every day starting very early. She is quite humorous and known for her great charisma.  For Nancy, having her own business has meant strengthening her household’s independence.

The loan will be used to buy skirts, dresses, suits, t-shirts, pants and shorts, among others.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su hijo Ehisnover de 12 años y de sus padres; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Todos los días se despierta muy temprano para atender a su hijo y después se dirige al centro educativo donde se desempeña como profesora. Le gusta mucho enseñar y educar a sus alumnos y aunque a veces se siente cansada continua trabajando ya que tiene muchos planes futuros. Para esta trabajadora mujer nunca es tarde en la vida pues antes se dedicaba a la venta de comida en la puerta de su casa; luego estudio educación en un instituto y hace 1 año se convirtió en profesora. También realiza material educativo en material corospun (microporoso parecido al plástico) y es una experta preparando figuras de personajes animados que cobran vida con el trazo de la mano de victoria. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una librería en su casa, pues por la zona donde vive no hay una que abastezca a los niños de material educativo. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar laborando en busca del progreso. Victoria tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de corospun, que es el material que necesita para continuar produciendo sus diseños educativos, también desea comprar algunos libros para actualizarse.
texts.en:
Victoria, 41, lives in her own house with her son, Ehisnover, 12, and her parents.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead in life.

Every day she rises very early in the morning to care for her son and then head for the school where she’s a teacher.  She enjoys teaching very much and, even though she often feels quite tiered, she continues working because she has many plans for the future.

For this very hard working woman it’s never too late in life.  She used to work selling food from her doorstep.  Later, she studied Education at an institute and a year ago became a teacher.  She also makes teaching aids from Corrospum (a micro porous material similar to plastic) and she’s expert in making figures of cartoon characters that come to life thanks to Victoria’s skills.

Because she’s an enterprising woman she plans to set up a bookstore in her home in the future because there is no place in her neighborhood supplying educational materials to the children.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who made the money that will allow her to continue working toward progress possible.

Victoria plans to use the money to buy Corrospum which is the material she needs to continue making her teaching aids.  She also wants to buy a few texts to upgrade her skills.

loans.use: To buy Corrospum (a micro porous material similar to plastic) to make educational items as well as to buy books to upgrade her skills.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: El Sr. Mariano S. era investigador de la policia y debido a un accidente que le fractura la espalda en cumplimiento de su deber ya no pudo laborar ahí, recibe pension, en este momento a el le dieron la oportunidad de ser guardia de seguridad o vigilante en una escuela en la que frecuentemente era visistada por los ladrones, el ahora vive dentro de la escuela le acondicionaron unos salones, a base de sacrificios y tocando puertas le ha estado dando estudio a su hija, para eso solicito el credito. ya que el y su esposa la señora Maria, quieren lo mejor para su hija que esta estudiando la universisas.necesitan pagar la colegiatura para el mejor futuro de ella.
texts.en: Mariano was a police inspector but, due to an accident in the line of duty that broke his back, he can no longer do that job. He was recently given the opportunity to work as a security guard or watchman in a school that was often visited by thieves. He now lives in some rooms at the school. Thanks to sacrifices that he made and lots of knocking on doors, he has been able to send his daughter to school, and this is what he wants a loan for. He and his wife, María, want the best for their daughter who is studying at the university. They need to pay tuition so that she will have a better future.

loans.use: To pay for university for his daughter

loans.name: Essineta Jose

texts.pt:
Essineta José S. nasceu na província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique é viúva mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 trabalham, um como professor e outra como enfermeira. Fez a 4ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria com a sua filha que freqüenta a 12ª classe.

Saiu de Gaza quando seu marido é transferido para Trabalhar no Distrito de Namaacha, anos depois seu marido perde a vida deixando - a com 3 filhos. A vida fica difícil pois ela não trabalhava e passa a vender pasteis clandestinamente para custear as despesas escolares dos filhos. Anos depois é chamada no Banco Comercial de Investimento (BCI) para tratar documentos e passar a receber uma pensão no valor de 8.000.00mt do seu falecido marido para assistência dos filhos. Assim consegue construir uma casa do tipo1, e agora a grande preocupação era ampliar a sua casa. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, num encontro de grupos de mulher de poupança (chitique) soube da existência da Hluvuku. Este é o 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tijoleiras, cimento cola, pagamento de mão de obra e outros). Os anteriores no valor de (6.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, 20.000.00mt e 11.000.00mt) todos foram usados para comprar material de construção e para ampliação da sua casa.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para mobiliar a sua casa oferecendo mais conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Essineta José was born in the Gaza Province, in South Mozambique. She is a widow and mother of 3 children, 2 of whom work, as a teacher and a nurse. She went to school until 4th grade and didn't finish due to lack of conditions. She lives in her own home with her daughter who is in 12th grade.

She left Gaza when her husband was transferred to work in the Namaacha District. Years later her husband passed away leaving her with 3 children. Life became hard because she didn't have a job. She then started selling salty pastries informally to pay for her children's schooling. She was later asked to come to the "Banco Comercial de Investimentos (BCI)" to deal with some documents and was granted a pension of 8,000 meticais from her late husband to support her children. She was then able to build a "type 1" home and her concern now was to increase the size of her home. 

She has never had a loan with other banks. She learned about Hluvuku at a women's traditional savings (chitique) meeting. This is her fifth loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais. She plans to purchase construction materials (tiles, cement glue, labor and others). The previous loans, in the amounts of 6,000, 15,000, 20,000 and 11,000 meticais, were all used to purchase construction materials and to increase the size of her home. 

She is confident she will pay ahead of schedule and request another loan to furnish her home and offer more comfort to her family.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (tiles, cement glue, labor and others)

loans.name: Mujeres Del Éxito Group

texts.es: Doña Martha S. de treinta y ocho años de edad, casada, curso el sexto grado de primaria, tiene 4 hijos de diferentes edades el mayor de 16 y la mas pequeña de 6 años, su esposo se dedica  a la confección de pantalones y ella se dedica al comercio (Venta de carne de pollo) en el mercado  y ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en este negocio, ya que esta actividad la ayuda a obtener ganancias para poder colaborar con los gastos de su familia y la educación de sus hijos. Ella siempre sueña con un negocio grande  y contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de unas vecinas  y hermanas de la iglesia, organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MUJERES DEL ÉXITO, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes con el pensamiento que de ellas depende llegar a cumplir sus sueños y obtener éxito en sus negocios. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; venta de ropas típicas y Refacciones, en las escuelas de los lugares aledaños.  El préstamo doña Martha lo utilizará para capital de trabajo, y de esa forma incrementar sus ganancias y considera que con la ayuda de este crédito aumentara su negocio y obtendrá un mejor desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha S., 38, is married and finished 6th grade.  She has four children of various ages.  The oldest is 16 and the youngest is 6.  Her husband makes pants and she sells chicken meat in the market.  She has been in business for 10 years since this activity helps her earn profits that she can contribute towards household expenses and her children’s education.

She always dreams with having a large business and with enthusiasm, desire to stand out and with help from some neighbors and fellow church members, the decision to form a group to request a loan was made.

The communal bank is called “MUJERES DEL ÉXITO (Women of Success).  The name was chosen by all the members with the thought in mind that having their dreams come true and being successful in their businesses depends on each one of them.

The group has 10 female members who are in a variety of activities among which are: sale of typical costumes, sale of replacement parts, and teaching in neighboring villages.

Martha will use the loan as working capital to increase her profits.  She considers that help from this loan will increase his business leading to better personal and family development.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel y su espoa L. señora Iris, son unmatrimonio muy joven D. apenas 4 años D. casados, tienen un pequeño hijo D. dos años, poco a poco le han hecho mejoras a su vivienda, para darle una mejor calidad D. vida al pequeño y para que sus futuros hijos esten comodos en su hogar, en L. caque que ahora avitan no cuenta con piso, y es por eso que solicitan este credito para colocar el piso y L. banqueta D. su casa.
texts.en: Abel and his wife Iris are a very young married couple who have been married for barely 4 years. They have a little son of 4 years old. Little by little they have been making improvements to their home so they can give their little one a better quality of life and so that their future children will be comfortable in their home. They don't currently have a finished floor, and so they are requesting this loan to put in a floor and sidewalk.

loans.use: Construction of a floor and sidewalk.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El joven Alfredo M. de  27 años de edad, soltero  se dedica a la reparación y mantenimientos de motos en general.
 Desde muy joven realiza esta actividad aprendió de su padre y le resulta bastante bien porque le genera un buen ingreso, pero sin embargo le faltan herramienta que puedan facilitar su trabajo. 
Solicita dicho préstamo para la compra de Herramientas , ya que tiene muchos trabajos a realizar.. Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada de acceder a un préstamo.
texts.en:
Alfredo M., 27, is single.  He is a motorcycle repairman.

He has been in this line of work since a very young age having learned it from his father.  It works out well for him because it generates good income. However, he lacks some tools that would make his work easier.

He requested a loan to buy tools because he has many jobs to complete.

He thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity to have access to a loan.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Josefa Maritza

texts.es: La señora Josefa tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Ella tiene el negocio de venta de carne localizada en el mercado loval. Tiene 21 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Pues sus inicios se dan por la falta de generar ingresos a su hogar, siempre ha sido muy responsable con sus cuotas, pues no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento. Ella ofrece un buen servicio y está muy contenta con este medio de vida. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de insumos de carne.
texts.en: 54 year old Josefa is married and has one child in her care. She runs a butchers in the local market. She has been running this business for 21 years.  She started the business to generate income for the household. She has always been very responsible about her repayments, and this is not the first loan that she has received. She offers a good service and is very happy with her way of life. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies of meat.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Francisco Foquisso

texts.pt:
Francisco foquisso M. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, é casado pai de 3 filhos de 9, 13 e 14 anos todos vão a Escola. Vive na casa própria com sua família não responsabiliza se por ninguém, e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt por mês pois conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é negociante. 

Saiu de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha a procura de emprego. Primeiro trabalhou como empregado domestico durante 2 anos, mais tarde consegue um emprego melhor na Escola Secundária da Namaacha como Assistente Técnico, ainda com possibilidades de dar continuidade com seus estudos. Recebe um salario de 4.900.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda da sua esposa que é comerciante consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com kiva no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os três primeiros empréstimos de (5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 10.500.00mt) foram usados para habitação (legalização do terreno e inicio da obra).

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para manutenção de energia e pintura da sua casa.
texts.en:
Francisco Foquisso M. was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has three children ages 9, 13 and 14 years.  All the children go to school.  He lives in his own house with his family and is not responsible for anyone else, and he manages to save 1,000 meticais per month with the help of his wife, who is a businesswoman.

He left Inhambane to move to Namaacha District in search of work.  First, he worked as a domestic worker for two years.  Later, Francisco got a better job at Namaacha Secondary School as a Technical Assistant, where it is even possible for him to continue his own studies.  He receives a salary of 4,900 meticais per month, which he applies to household expenses.  With the help of his wife, who is a businesswoman, he even manages to save some money in his bank account.

Francisco has never had loans with other banks.  This 10,000 meticais loan is his fourth loan with Hluvuku and his second with Kiva.  He intends to buy construction material (iron, cement, sand, stone and other materials) to continue work on his house.  The first three loans (for 5,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 10,500 meticais) were used for housing (securing the title to the land and beginning construction).

He is confident that he will pay off the loan ahead of schedule and request a new loan to set up electrical service and paint his house.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Faïda sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Zambougou dans la commune rurale de Sanando dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de parenté et de voisinage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente du niébé, du mil, du lait, des condiments alimentaires et de pagnes wax. 
Dans le but de s’approvisionner au comptant en marchandises, elles ont  décidé d’adhérer  à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sanata  D.  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de niébé. Elle se ravitaille en niébé à la foire de Konodimini et de Konobougou. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit à domicile et à la foire du village à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Sanata  D. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer et réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Elle a pour objectif à l’image des autres membres du groupe de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The five women of the Faida group are all married and living mainly in polygamous families.  On the average, they are 36 years old, with four children. They live in Zambougou village in the rural community of Sanando in Seégoou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors. They sell niébé [a type of black-eyed peas], millet, milk, food condiments and wax “pagnes,” [traditional colorful cloth]. In order to be able to pay cash for a new stock of goods, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Mrs. Sanata D. plans to use her loan to purchase two bags of niébé. She stocks up at the Konodimini market in Konobougou. She sells for cash and on credit out of her home and at the village market to a customer base composed generally of women. 

Mrs. Sanata D. hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 28,000 West African Francs, which will be used to cover some everyday household needs, with the rest reinvested in her business. Like other group members, she would like to start raising sheep and goats.

loans.use: Purchasing black-eyed peas

loans.name: Elizabeth Haidee

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 40 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa y vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

Cuando ella era pequeña le ayudaba a la mama en la tienda que tenían en su casa, poco a poco fue creciendo y descubriendo que la mejor opción de tener dinero era teniendo su propio negocio. Poco a poco con esfuerzo compro víveres y ubico una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm, en ocasiones ella trabaja en una farmacia para tener mas ingresos y su hija mayor atiende la tienda mientras que ella sale. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, y sabanas para vender a sus nuevos clientes. En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket y así ayudar con los gastos de sus hijos y ayuda a su papa económicamente.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 40, has a small grocery store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations rich in seafood.

When she was little she helped her mother in the store they had at home.  As she grew up she realized that having her own business would be a better way for her to earn her own money.  Gradually, with effort, she bought foodstuffs and set up a small store in the front part of her house.  She is open for business from 7am until 10pm.  Sometimes she works at a pharmacy to earn extra income and her oldest daughter tends to the store when she has to go out.

She will use the loan to buy rice, cooking oil and bed sheets to sell to new customers.  In the future she’d like to have a minimarket to help cover her children’s expenses and to help out her father economically.

loans.use: For rice, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Joana P. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada mãe de 6 filhos de 12 aos 31 anos, 5 destes é que vão a Escola o mais velho já esta empregado. Fez somente 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.

Apos o seu casamento começa a fazer o trabalho agrícola como base de sustento da sua família ha mais de 25 anos, é proprietária de 25 hectares de terra, não tem empregados conta com ajuda dos seus filhos e enteados. Tem plantado (milho, feijão manteiga, feijão nhemba, amendoim, melancia e aboboras) para venda, outra para o consumo familiar assim como para usar como forma de pagamento quando solicita mão-de-obra para sacha. Vende mais milho a lata e saco (120mt x30latas e a 360mtx50sacos) conseguindo um lucro de cerca de 21.600.00mt por cada época que aplica nas despesas de casa e devido a doença do seu marido que encontra se internado ela fica sem fundo suficiente devido as despesas hospitalares e aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo para sustentar a sua atividade.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Joana na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar insumos agrícolas (sementes, fertilizantes e outros) para aumentar o volume de produção na sua machamba. O anterior no valor 25.000.00mt foi usado para lavrar a terra e comprar insumos agrícolas.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto pois conta com ajuda da família. Pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para aplicar na produção de hortícolas em breve.
texts.en:
Joana P. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 6 children between 12 and 31 years old.  Five of the children go to school, and the eldest is employed.  Joana only finished seventh grade and did not continue school because of financial difficulties.  She lives in her own house and supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

After her wedding, more than 25 years ago, she began farming as a means of supporting her family.  Joana owns 25 hectares of land.  She has no employees and counts on help from her children and stepchildren.  She has planted corn, butter beans, cowpeas, peanuts, watermelon and pumpkins for sale, as well as some for her family to eat and some to use as payment when she requests labor for the harvest.  She sells mostly corn in cans and sacks (120 meticais for 31 cans and 360 meticais for 50 sacks), earning an income of around 21,600 meticais for each period.  She uses this money for household expenses, and owing to her husband's illness (he is currently hospitalized), she does not have enough money because of the hospital expenses.  Joana approached Hluvuku and Kiva to request a loan to keep up with her work.

This is Joana's second loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva.  She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy farm supplies (seeds, fertilizers and other items) to increase production on her machamba (small farm).  The previous loan, for 25,000 meticais, was used to plow the land and buy farm supplies.

She is confident that she will repay the loan ahead of time because she has her family's help.  She intends to ask for another loan soon to put toward agricultural production.

loans.use: compra de insumos agrícolas (sementes, fertilizantes e outros)

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et habitant le village de Zambougou dans la commune rurale de Sanando dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de parenté et de voisinage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de fourrage de niébé, du savon local (kabakourouni), des condiments (Sounbala)  et de la galette de mil. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire.
 Madame Magninè Traoré est reconnue à Zambougou pour la qualité de sa galette et sa ponctualité de vouloir ravitailler le matin de bonheur toute la population du village en petit déjeuner. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de mil qu’elle transforme petit à petit en galettes. Elle vend au comptant et à crédit devant sa porte à une clientèle mixte. Elle s’approvisionne en mil à la foire de Konodimini. 
Pour faire de la galette, elle décortique le mil, le moudre au moulin pour avoir sa farine, malaxe cette dernière avec la bouillie de mil et un peu de levure pour obtenir de la pâte. C’est cette pâte qui est coupée et frite à l’huile d’arachide ou au beurre de karité. 
Madame Magninè Traoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Sabali group is composed of five married women, living mainly in polygamous families. On the average, they are 47 years old with four children. They live in the Zambougou village in the rural community of Sanando in Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as neighbors and relatives by blood or marriage. Their business is selling niébé [a type of black-eyed peas], local soap called “kabakouroni,” a popular food condiment called “sounbala” and millet cakes. In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan.

Mrs. Magninè Traoré is well known in Zambougou for the high quality of her cakes and for being on time: she is always has  breakfast ready to be enjoyed by locals early in the morning. She plans to use her loan to purchase three bags of millet, to be used little by little for her cakes. She sells for cash and on credit in front of her home to a diverse customer base. She buys millet at the Konodimini market. In order to bake cakes, she hulls millet, grinds it in a grinder to make flour, which is then mixed in with millet broth and a bit of yeast so as to make dough. The resulting dough is then cut into pieces and fried in peanut  or palm oil. Mrs.  Magninè Traoré hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 21,500 West African Francs, which will be used for savings and for some everyday household needs. Her goal is to start raising sheep and goats.

loans.use: Purchasing millet

loans.name: Maria Jose Dias

texts.pt:
Maria José Dias M., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, é divorciada mãe de 8 filhos de 25 aos 45 anos de idade nenhum deles vai a Escola, todos estão empregados. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e responsabiliza se pala sua neta que vive com ela em sua casa.

Maria é obrigada pelos pais a abandonar os estudos para se casar com um marido que eles atribuíram a ela. Assim ela recusa se e sai da casa dos pais para casa do namorado, que por ela foi escolhido. Começa a trabalhar na OMM (Organização da Mulher Moçambicana) como Educadora, anos depois é contratada para trabalhar na Escola Secundaria da Namaacha na sensibilização das alunas internas e como Modista daquele recinto Escolar. É funcionaria permanente ha 8 anos, tem um salario de 2.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas da casa, mas conta também com ajuda dos seus filhos no valor de 3.000.00mt mensal e ainda tem inquilinos em sua casa que pagam 1.500.00mt por mês, assim ela consegue poupar algum no final de cada mês.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende custear as despesas de legalização do seu terreno e fazer reabilitação das janelas da sua casa dando assim mais conforto a sua família. Os três empréstimos anteriores no valor de (5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt) foram usados para comprar material de construção. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir mais empréstimo pois pretende abrir uma fábrica de sabão no Distrito.
texts.en:
Maria José Dias M. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She is divorced and has eight children between 25 and 45 years old.  None of them attend school; they are all employed.  She lives in her own house with her family and takes care of her granddaughter who lives with her.

Maria's parents made her abandon her studies to marry a man they chose for her.  She refused and left her parents' house to move to her boyfriend's house.  She began to work at OMM (Mozambican Women's Organization) as an educator.  Some years later she was hired to work at the Namaacha Secondary School educating the boarding students and working as the school dressmaker.  She has been a permanent employee for eight years.  She has a salary of 2,500 meticais which she uses for household expenses, but she counts on her children's help for 3,000 meticais monthly, and she also has lodgers in her house who pay 1,500 meticais per month.  In this way Maria manages to save some money at the end of each month.

She has never had loans from other banks.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva.  She is asking for 15,000 meticais, which she intends to spend on purchasing the title to her land and replacing the windows in her house so her family can be more comfortable.  The first three loans were for 5,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 10,000 meticais, and were used to buy construction materials.

Maria is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of schedule and ask for another loan since she intends to open a soap factory in the District.

loans.use: Purchase title to land

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años, vende animales entre porcino y ovino, actividad que empieza en conseguir estos animales de granjas alejadas, del cual los compra y luego procura mantenerlos en buen estado hasta que tengan el peso exacto para ser vendidos los fines de semana en la ferias ganaderas de su comunidad, es así que como se genera ingresos semanales. Sin embargo durante los demás días de la semana opta por  trabajar cuidando niños en su casa, ya que en  ocasiones sus vecino le solicita este servio. Por otro lado su madre la apoya en el negocio de venta de animales, ya que este trabajo le es bastante rentable y más cuando es época de festividades. Por tal razón, Angélica desea seguir vendiendo animales y tener más capital de trabajo. Es la crédito número 16 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales, de esa manera podrá incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Angélica is 35 years old, and lives with her two children and her husband in her own home. For 4 years she has been selling pigs and sheep. First she buys animals from farms and then tries to keep them in good condition until they reach exactly the right weight to be sold at the weekend livestock markets in her community. This is how she makes her weekly income. However, during the other days of the week, she works looking after children in her home, as her neighbors sometimes ask her to do this for them. On the other hand, her mother helps her with selling the animals and this work is quite profitable, especially during the holiday season. For this reason, Angélica wants to keep selling animals and to have more working capital. This is her 16th loan from MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support and is very responsible about her repayments. She also likes being part of the community bank because all the members are people that she knows, who are responsible and very supportive. She is very grateful to the people who will be managing the loan, which will be very useful in advancing her business. She will use the loan to buy more animals and in this way she will be able to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata Traoré est une femme mariée de 42 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec ses enfants et son époux dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Madame Aminata Traoré a tenté plusieurs activités comme l’achat et la vente d’habits, d’articles de fête  etc,  cela sans succès. Alors elle opta de faire de la restauration qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa sœur, depuis maintenant  plus de 8 ans. Son restaurant est situé prêt du grand marché de Bougouni et est très fréquenté.
Après 8 prêts solidaires, elle est venue en individuel où elle est à son 7 ème prêt individuel. Tous les autres prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
