Dans le souci de toujours maintenir sa clientèle et d’acquérir de nouveaux, elle continue de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter,  des condiments alimentaires, des poulets,  de la viande, des céréales et quelques petits matériels (cuillères fourchettes, couteau à table, sel de table etc).
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni. Sa clientèle a une composition diverse et variée. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Traoré is a married woman, 42 years of age, with five children. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Hérémakonon-North District of the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of Mali).

After having left school early, she started working to earn a living. Mrs. Aminata Traore tried different business activities such as selling clothing, party supplies etc, without success. And thus she decided to go into a restaurant business, which she has learned from her sister. She has been in business for eight years now. Her restaurant is located next to the big market of Bougouni and is very popular. After eight solidarity loans, she started applying individually and is now on her 7th individual loan. All previous loans have been duly reimbursed without any issues.

With the goal of  retaining her existing customers and attracting new ones, she continues to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to purchase food condiments, chicken, meat, cereals and some minor items (spoons, forks, knives, table salt etc). She stocks up in Bougouni. Her customer base is very diverse. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 65,000 West African Francs, which will be used to help her husband provide for family needs, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing restaurant supplies

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es: Víctor Enrique  es un joven de 26 años, la necesidad lo ha impulsado a obtener su propio negocio que es la elaboración de cruces y lozas para sepulturas. Este es su primer Financiamiento con Fundación planea comprar una amplia variedad de productos como cemento, arena, piedrín, pintura, azulejos entre otras cosas que son necesarias para la elaboración de sus productos.  Está necesitando de este capital de trabajo adicional para responderles a sus clientes que le solicitan variedad. El buen carisma que ofrece es lo que hace que obtenga más clientes y una buena calidad en lo que realiza. Su sueño es llegar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Necessity has pushed Víctor Enrique, 26, to start his own business.  He makes crosses and cover slabs for graves.  

This is his first loan with the Fundación and he plans to use it to buy a wide variety of supplies, like cement, sand, gravel, paint, tile, etc., that he needs to manufacture his items.  He needs capital to respond to customer requests for a wider variety of items.  The good charisma he exhibits and the high quality of products he makes leads to more customers.

His dream is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene una amplia experiencia de 20 años en las ventas, vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad desde golosinas y abarrotes, en sus inicios vendía en una caseta ahora vende en su casa que le permite mayor comodidad en el desarrollo de su negocio. Además su esposo y sus hijos  también aportan significativamente en la atención de este negocio ya que gracias a ella tienen grandes oportunidades. Su tienda esta ubicada en el paradero de una línea de transportes cuyos choferes son sus potenciales clientes, también vende carne, por lo que también le resulta rentable. Para el futuro desea suministrarse de varios productos, de esa manera podrá mejorar sus ganancias. Este es su crédito número 18 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda y para aprovechar algunas temporadas que se vienen.
texts.en:
Celia, 47, lives with her husband and three children in her own house.  She has been in sales for 20 years.  She sells all kinds of basic need items from sweets to groceries.  At the beginning she used to sell from a small booth but now she sells from home which is more comfortable and better for the development of her business.  Besides, her husband and children contribute significantly to running the business since it offers great opportunities to them.

Her store is located at a transportation hub and the drivers are her main customers.  She also sells meat which makes it still more profitable.  For the future she’d like to stock various products to improve profits.

This is her 18th loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she can count on financial support since they know she’s a responsible person with respect to repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are people known to her, they are responsible and mutually supportive.

She is very grateful to all those who will fund the requested loan that will be very useful for her business.

She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to stock the store and to take advantage of the approaching seasons.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anielka De La Concepcion

texts.es: Anielka tiene 26 años, es una joven que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una forma humilde, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general y tortilla. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio pues es una persona muy responsable ya que siempre ha pagado sus cuotas en tiempo.   Anielka es una mujer seria, sencilla y honesta en sus compromisos.El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de maíz, cal y leña.
texts.en:
Anielka is 26 years old.  She is a young woman who has always liked to work and earn a living in a humble way.  She sells general merchandise and tortillas.  She has had this business for four years.  

She is a very responsible person who has always made her payments on time.  Anielka is a serious and easygoing woman who is honest with her obligations.

She will use the loan to buy corn, lime powder, and firewood.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Bendicion 3 Group

texts.es: Doña Juana X. C. es una señora casada, tiene cinco hijos: tres hijas y dos hijos, doña Juana trata de apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace más de 10 años, doña Juana necesita surtir su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas de ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desde hace mas de 10 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata de apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas de su aldea, el cual cada una de las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de frutas, crianza de animales, venta de alimentos, elaboración de canastas entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana X. C. is married and has five children, three daughters and two sons.  She tries to support her family and prepare a better future for her children.  She sells clothes for children and adults.  She has been in business for over 10 years.  She needs to stock the business to improve sales and profits.

For this reason she gathered together a few friends and neighbors that she’s known for over 10 years to form a group because she tries to help not only her family but other people in the village too.

Each of the women engages in a different activity, such as: fruit sales, small animal raising, food sales and basket weaving, among others.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  Sra. María de 33 años de edad, soltera y desde muy joven  se dedicó  a la artesanía de ao po’ i realiza.
Ella confecciona,  manteles, sabanas, individuales, servilletitas y otros, todos realizados en forma artesanal con bordados y encajes.
Actualmente ella quiere confeccionar ropas para la temporada y necesita comprar gran cantidad de metería prima por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas.
 Ella quiere aprovechar las ventas que normalmente se tiene en el verano ya que las confecciones de este tipo de telas son bastantes frescas y comodas para la época de calor.
texts.en:
María, 33, is single and has been an “ao po’i” artisan since she was very young.  (“Ao”  means cloth or clothing in Guaraní and po´i  means fine or thin. Ao po´i developed as a result of the isolationist policies of Paraguay´s first post-colonial leader, and dictator, Dr. Gaspar Rodríguez de Francia. Without access to imported cloth Paraguayan women had to make their own fabric starting with raw cotton which was spun into thread, woven into cloth and later decorated with embroidery. Nowadays much ao po’i cloth is made by machine but still hand sewn and embroidered. There remain a few artisans who do the entire process by hand.)

She makes tablecloths, sheets, place mats, napkins and others, all artisanal with embroidery and lace.

She now wants to make seasonal clothing and needs to buy a large quantity of raw materials.  She is asking for a loan to buy fabric.

She wants to take advantage of sales that are common in summer because this type of clothing is quite cool and comfortable for hot weather.

loans.use: To buy "ao po´i" (typical Paraguayan embroidery) fabric.

loans.name: Felix Angel

texts.es: Félix Ángel se dedica a vender carne y junto a su esposa, reside en la comunidad de telica. Félix se dedica a este negocio desde hace 9 años y lo aprendió como una forma de vida. Actualmente vende este producto que es muy solicitada por sus clientes pues es muy importante para el consumo diario.  Una de las dificultades que enfrenta es que no ha podido suplir la demanda de sus clientes. El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar capital de trabajo carne. Es su primer crédito y espera cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Félix Ángel sells meat.  He lives with his wife in the Telica community.  Félix has been in this business for nine years.  He learned it as a way of life.  The meat that he now sells is in much demand by his customers.  Daily consumption makes it very important.

One of the difficulties that he faces is that he has not been able to meet the demand of his customers.  He needs the requested loan as working capital for meat.  This is his first loan, and he plans to make his payments on time.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 9 años se animó a vender productos de belleza, paralelamente a esto también se dedica a vender pollos, puesto que en su casa tiene un espacio amplio donde tiene una granja de pollos. Es así que recibe dos ingresos económicos, tanto de la venta de cosméticos como la venta de pollos, de esa manera puede ayudar a cubrir los gastos que tiene su familia. Por el momento desea intensificarse en ambos negocios, asimismo esta dispuesta cultivar alfalfa, ya que le servirá como forraje para sus animales. Esta en su crédito número 16 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en productos de belleza y también más animales menores.
texts.en: Edy is 42 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in a home that they own.  For the past 9 years, she has sold beauty products and at the same time has sold chickens, since there is a large space in her home that houses a chicken coop.  In this way, she has two sources of income, one from selling cosmetics and the other from selling chickens, allowing her to help cover her family’s household expenses.  At the time being, she hopes to strengthen both businesses and is also looking to grow alfalfa, which would serve as fodder for her animals.  This is her 16th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to have financial support, and she is known to be responsible with her payments.  Edy is thankful to be part of the community bank and knows all the members of the bank.  She is thankful for the people that manage the loan that she is requesting as they will contribute to the progress of her business.  Edy will use this loan to purchase beauty products and more animals.

loans.use: To increase her supply of beauty products

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan C. tiene 28 años, vive en la zona de Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor C. es una personas sencilla, con ganas de superarse y trabajadora. El se dedica actualmente a la agricultura y  al transporte como chofer. Hace algunos años atrás el solo se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero ha tenido que buscar otra ocupación porque la producción de alimentos ha disminuido por la falta de agua. 
El desea volver a dedicarse por completo a la agricultura solamente, porque tiene espacio suficiente para cultivar alimentos y piensa que esta actividad le va ayudar a mejorar su vida. Pero para realizar esta actividad necesita tener agua suficiente.

Es por esta razón que ha solicitado un crédito para ser socio de un pozo de agua que le permita tener agua para regar sus plantas y dedicarse a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan C., 28, lives in the Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe area of Quillacollo province, Cochabamba department.

He is an unassuming, hard working person who wants to get ahead in life.  He is a farmer and also a driver in transportation.  A few years back he was just a farmer but has had to seek additional employment because the lack of water has decreased farm production.

He wants to go back to being a farmer full time because he has fields sufficient to grow food and feels this activity can help him improve his life.  However, in order to do this he needs to have sufficient water.

He has, therefore, asked for a loan to be a shareholder in a well so that he can have enough water to irrigate his plants and thus be able to be a farmer.

loans.use: To buy a share in a well to have water for irrigation.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es: Doña Juliana P. O., D. treinta y cinco años D. edad, es una señora casada, tiene tres hijos y dos hijas, Doña Juliana, trata D. apoyar económicamente a su familia, se dedica a la crianza D. animales tales como cerdos y gallinas, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Juliana se dio cuenta que necesitaba comprar más animales para seguir criando y así poD. obtener dinero vendiendo sus animales cuando ya sean granD., pero ella aprovecha sus ganancias vendiendo huevos D. sus gallinas, esta venta lo realiza con sus amigas y vecinas D. su comunidad, por esa razón ella quiere, mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas que conocía desD. hace mas D. 10 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que, mencionado ya viene trabajando desD. hace seis meses, el cual ellas ya, han recibido D. nuevo el segundo crédito, por el cual, ella sigue apoyando, no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. utensilios,  entre otros.
texts.en: Juliana is 35 years old, married, and has three sons and two daughters. Juliana, who is financially supporting her family, works raising animals such as pigs and chickens, and has been doing this for more than 10 years. Juliana realized that she needed to buy more animals in order to continue breeding them and so to obtain money from selling them when they are grown. But she also gets income from selling the eggs from her chickens to her friends and neighbors in her community. She wants to improve her sales and increase her income a little, so she joined-up with some friends that she has known for more than 10 years to create a micro-loan group. They have been working together for six months, and they have already paid back their second loan. She used this to support not just her family but also the people of her community. Each of the women in the group has a different business such as: selling fruits, raising livestock, selling clothes, and selling tools, among others.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es:
El Señor Primitivo Ávila E. tiene 24 años, el vive en concubinato y es padre de un hijo al cual ayuda y apoya en su educación, El cliente se dedica a la producción de plátano, yuca y pequeños cultivos, cuenta con 4 hectáreas de plantación de plátano con una producción anual de 720 cabezas a un costo de 2.58 $us. Con un ingreso anual de 1,857.60 $us. Una parcela con una producción anual de 30 qq con un ingreso anual de 5.74 $us y otros cultivos menores con un ingreso anual de  1,800.00$us. En la localidad de 2da. Nazareno, El cliente cuenta con una experiencia como agricultor con más de 6 años experiencia la cual le ayuda a conocer bien el mercado donde se desenvuelve.

El cliente entrega su producto a los comerciantes de los distintos mercados locales de la zona.
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una motocicleta, para el transporte  de la fruta de su chaco hacia su casucha donde almacena su producto para luego comercializarlos a los diferentes comerciantes mayoristas. Este es su único medio de transporte para ese tipo de lugar.

Cabe señalar que el señor Primitivo Ávila E. se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Mr. Primitivo Ávila E., 24, lives in a common law marriage.  He has a son in school whose education he pays for.  He farms bananas, manioc and other minor crops.  He has four hectares of banana that produce a yearly crop of 720 stalks at a cost of $2.58US.  His annual income from this is $1,857US.  Another parcel produces 30 quintales a year with an annual income of $5.74US and with his other minor crops equals an annual income of $1,800US.  He lives in Segunda Nazareno.   He has been a farmer for over 6 years which makes him quite knowledgeable about his market.  He sells his product to various merchants in the area local markets.

This is his first loan from our institution.  He will use it to buy a motorcycle to transport the fruit from his field to his shed where he stores it for later sale to various wholesalers.  This is the only type of transportation means suitable for that kind of place.

It’s worth noting that Mr. Primitivo Ávila E. came by in person to ask for the loan after having been told by coworkers about the good credit terms our institution offers.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport merchandise.

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.es: El señor Ever Jose M. L., tiene la edad de 42 años,  es casado y tienen 4 hijos adolecentes, que se dedican a los estudios, el mayor de ellos pronto está por comenzar los estudios universitarios, ella labora como capitán de mesa en un restaurante, habitan en una vivienda pequeña y humilde que que con el esfuerzo de la pareja y sus bajos ingresos han logrado avanzar en gran medida las remodelaciones en su hogar, pero es para este fin que solicita un préstamo para la compra de una verjas que instalara en el frente de su hogar, esta inversión le brindara a la fachada de su hogar una mejor presentación y seguridad a sus hijos debido a que el espacio donde habitan tiene un alto índice de delincuencia. La tranquilidad de su familia  es lo que el señor M. anhela para su desarrollo.
texts.en: Señor Ever Jose M. L., 42, is married with 4 adolescent children currently in school.  His eldest daughter, who will soon enter the university, works as a head waiter in a restaurant.  They live in a small, humble house that they have been remodeling on their own with their small income.  It is to achieve this goal that he is requesting a loan to purchase some railings that he will install in the front of his home.  This will provide his home with an improved appearance as well as increase the safety of his children, since the place where they live has a high delinquency rate.  The peace of his family is Señor M.'s greatest wish.

loans.use: Purchase of railings

loans.name: Las Pascuas Group

texts.es: Doña Vicenta X. D. cuarenta años D. edad, es una señora casada, tiene nueve hijos y tres hijas, dona Vicenta es una emprendedora en su hogar para prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales, como también atienD. una tiendecita que ella  ha podido  mantener, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Vicenta se dio cuenta que necesitaba surtir mas su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas, y tratar la manera D. apoyar a su comunidad para que las persona puedan comprar lo necesario en el consumo diario y así evitar subir a comprar al pueblo ya que a ellos les que muy lejos, y así D. esa manera ella pueD. obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace mas D. 12 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, elaboración D. camisolas y pantalonetas, pants blusas, venta D. mercería, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vicenta X., 40, is married.  She has nine sons and three daughters.  Vicenta is enterprising in order to prepare a better future for her children.  She raises small farm animals and tends to a small grocery store she’s managed to have for over ten years.

Vicenta noted that she had to better stock the store in order to improve sales and support her community offering what they need for daily consumption without having to go all the way up to town which is quite distant.  This way she is able to earn a few more profits.

She, therefore, gathered together a few friends and neighbors that she has known for over 12 years to form a group because she tries to help not just her own family but also other people in the village.

Each of them is engaged in a different type of activity, such as: fruit sales, small animal raising, clothes making, notions sales, etc.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su octavo ciclo y siguen trabajando activamente todas en conjunto y también cada una con sus emprendimientos que les genera ganancias.
 Una de ellas y una de las mas trabajadoras y activas es la Sra. Teodosia Balmaceda de 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas quienes la  ayudan  en su trabajo ya que ella es de  profesión peluquera. 
Tiene su peluquería en su casa con clientela formada es una persona muy activa y también hace comestible los fines de semanas para tener más ingresos, para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa. 
Actualmente quiere anexar a su peluquería aprovechando la concurrencia de la gente, ropas de la temporada de verano, y para ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, vestidos, shorts, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is in its eighth loan cycle and they are actively working together as well as in their respective business that generate profits for them.
One of the members, and one of the hardest working, is Teodosia. She is 50 years old, has 2 daughters who help her with her work, and she is a hairdresser. 
She runs her hairdressing business from home and has regular customers. She is a very active person and also makes and sells food at the weekends to bring in more income to cover the household expenses. 
Currently, she wants to add another service to her hairdressers, taking advantage of the fact that people are there: she plans to sell summer clothes, and for this she is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, dresses, shorts, and other things.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shirts, dresses, shorts, and other things.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is part of the communal bank “Peulla Brotes Nuevos” and resides in the city of Viña del Mar. She is a mother of three children, but only the youngest, a 17 year old, lives with her. Gabriela sells used clothing, primarily jeans, at two local street fairs; she has sold at one of the fairs for the past 15 years and at the other for one year. She works four days a week, including the weekends, from 8am to 5pm.
With this loan, Gabriela will purchase jeans and pearl beads to make jewelry. Gabriela dreams of furthering her business, depending on more space and merchandise. She is motivated to own her own house, as she currently lives with loved ones, and feels that her quality of life would benefit if she had her own house.
Gabriela says Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, gave her the opportunity to succeed and "take a big step forward”, and that it’s a blessing that it lent a hand to make her business grow. Gabriela now sees improved earnings, and the results of her efforts.
Viña del Mar is a city and community located in the central coastal region of Chile, known as the "Garden City" because of its beautiful parks and gardens. The city is in the Valparaíso region, known for its temperate climate. This region is known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To purchase more used jeans plus pearl beads to make jewelry

loans.name: Las Samaritanas De Xequemeya Group

texts.es: Doña Rosario L. L. D. treinta y nueve años D. edad, es una señora casada, tiene tres niños y  una nena, doña Rosario apoya económicamente a su familia y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración D. trajes para niños y elaboración D. pantalones. Para elaborar esta prendas ella utiliza una máquina D. coser para realizar su trabajo con el apoyo D. su esposo, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Rosario necesita elaborar mas prendas, para poder mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas que conocía desD. hace mas D. 15 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, cultivo D. frijol y tomate, elaboración D. ropa como pants, pantalones, venta D. alimentos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario L. L., 39, is married.  She has three sons and one daughter.  She helps support her family and proviD. a better future for her children.  She makes clothes for children and she makes pants.  She uses a sewing machine to do the work.  Her husband helps her.  She has been in this line of work for over 10 years.

Rosario needs to make more items in order to improve sales and thus earn a bit more profits.  To do this, she gathered together a group of friends she’s known for over 15 years to form a group because she tries to support not just her family but other people in her village as well.  

Each of the women is in a different type of activity, such as: fruit sales, raising animals, bean and tomato farming, clothing manufacture, food sales, etc.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials and supplies.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepción De Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité “Inmaculada Concepción de Maria” tiene  4 meses  de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes  ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero para el nuevo ciclo incluyeron entre sus integrantes  a  señoras que emprenderán actividades. 
Todas realizan actividades variadas a la conveniencia de cada una así como la Sra. Antolina quien decidió  dedicarse a la venta de ropas desde su casa ya que está en una zona muy concurrida.
Ella comenta que se encuentra muy contenta con el grupo y que le gustaría aumentaría aumentar la cantidad y variedad de mercaderías con que cuenta en su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, calzados, shorts, camisas, remeras, vestidos.
texts.en: The “Inmaculada Concepción de Maria” committee formed 4 months ago and works with Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the members already engage in productive activities, but for their new cycle they have included in their membership women who will undertake new enterprises.  Each has a different activity according to her particular convenience, such as Sra. Antolina who decided to begin selling clothing from her home since she lives in a very crowded area.  She says that she is very happy with the group and that she would like to increase the quantity and variety of clothing offered by her business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase pants, socks, shorts, shirts, T-shirts and dresses.

loans.use: Purchase of stock such as  T-shirts, shirts, dresses and socks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is part of the communal bank “Peulla Brotes Nuevos,” and resides in the city of Viña del Mar. She runs a small sewing and clothing shop at her house. Elizabeth also sews for a boutique, but this is not a steady employment contract. Elizabeth receives help from her husband in the business; he also has a second job working in construction. Her husband takes care of all the ironing and sometimes does some sewing tasks as well.
With this loan Elizabeth intends to rent a local studio in a more visible location, which will also offer more space. She dreams of expanding her business to sell clothing items and decorative items that she produces. Elizabeth’s motivation is to give higher education to her four sons: aged 20, 18, 17 and 16. Elizabeth's oldest daughter (aged 20) studies pedagogy and is also a well versed seamstress, so Elizabeth also plans to lean on her skills as her business grows more.
For Elizabeth, working with Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza has been helpful as it has motivated her to think about the future of her business and through that advance forward to the next step. She is also happy with the interest rates and the weekly payment schedule, as this gets her out of debt quicker.
Viña del Mar is a city and community located in the central coastal region of Chile, known as the "Garden City" because of its beautiful parks and gardens. The city is in the Valparaíso region, known for its temperate climate. This region is known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To expand her business by renting a local studio

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana es una pequeña comerciante que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y el apoyo de la institución. La venta de cuajadas y tortillas que realiza de varios años, comenzando con poco dinero. También ante se dedicaba a vender desayunos.
Como madre soltera logro apoyar a sus hijos, y mejorar parte de la vivienda, pues le ah tocado muy difícil, pero entre mas trabaja, se siente animada por su objetivos de ventas.
Hoy con este préstamo desea invertir en su negocio. En la compra de varios quintales de maíz, leña, cal y cuajada en mucha cantidad, logrando vender a sus clientes, así como la captación de los mismos.
texts.en:
Ana runs a small business that has grown thanks to her tenacity and the support of the institution.  She has been selling cheese made from curdled milk and tortillas for several years, starting with little money.  She also used to sell breakfasts.  As a single mother, she has been able to support her children and make improvements to their home.  Even though she works a lot, she is inspired by her sales goals.  

She will invest this loan in her business.  She will buy several quintales (100 pounds) of corn, fuel, lime and cheese in large quantities to sell to her current customers and to attract new customers.

loans.use: To purchase corn, fuel, lime and cheese

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix C. A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Actualmente se encuentra casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos. 
Su hijo tiene 18 años y se encuentra estudiando en  secundaria y a la espera de estudiar derecho, el préstamo es para estudiar. (vestimenta y alimentación.). El señor Félix trabaja en una empresa de recolección de escombros en la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa se dedica a lavar ropa.
Es su primer crédito con IMPRO y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente para acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Félix C. A. lives in his own house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and their three children.

His 18 year old son is in high school, and he hopes to study law.  The loan is for his education (clothes and food).

Félix works for a company that collects rubbish in the city of La Paz.  His wife washes clothes.

This is his first loan with IMPRO.  The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Heyddi Patricia

texts.es:
Heyddi de 25 años, es comerciante informal, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Desde pequeña ella le ayudo a su mama a recopilar el dinero de los artículos que ella vendía. Hace 7 años atrás después de haberse casado comenzó a vender artículos y productos de uso personal a sus vecinos y conocidos. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 14h00pm hasta las 17h30pm todos los días. Vende blusas desde $ 5.00, pantalones a $ 15.00 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, adornos de navidad para estar preparada para la temporada navideña y así asegurar las primeras ventas a sus conocidos. En el futuro quiere tener una boutique en una parte de su casa.
texts.en:
25-year-old Heyddi is an informal merchant.  She lives in Playas, a tourist destination in Ecuador known for its wide variety of seafood.

Since she was little, Heyddi helped her mom gather the money from the things she sold.  Seven years ago after she got married, Heyddi began selling clothes and personal products to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Since then, she has worked every day from 2PM to 5:30PM.  She sells blouses from $5, pants from $15, etc.

With this loan, Heyddi wants to buy clothes and Christmas decorations to be prepared for the holiday season and secure the first sales to her customers.  In the future, she wants to have a boutique in her house.

loans.use: Buying clothes and Christmas decorations for resale

loans.name: Las Colmena 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Lourdes es una D. los miembros del Grupo Las Colmena  1, 2 y 3, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos misceláneos, zapatos, artesanía,  etc.  Sus plazas se encuentran en L. ciudad D. Samana, una ciudad turística en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Océano atlántico y rica en recursos naturales.  Está asociada D. Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque le interesaba obtener un capital para fines D. negocio, y D. esta manera hay mas compromiso y crecimiento. Tiene 2 hijos, los cuales viven junto con elL. y su padre, realiza como negocio, las ventas ambulante D. productos D. belleza y cosmeticos. Lourdes desea terminar sus estudios universitarios, el cual es su mayor reto, y mientras lo logra seguira asistiendo a L. iglesia, L. cual es su lugar favorito.

Lourdes  está muy emocionada D. recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después D. haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento D. su negocio. ElL. ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 1 año, el cual lo inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en L. compra D. diferentes productos D. uso personal como cosmeticos, y D. belleza.  ElL. va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio, desea construir su casa y lo hara por medio del ahorro D. los beneficios que genere su negocio a largo plazo. Su sueño es servir siempre al Señor por sobre todas las cosas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of Grupo Las Colmena 1, 2 and 3.  The group’s members are micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, artisanry, etc.  Their markets are in Samana, a developing tourist destination, bordered by the Atlantic coasts and rich in natural resources.  Lourdes, a member of Esperanza International, became part of Grupo Las Colmena because she was interested in obtaining capital for her business, and this way there is more commitment and growth.  She is married and has two children who live with her.  She is a travelling saleswoman, selling beauty products and cosmetics.  Lourdes wants to finish her college education—it’s her biggest challenge—while she continues to help at the church, which is her favorite place.

Lourdes is very excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza International, having satisfactorily paid back her first and being given the opportunity to grow her business.  She has had her business for about one year, having started it with the first loan she received from Esperanza.  She will invest her new loan in the purchase of different personal products like cosmetics and other beauty products.  She will reinvest her earnings into her business.  She wants to build a house, and she will do it by saving up money maD. from her business in the long term.  Her dream is to always serve God above all else.

loans.use: Cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz A. is 38 years old, married and has two children. Almaz is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.
Nine years ago, Almaz had the idea of starting to raise cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Slowly, the number of cows increased and with them, her customers started asking for more and more. Her monthly income is about 250 to 300 AZN and she would like to increase it to 500 AZN. With an endless list of requests, Almaz has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN. She will use this loan to purchase three baby calves. Almaz started her business with a loan from Kiva partner, Aqroinvest, and is recommended as a good client.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran M. is 49 years old. He has run his own food store since 2004. For almost six years Imran has been selling different kind of goods such as juices, rice, tea, and other merchandise. These products are very popular with his customers.
His monthly income is about 200 to 300 AZN and Imran is planning to increase it to 500 AZN. For this purpose he needs to increase his stock and therefore is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en: Ilqar M. is a dedicated entrepreneur who is sometimes accused of being a workaholic. Five years ago he started a small business selling groceries. He chose a good location for his business, one that was convenient and fills a market niche, and he has poured his energy into making it successful. Ilqar, a kind, attentive man who tries to take care of his customers, has requested a loan to help open a new sales location and purchase more grocery items to sell. He’d like to continue expanding his business so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad A. is 48 years old, married and runs his own business. He operates a dealer center for selling mobile Sim cards and cards to replenish the phone balance.
Elshad tries to use up-to-date technologies in his work so that he can satisfy his customers' demands and requirements. He is requesting a loan of 800 AZN to purchase Sim cards and to improve his business place. This is Elshad's second loan and he thanks everyone for their support. He promises not to let them down and to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase Sim cards

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh A. is 46 years old. He is married and has three children. Saleh is hardworking and has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children. He started his business ten years ago and now he has great cattle breeding experience. Thanks to the first loan from AqroInvest, Saleh was able to increase his income. Over time he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Saleh has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy young cattle. This loan will help to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Ziya

texts.en: Ziya B. is 36 years old and married with two children. The plans that he has for his family are to improve their living conditions and to prepare his two children for professional life.  Ziya has had his grocery store for four years; he started it with his own resources through his work. He wants to increase the sales of new products preferred by his clients.  Ziya plans to meet his economic plans by purchasing products such as bread, tinned goods, sweets, and juices to grow his revenue.  For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: pruchase more merchandise to increase profit

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil B. is 48 years old. He is married with three children.  Kamil has been running the business for five years. He sells office supplies in his store. The business generates significant income for the family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.  Today Kamil is requesting 1000 AZN.  He plans to spend the loan for purchasing more office supplies to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more office supplies to increase income

loans.name: Qahir

texts.en:
Qahir A. is 45 years old.  He is married with two children.  He owns a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs like macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and detergents. Qahir started this business six years ago with a small inventory of foodstuff.  Over time he has expanded his business and has become very successful. 

Qahir is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase his stock.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children will progress through their studies, for which he is doing his very best.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase stock

loans.name: Tany Irone

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Tany, ella mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tuvo  tres hijos, los tres ya son mayores pero su hija menor que es soltera vive con ella, el esposo es comerciante.

Tienen un almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices, trabajan todos los días ya que este es un negocio familiar, desde muy temprano abren su negocio a las 8 am y cierran a las 17h00, además de repuestos también venden aceites y otros lubricantes de automóvil y motocicletas, dice que le va muy bien en su negocio ya que junto a su local hay talleres mecánicos entonces aprovechan para vender a los clientes que necesitan los repuestos. Cada quince días el esposo viaja a Quito  y Guayaquil a realizar los pedidos que luego reciben en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar repuestos para tener de todo para sus clientes. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 18 ciclos y esta muy a gusto en el.

Su meta es comprar un camioncito para traer los repuestos de otras ciudades.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto every fifteen days the Salud Y Vida Communal Bank meets. This area is known for its traditions and for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we found Mrs. Tany, she has common law marriage where she has three children, all three are grown but her youngest daughter is single and lives with her, Tany’s husband is a merchant.

They have a store where they sell automotive spare parts and work everyday since it is a family business. They open the store from very early in the morning from 8 a.m and close at 5 p.m. Besides selling spare parts, they sell oils and other lubricants for cars and motorcycles. Tany says that she does very well in her business since next to her local there are mechanics and they take advantage of this by selling items to customers who need replacements. Every fifteen days, Tany’s husband goes to Quito and Guayaquil to fill in the orders that they have made in their store.

This loan will be used to buy spare parts to have everything their customers need. Tany has been in the communal bank for 18 loan terms and she is very happy in her communal bank.

Tany’s goal is to buy a little truck to bring the spare parts from other cities.

loans.use: To buy automotive spare parts.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar I. is 56 years old.  Anvar has been raising sheep for the last five years.  Over the years of his activities, two of his children have become adults and now help him as well as his wife.  Currently, Anvar has 15 heads of the sheep in the household which help to generate stable profits. 

Now Anvar is planning to purchase more sheep and fodder for his family's business.  For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN.  He will use it to purchase 20 sheep.  This is the first loan for Anvar and he is grateful to everyone for trusting him and supporting him and promises not to let you down.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Tarif

texts.en: Tarif Q. is 40 years old. He is married and has two sons. Tarif has been running his business for three years.  He sells office supplies in his shop.  The business generates significant income for the family allowing him to improve the living conditions.  Today Tarif is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN.  He plans to spend the loan to purchase new goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to increase profits

loans.name: Iris Yolanda

texts.es:
la señora Iris Yolanda C. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la Aldea El Corinto de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta casada con el sr. Julio Cesar Nuñez. Iris tiene tres años de dedicarse al comercio cuenta con una pulperia y tiene 17 años de vivir en dicha Aldea.
La señora Iris utilizara el credito para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
su meta es poder tener bien acondicionado su negocio y con mucha variedad de productos. 
nos comento que se siente feliz porque siente que su negocio va creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en: Mrs. Iris Yolanda C. is 34 years old and lives in Aldea El Corinto in the city of San Lorenzo. She is married to Mr.Julio Cesar Nuñez. For three years Iris has worked in commerce in a grocery store and has lived in the Aldea village.  Mrs. Iris will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. Her goal is to have her business well stocked with a wide variety of products. She tells us that she is happy because she feels her business will continue to grow little by little.

loans.use: Purchase soda, salt, rice, beans, cornmeal, eggs, butter, sugar, sauces, spaghetti, matches, candles, and batteries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estela Mariaca

texts.es: Estela Maria tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio en una tienda. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, siempre ha sido una madre responsable con sus dos hijos que son menores de edad. Inicio este negocio por la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos para su hogar ella es una madre responsable y trabajadora y que disfruta mucho de  su trabajo al interactuar con sus clientes. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida su familia.
texts.en: Estela Maria is 45 years old.  Her economic activity is offering the service of a store. She has worked in this business for more than 16 years. She has always been a responsible mother with her 2 minor children, She started this this business out of need to look a source of income for her home. She is a responsible and hard-working woman who who really enjoys her work when interacting with her customers. This loan is to buy materials such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and sheets, among other things. She dreams of improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mirkhasan

texts.en: Mirkhasan S., 50, owns a little grocery store in the local market where he sells a variety of goods.  Mirkhasan, together with his wife, have two children to support.  Mirkhasan has asked for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more grocery products, allowing him to expand his offerings and to increase his inventory. He believes that this will allow him to reach a wider customer base so he can increase his income to help provide for his family.  Mirkhasan looks forward to seeing the results of this investment and hopes that his family can become more economically secure for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Nancy Leticia

texts.es:
Nancy de 41 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Ella hace trabajos de computación en su casa y alquila la computadora a las personas del sector donde vive para tener mas ingresos. 

Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus tres hijos ella comenzó a ser un estudio en su barrio de la necesidad de las personas del sector y vio que ellos buscaban lugares para hacer investigaciones por Internet. Decidió comprar una computadora y dar los servicios de computación y alquilarla poco a poco pudo comprar una impresora para imprimir los trabajos. En la actualidad ella trabaja desde las 14h00pm hasta las 18h30pm porque a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela y ella tiene tiempo para atender a sus clientes. La hora de Internet la da a $ 0.50, las impresiones con investigaciones a $ 1.00. Con el tiempo que tiene haciendo trabajos ha podido comprar un dispositivo de recargas celulares para tener otro ingreso adicional. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una computadora para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber en su casa y darle mas oportunidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy, 41, lives in a canton called Playas one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations with a wide range of seafood.  She does computer jobs at home and rents her computer to people in the area as a source of extra income.

To help her husband meet their three children’s expenses she did a study in her neighborhood to see what folks in the area needed and she discovered that what they wanted was someplace to do research on the Internet.  She decided to buy a computer and provide computer services and to rent computer time.  Little by little she was able to add a printer to print out the assignments.  

She is currently open for business from 2pm to 6:30pm because that’s the time her children are in school and she has time to take care of customers.  She charges $0.50 per hour of Internet time, printing research costs $1.00.  With the time she’s been in business she’s been able to buy a cell phone recharging base as still another source of income.

She wants to use the loan to buy another computer to provide improved customer service and earn more income.  In the future she’d like to have an Internet café in her house to provide better economic opportunity for her children.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Doracy

texts.en:
Doracy moved to the US with hopes of replicating the lingerie store that she owned in Brazil. After attempting door to door selling for a time, she was able to save enough money to open her own storefront in 2006. She also expanded her business to include a thriving online shop. She has continued to grow her business to include formal dresses which she sells most of during graduation season. 

This is Doracy’s fifth loan with ACCION USA. She used her previous loan to move her business to a better location which greatly improved her business. With her new loan she wants to purchase more merchandise to prepare for the Christmas season.  This is her busiest season and she wants to be fully stocked for the holiday rush. 

Moving forward, Doracy hopes to continue to grow her business and eventually open a second store and perhaps move into a mall. Her goal for this upcoming year is to see her daughter graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid A. is 36 years old. He is married with two children. Seven years ago, Farid, with his mechanic skills, started to do work for his neighbours and acquaintances.  He learned these skills at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business. 

With faith and enthusiasm, his auto-mechanic business started to grow little by little. Villagers who use machines for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him.  Now, Farid is finding that the tools he has are not enough to work at his job with full speed.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan of 1000 AZN.  This loan will be use to buy tools and materials used to repair cars.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials used to repair cars

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: Lupe tiene 39 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en casa D. sus padres. DesD. hace 1 año se dedica a L. venta D. leña así como a L. venta D. panes, es así que logra afrontar los costos D. su hogar. DesD. entonces se levanta D. madrugada para vender pan, ni bien salen del horno los distribuye a las bodegas D. su comunidad, es por ello que día a día se esfuerza en elaborar pan D. calidad al gusto D. sus clientes. Asimismo dentro D. esta actividad contrata a una persona que sabe preparar L. masa, mientras elL. se encarga D. terminar el proceso, D. esa manera termina D. hornear L. cantidad D. pan que al día se venD.. En cuanto a L. venta D. leña compra por troncos, en el que los manda a cortar para luego ser vendidos; generalmente esta venta lo realiza los fines D. semana. Lo que más anheL. es mejorar su panificadora, para ello necesitara D. maquinarias más sofisticadas y pueda elaborar pan en corto tiempo y en cantidad. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que L. consideran como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. troncos al por mayor y para que pueda incrementar su capital D. trabajo y poder establecerse en este negocio.
texts.en:
Lupe, 39, lives with her three children in her parents’ house.  For the last year she has sold firewood as well as bread; this is how she meets household expenses.  

She rises at dawn to sell bread to stores in her area as soon as it comes out of the oven; she works hard to produce quality bread for her customers’ enjoyment.  She hires a person who knows how to prepare the dough while she finishes the rest of the process thereby making just the right amount of bread she sells daily.

With respect to the firewood sales, she buys tree trunks that she has cut for subsequent sale.  These sales are usually done on the weekend.

Her greatest wish is to improve her bakery; to do so she needs more sophisticated machinery to bake the bread in quantity and more quickly.

This is her 8th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she’s considered to be a responsible person with respect to repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are mutually supportive.

She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting because it will be very useful for the progress of her business.

She will use the requested loan to buy tree trunks at wholesale in order to increase her working capital and become established in this type of business.

loans.use: To buy tree trunks to make firewood.

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
el señor Jose Balbino R. C. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Denia Elizabeth Colindres tienen cinco hijos.
Jose y su familia viven en la aldea Altos de la Cruz desde hace 1 año y se dedican a la elaboracion y venta de ladrillos y tejas, dicho producto se elabora con tierra, barro  para luego ser quemado en un horno a base de fuego con leña.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima y continuar elaborando ladrillos y tejas para lograr tener mas utilidades y por ende darles una mejor calidad vida a su familia.
su meta es comprarse un mejor vehiculo para transportar el producto.
texts.en:
Mr. José Balbino R. C. is 34 years old and married to Mrs. Denia Elizabeth Colindres. They have five children. José and his family have lived in Altos de la Cruz for a year and work making and selling bricks and tiles. They make these products with dirt and clay and then bake them in a wood-burning stove.

He will use the loan to buy materials to keep making brick and tile to have more profits and give his family a better quality of life. His goal is to buy a vehicle to transport his products.

loans.use: Fo buy firewood, dirt, and clay

loans.name: Hacia El Futuro 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Elliot es uno de los miembros del Grupo Hacia el futuro  1, 2 y 3, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, artesanía, Cosmeticos, etc; en la ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores de pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depende de la Zona franca, la industria del cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo. Este asociado de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenía la necesidad de trabajar para superarse.

Elliot eS.á muy emocionado de recibir su Tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. El ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 6 años, el cual inició con un pequeño préstamo que pudo conseguir y comenzo a pintar y vender cuadros en la playa de Boca Chica, eS.á planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de productos cosmeticos por catalogo y adquirir materiales como pintura, telas y y marcos para realizar cuadros de todos los tamaños. El va a utilizar sus ganancias para inicial un negocio de venta de productos de comunicacióny crear un buen negocio para su futuro y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Elliot is one of the members of the Grupo Hacia el futuro 1, 2, and 3 (Toward the Future Group). They are small-business owners who work selling clothing, natural products, shoes, art, cosmetics, etc. in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its ball players and sugar industry. Their current economic success is dependent upon the Zona Franca, the cement industry, and other smaller operations such as tourism. This group member from Esperanza joined us because he needed to work to get ahead.

Elliot is very excited to receive his third loan through Esperanza Internacional (International Hope) after having satisfactorily repaid his previous loans and taking steps toward growing his business. He has had his business for around six years, and he started it with a small loan when he began to paint and sell his paintings at the Boca Chica beach. He is planning to inveS. his new loan in purchasing cosmetics through a catalog and buying supplies like paint, fabric, and frames to make paintings of all sizes. He is going to use his earnings to start a business selling telephones and create a good business for his future and for his family’s future.

loans.use: Cosmetics and paintings

loans.name: Juana Rafaela

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de edad avanzada, con un pequeño negocio la venta de ropa usada y venta de carne de cerdo, pues lleva ya varios años vendiendo, en donde ha logrado ayudar  a su familia.siendo sus hijos todos casados.

Con prestamos en Afodenic logro levantar su casa de paredes de concreto lo que le satisface porque está en mejores condiciones de seguridad, ya que la delincuencia es un problema en el país.
Lo que hará con este financiamiento es comprar el material que le hace falta para poder pegar su cerámica a su casa, que gran parte ya la tiene comprada y desea mejorar las condiciones de higiene como de vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana is an elderly woman with a small business selling used clothing and pork. She has been selling for many years and has been able to help her family. All of her children are married.

With loans from Afodenic she was able to build her house with concrete walls and she is satisfied because it is safer now, and delinquency is a problem in her country. With this loan, she will buy the supplies needed to glue the tile in her home. She has already purchased most of it, and desires to improve the hygiene in the home as well as the home in general.

loans.use: To finish buying tile and materials to glue the tile in her living room

loans.name: Elcira

texts.en:
Elcira is part of the communal bank “Progreso y Esfuerzo” (Struggle and Progress) and resides by the commune Lo Espejo.  For the past three years, Elcira operates a small shop offering a variety of products (cosmetics, school supplies, toiletries) along with her husband.  With this loan Elcira will purchase merchandise such as school supplies, sweet candies, soft drinks, and toiletries.  Elcira dreams of expanding her business by offering more merchandise to offer for her clients.

With the support of the loans received by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, Elcira has been able to grow her business.  Elcira has also been very pleased to participate in the group meetings, where she held the position as delegate.  

Lo Espejo is a municipality located in the southwest sector of the metropolitan area (Santiago, the capital of Chile).  It is recognized as the most densely populated commune in Chile since the sixteen century.  Its population is mainly the lower middle class.  In the country's capital, Lo Espejo has been the focus of social and economic activities.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as school supplies, soft drinks, and snacks, etc.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin Y. is 28 years old. He is married and has two children.  Shahin is a market vendor.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years.  During these years Shahin has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruit so that it keeps its marketable condition and does not lose taste and useful properties.  Shahin buys vegetables and fruit from the local farmers.  In the market, he is known among people because of the attractive prices and his friendly nature.  This allows Shahin’s business to generate stable and considerable income for his family.  Due to the season, Shahin’s now wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.  He will sell them later when the price will increase.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: La Casita De Juan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama la casita de Juan, porque no se ponían de acuerdo con el nombre de grupo, entonces le pusieron el nombre del esposo de la señora María Gloria, que fue la que organizó el grupo. El cual está ubicado en Cuautla de Morelos en México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. María Gloria Cabrera, es tesorera del grupo, tiene 44 años de edad, vende productos Jafra y es líder de un grupo de vendedoras, tiene 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a esto desde hace 8. Su esposo el señor Juan Castañeda es agricultor y se dedica a la siembra de gladiola. Ella se ha beneficiado con esta actividad, ya que con esto han hecho mejoras a su casa gracias a los ingresos que ha tenido, además de satisfacciones dado que por su buen desempeño ha ganado varios reconocimientos y premios, como viajes a Cancún, Acapulco, y el que nunca olvidara es el que gano a la ciudad de París Francia, ya que dice que por su situación económica, jamás le habría alcanzado para que ella algún día hubiera visitado esos lugares. Utiliza su crédito para invertir en productos y siempre tener lo que los clientes le pidan.
texts.en: This group is called La casita de Juan (Juan’s Little House) because the group could not agree on a name, and so they chose the name of Mrs. María Gloria’s husband, the one who organized the group.   It is located in Cuatla de Morelos in Mexico.  The group is made up of 10 members.  María Gloria Cabrera is the group’s treasurer.  She is 44 years old, sells Jafra products, is the leader of a group of saleswomen, and has two children.  She has done this work for eight years.  Her husband, Mr. Juan Castañeda, is a farmer and works cultivating gladiola.  She has benefited from this work, as they have made improvements to their house thanks to her income.  In addition to feeling pride for her hard work, she has also earned a lot of  recognition and prizes such as trips to Cancun, Acapulco, and the one she will never forget was the trip she won to Paris, France.  She says that because of her economic situation, she never would have thought she would be able to visit those places.  She will use the loan to buy products and to always have what her customers request.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Miguel Antonio Z. A. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en union libre señora Maria Leonarda Rodriguez con quien a procreado 4 hijos, Miguel y su familia viven en la colonia 18 de Diciembre de la comunidad de San Lorenzo desde hace 18 años.
Miguel se dedica a la elaboracion de tejas y ladrillos que se utilizan para construccion de casas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace unos tres años y tiene la ayuda de dos hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de tierra y barro para elaborar el ladrillo y las tejas.
su meta es poder tener una mayor produccion para asi tener mayores ganancias, las cuales necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Antonio Z. A. is 37 years old and lives with Mrs. Maria Leonarda Rodriguez. They have four children. Miguel and his family have lived in the 18 de Diciembre neighborhood in the community of San Lorenzo for 18 years.

Miguel works making tile and bricks used in housing construction. He has done this for three years and two of his children help him. He will use the loan to buy dirt and clay for making bricks and tile. His goal is to increase production and earnings, which he needs to cover the family’s expenses and to provide his children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy dirt and firewood

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín es hombre dedicado al trabajo para dar a su familia lo mejor. Tiene un hermoso hijo, que junto con su esposa apoyan a su educación.
Hoy en día labora como oficial de inspección, siendo ya muchos años en esta labor, empezando por vocación, y aplique al examen lo cual he logrado escalar.

Atreves de los préstamos en Afodenic es que ha  mejorado su vivienda, ya que lleva once ciclos de los cuales se ha beneficiado grandemente, siendo el medio más viable para el por los plazos. 
Con este préstamo mejora el techo de su casa, comprando láminas de zinc, y cuartones de madera para hacer este cambio. Planes a futuro es seguir logrando las mejoras a su casa para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Efraín is a man who is dedicated to his job in order to provide the best for his family.  He has a beautiful son whose education he and his wife support.

He’s employed as an Inspection Officer, a job he’s had for many years.  “Starting as a vocation, I applied to take the exam and have managed to rise.”

Through Afodenic loans he has made home improvements since he’s been in 11 cycles that have been of great benefit to achieve these improvements.

Plans for the future are to continue to make home improvements for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to improve the house replacing the old roof.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora Maria Antonia tiene 29 años, desde hace mas de 2 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que su actividad es una farmacia que con mucho esmero y esfuerzo logro prosperar con este medio de vida. Ella enfrenta desafíos muy grandes ya que actualmente se encuentra embarazada pues ha sido difícil el realizar este trabajo como es atender a sus clientes pues el algo agotador, pero sus energías las conserva porque sabe que tiene alimentar a su familia. por lo que viene a trabajar todos los días temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
texts.en: Maria Antonia is 29 years old. She has had this business for more than 2 years. Her activity is a pharmacy. With a lot of hard work and effort she has been able to prosper with this way of life. She is facing big challenges since she is pregnant now and it has been difficult to do the work. Serving the customers is somewhat tiring, but she saves her energy because she knows she has to attend to her family. She comes to work early every day at t in the morning and stays until 6 in the evening.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Norma Adilia

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer trabajadora, que gracias a su tenacidad y financiamiento con la institución ha mejorado su vivienda. Madre de dos hijos. Casada.
Tiene su propio negocio la venta de cajeta en donde prepara día  a día estos dulces que se venden a diario. Así como también lava y plancha ajeno logrando captar más dinero, siendo de gran ayuda para sus hijos y la economía de su familia, ya que su esposo también labora en operaciones de servicios.
Ha sido atreves de Afodenic que ha logrado las mejoras, lo que le satisface estar en mejores condiciones de techo, con el crédito anterior logro la división de los cuartos. Y con este pondrá piso ya que aun es de tierra, lo que comprara: Arena, cemento, piso y comenzar. El cual será de gran higiene.
texts.en:
Norma is a hard working woman who, thanks to her tenacity and financing from the Institution, has managed to make home improvements.  She’s married and has two children.

She has her own business making caramel that she makes to sell daily.  She also takes in washing and ironing to earn extra income knowing what a help this is for her children and her family’s economy.  Her husband is also employed in service operations.

Home improvements have been possible thanks to Afodenic loans.  The previous loan was used build interior walls to divide rooms.  This loan will be used to install a floor since the current floor is still dirt.  She will buy: paving stones, sand and cement and get started.  This will be more healthy.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies like: paving stones, cement, sand and others.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María es una pequeña comerciante que ha venido trabajando, con financiamiento para lograr la inversión de su pulpería. Que inicio desde hace varios años lo cual lo hizo con apoyo de su esposo.

Lo que necesita es invertir más en productos de alimentos, ya que es el que se vende más. Con los préstamos ha venido creciendo ya que comenzó con poco lo que Afodenic ha sido una puerta a su economía. 
Lo que comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bidón de aceite, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosas. Logrando así vender más y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is a small businesswoman who has been working with loans to achieve success with her grocery store.  She started it several years ago with help from her husband.

What she needs most is to invest in more food items because these are her best sellers.  With loans she has been growing because she started out with very little and Afodenic has been a pathway to better economy.

She will buy: rice, beans, sugar, a large container of cooking oil, dairy products, sweets and soft drinks thereby attaining better sales and meeting customer demand.

loans.use: To buy basic grains like: rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, sweets and others thus obtaining better sales.

loans.name: Pasuc Group

texts.es: Don Domingo Lorenzo J. Ajin, es una persona ha cursado el sexto grado primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual   esta a su cargo, el se dedica a la confección, elaboración de camisas y  pants, tiene 20 años  ya con este trabajo. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo de 4 personas 3 mujeres y 1 hombre, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar: la Artesanía elaboración de playeras, Camisas  y blusas,  y crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo lo utilizarán para compra de materia prima tela e hilo, espera lograr mejorar sus ingresos y su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo Lorenzo J. Ajin finished 6th grade.  He has a S. in his care.  He is a craftsman.  He makes shirts and pants.  He’s been in this business for 20 years.

With enthusiasm and help from some of his neighbors a group was organized to seek a loan.  The communal bank is called “Pasuc” (Guatemalan place name) and has four women members.

They are involved in a variety of activities among which we can mention the following: crafts, clothes making, raising domestic animals.

She will use the loan to buy animals to raise and increase sales.

One of the difficulties involved with being the owner of a business is lack of capital.  She hopes to get better profits.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es: Hilda se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 32 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha sido de gran provecho esta oportunidad que tuvo al trabajar con créditos. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia, por lo que tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan sus frutas muy frescas. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de inventario pues es necesario para mantener a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere mejorar su espacio en donde coloca los diferentes productos que ofrece y llamar la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda sells fruits and vegetables.  She’s been in this business for over 32 years.  Being able to have the opportunity to work with these loans has been of great use to her.

The business if very helpful for her family’s support.  She has a wide variety of customers who request her very fresh fruit.

The reason for the loan is to buy more stock inventory to retain her customers.

In the future she’d like to improve the space where she displays her products and attract her customers’ attention.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Alexandra Judith

texts.es:
Alexandra de 32 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de accesorios cristianos. 

Ella asiste a una iglesia evangélica desde hace años y por eso decidió tener un pequeño negocio en la parte delantera de su casa de venta de accesorios cristianos. Vende cd, accesorios, biblias, camisas cristianas en su pequeña tienda, trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 16h00am de lunes a domingo. Para tener otro ingreso adicional ya que ayuda a sus padres económicamente trabaja en una empresa de atún llamada (NIRSA) en turnos rotativos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar biblias, accesorios, camisas para su negocio cristiano. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio de ropa interior y seguir ayudando a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 32, lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations with a wide variety of seafood.  She has a small store that sells Christian items.

She has been a member of an evangelical church for several years and this led her to set up a small business in the front part of her house selling Christian accessories.  She stocks CDs, accessories, Bibles and Christian shirts in her store.  She works from 7:30am until 6pm Monday through Sunday.  In order to have an additional source of income, because she helps her parents economically, she also works in a tuna processing plant, called NIRSA, on rotating shifts.

She will use the loan to buy Bibles, accessories and shirts for her Christian store.  In the future she’d like to have an underwear store and to continue helping her parents economically.

loans.use: For CDs, Bibles and t-shirts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 57 años, vive con sus hijos de 19 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años ella se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y a la venta de animales menores como cuyes y pollos, con lo que ha logrado establecerse económicamente. Por otro lado ha comprado vacas, de las cuales les extrae la leche, otra forma más de generarse ingresos diaR.. Asimismo vende animales en las ferias comerciales de los pueblos aledaños a su localidad y los fines de semana en las ferias ganaderas. Por tanto procura tener la cantidad de animales en su granja, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo cuanto tiene tiempo libre, ya que gracias a este negocio María ha logrado educar a sus hijos, así como cubrir las necesidades dentro de su hogar. Sin embargo hay momento de ventas baja, pero eso no le desanima ya que una de sus características es saber convencer a su clientes al momento de comprar su mercadería. Ahora lo que más desea es aumentar su capital de trabajo y continuar progresando. Es el crédito número 11 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, puesto que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidaria. Asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para aplicar en su cultivo de alfalfa, ya que le servirá como forraje para sus animales.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives with her 19-year-old sons in her own house.  For 20 years she has been farming and raising small farm animals, like guinea pigs and chickens, thus becoming economically established.
