On the other hand, she has purchased cows whose milk is another source of daily income.  She also sells animals on market days in neighboring communities as well as at weekend livestock fairs.

She, therefore, always tries to have a good quantity of animals on her farm.  Her son helps her in his spare time and thanks to this business María has managed to educate her children as well as to cover household needs.

However, sometimes sales decrease but this does not discourage her since one of her characteristics is knowing how to convince her customers to buy her merchandise.  What she most wants now is to increase her working capital in order to continue making progress.

This is her 11th loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she’s known to be a responsible person with respect to repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are mutually supportive.

She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s asking for that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure to use on her alfalfa crops which will serve as forage for her animals.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure to use on her alfalfa crops.

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es: El grupo   la Vecindad del Cinco está conformado por 7 miembros los cuales todos se dedican al comercio minoritario como venta de ropa bodegas etc., tiene formado hace mas de 7 años los cuales han hecho una labor extraordinaria con las ganancias de las prestaciones. Un caso en particular es el de la señora Beatriz B., con 39 años de edad sale adelante cada día con su negocio de venta ambulatoria de ropa, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones como los estudios de sus 4 hijos en el colegio, alimentos, vestimenta y un techo donde vivir. Con el presente préstamo piensa invertirlo en comprar  prendas de vestir para el verano y ahorrar para la compra futura de una maquina cortadora de tela, el cual le seria de mucha ayuda en su negocio. Cada integrante del  grupo  la vecindad del cinco tiene un desempeño laboral distinto. Pero todos coinciden en la dedicación  y el esfuerzo que dan todos los días para progresar  y salir a delante.
texts.en:
The “Vecindad del Cinco” (Neighborhood of the Five) has seven members who are all retailers.  They sell clothes and groceries, for example.  It has been in operation for over 7 years and they have done an extraordinary job with profits from the loans.

One case in particular is Mrs. Beatriz Bazán, 39.  She goes out every day with her ambulatory clothing sales business.  This business has brought her many benefits, like being able to educate her four children, providing food, clothing and a roof over their heads.

She plans to use the present loan to buy summer clothes and to save up to buy a fabric cutting machine in the future that will be very helpful for her business.

Every member of the group has a different job but they all agree on dedication and daily effort to make progress and continue to move forward.

loans.use: To buy summer clothes.

loans.name: La Buena Union 1 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Martha es una D. L. miembros del Grupo La buena union  1 y 3, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos misceláneos, zapatos, artesanía,  etc.  Sus plazas se encuentran en la ciudad D. Hato Mayor, una ciudad dedicada a la agricultura al noreste del pais.  Está asociada D. Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenia el deseo D. invertir en su negocio y le hacia falta capital. Es madre soltera con 3 hijos, D. L. cuales 2 aun viven con ella, por L. que se esfuerza y se dedica a trabajar. Nos dice que su reto mas dificil ha sido criar a sus hijos, pero que a la ve disfruta cuidarle y tambien asistir a la iglesia.

Martha está muy emocionada D. recibir su Tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después D. haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento D. su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 2 años, el cual inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra D. Shampoo, Acondicionador, y otros cosmeticos.  Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para ir construyendo su casa ya que su sueño es poder vivir tranquila y en una buena casa junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión 1 y 2” (The Good Union 1 & 2) communal bank.  They are micro entrepreneurs who are in clothing sales, sales of assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc.  Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

This Esperanza associate started with us because she wanted to invest in her business and she lacked capital.  She’s a single mother of three children, two of whom still live with her and for whom she strives to work hard.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been raising her children although she enjoys caring for them and attending church.

Martha is very excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward her business’s growth.  She has had her business for about 2 years; she started it with her first Esperanza loan.

She will use this new loan to buy shampoo, hair conditioner and other cosmetics and will use profits to gradually build her house since her dream is to live in peace with her children in a good house.

loans.use: For shampoo, conditioner and others.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene experiencia en las ventas desD. hace  9 años, pero hace 2 que decidió incursionar en L. venta D. animales ovino, por lo que los compra en los establos  alejados D. L. zona rural debido al bajo precio que son adquiridos, para luego revenderlos a un precio competitivo en el mercado y en las ferias ganaderas D. su ciudad. Paralelamente a este trabajo, durante los días D. semana se dedica a vender anticuchos (una comida típica D. su zona) y cuya venta lo hace en L. esquina D. su casa, en ocasiones en L. feria D. pelea D. gallos que  hay en su zona. Durante este tiempo D. trabajo ha visto L. rentabilidad que tiene gracias a L. venta D. animales, es por ello que desea incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Es el crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además asegura que será muy responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas. Le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias, asimismo a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo, puesto que le será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para incrementar su capital D. trabajo, como el D. adquirir más animales, D. L. misma manera desea comprar carbón para L. venta D. anticuchos.
texts.en:
Marisol is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She has nine years of experience in sales. Two years ago she decided to venture into selling sheep because they can be purchased for a low price in the remote stables in the rural area, then resold at a competitive price in the market and in the livestock fairs in the city. Along with this work, during the week days she sells kebabs (a local dish) on the corner where she lives as well as at cockfights that take place in her area.  

During the time she has worked, she has seen that selling sheep is profitable, so she wants to increase her working capital. This is her 15th loan with MFP, and she is really happy to know that she has financial support. In addition, she assures that she will be reliable with her payments. She is pleased to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are very supportive. She is grateful to all those people who make the loan possible for it will be very useful for the progress of her business.
 
She will use the requested loan to increase her working capital and invest in more livestock and in charcoal for the sale of the kebobs.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es: Doña Rosa es casada, tiene 47 años D. edad  se dedica a la Tejeduría (Elaboración D. Cortes Típicos), cuenta con 25 años D. antigüedad, su esposo quien es D.  gran apoyo para ella juntos han  logrado salir adelante. Viendo la necesidad D. un capital para incrementar la producción. Se reúnen con otras mujeres y solicitan financiamiento en ASDIR conformando el Banco Comunal llamado Ebenezer, integrado por diez señoras, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades. El destino del crédito Rosa lo usara para comprar materia prima y así  incrementar las ventas como también las ganancias. Lo que anhela es tener más operarios y  que su negocio sea también fuente D. empleo.
texts.en: Rosa is married and is 47 years old.  She has worked as a weaver (making traditional Guatemalan skirts) for 25 years.  Together with her husband, who is her greatest support, she has managed to get ahead.  Seeing the need for capital to increase her business, she met with other women and requested a loan from ASDIR.  Her communal bank is called Ebenezer, and it includes 10 women who are engaged in a variety of businesses.  Rosa will use this loan to buy raw materials so that she can increase her sales and also her earnings.  She would like to have more employees, so that her business could become a source of employment.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un ganadero, tiene 46 años vive junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos, reside en un lugar llamado las mercedes en el sauce. Él se dedica desde 20 años al trabajo de venta y compra de ganado por que su padre siempre se dedico a este oficio, pues lo desempeña muy bien, además cuando hay muchos gastos en su familia pues es un padre muy responsable. Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganando que es solicitado por sus clientes.
Él se proyecta a futuro con más oportunidades de crecer como ganadero y que sus hijos tengan acceso a la educación para que mejoren sus condiciones de vida en el futuro.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is a rancher. He is 46 years old and lives with his wife and their six children. He lives in an area called Las Mercedes in El Sauce. For 20 years, he has bought and sold livestock because his father was in this line of work, so he does it well. Also, there are a lot of expenses in his family, so he is a very responsible father. He is seeking a loan to purchase livestock for his customers. In the future, he hopes to have more opportunities to grow as a rancher and hopes that his children have access to education to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
Marlon es un joven con deseo de superación, trabajador que ha logrado mantener su pequeño negocio de venta de accesorios de celular y una variedad que le ha invertido atreves del financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, siendo una oportunidad para el crecimiento de su pequeño negocio.

El cual solo comenzó con la venta de películas y músicas, ahorro de su trabajo como albañil. Hoy en día solo se dedica al negocio, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa, la cual vende enchiladas, tacos y refrescos por las tardes, y  así equilibran los gastos.
Con este préstamo comprara: accesorios para celulares, controles de tv, calculadoras, películas y música para aumentar de inventario, mejorar las ventas  siendo más rentable.
texts.en: Marlon is a young man who desires to get ahead. He is a hard worker who has established a small business selling cellular accessories. He achieved this using the funding from Afodenic, as it was an opportunity to grow his small business. He started off just selling movies and music with savings from his job as a mason. Today he only works at his own business, with the help of his wife. She sells enchiladas, tacos, and refreshments in the afternoons, thus sharing the costs. With this loan, he will buy cellular accessories, TV remotes, calculators, movies, and music to augment his stock, improve his sales, and be more profitable.

loans.use: Cellular accessories, movies, and videos

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: Doña Patricia, es casada, tiene 47 años D. edad,  se dedica a la vender productos D. belleza, venD. en el mercado D. salcajá todos los días, tiene 16 años D. vender, lo cual ha sido una fuentre D. ingresos para ella. Necesitando capital para comprar  mercadería y siendo una persona con liderazgo reúne a otras once mujeres para solicitar crédito en ASDIR formando un Banco Comunal el cual lo llaman Los Girasoles. La mayoría D. las señoras tienen negocios los cuales son ambulantes y ellas al igual que doña Pattricia sueñan con lograr adquirir un local propio para agrandar el negocio que tiene y asi loghrar mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Patricia is married, 47 years old, and works selling beauty products in the Salcajá market every day. She has been in sales for 16 years, and this has been a source of income for her. She needs capital to buy merchandise, and being that she is a leader, she joined with eleven other women to apply for a loan from ASDIR. They formed a communal bank called "Los Girasoles" [The Sunflowers]. The majority of these women have traveling businesses, and like Patricia, they dream of establishing stores of their own to expand their businesses and improve their incomes.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 45 años, está separada de su esposo hace ya 11 años y como madre luchadora y tenaz cuida de sus 2 hijos; Noe de 18 y Brigit de 15 años, a los que cuida y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). Hace más de 2 años que cuida de Yeraldine de tan solo 3 años de edad; ya que su madre murió producto de una enfermedad, ahora sola y con muchas responsabilidades Teodosia pudo salir adelante. Cada día agradece a Dios; ya que en los últimos meses adquirió una pequeño local donde pueda vender los ricos platos de comida que cocina; está actividad le resulta rentable a ella; los pobladores conocen de su exquisito sabor, pues antes vendía en una esquina de la plaza principal de su comunidad. Ahora con el apoyo de su banco comunal, desea conseguir materiales para su nuevo restaurante; su mayor anhelo es establecerse y triunfar con lo que más le gusta que es cocinar. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y agradece a su banco comunal por apoyarla y confiar en ella, y asegura que no los defraudará. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar sacos de arroz y azúcar para abastecer los insumos que requiere para la preparación de sus platos de comida.
texts.en: Teodosia is 45 and has been separated from her husband for 11 years now.  She is a persistent and tenacious mother and cares for her 2 children.  Noe is 18 and Brigit is 15.  She cares for them and raises them in her own house, which is located in the Peruvian desert (in the Las Palmas community).  She has also cared for Yeraldine, who is only 3, for 2 years.  Her mother died from an illness, so she was left alone.  With all of her responsibilities, Teodosia was able to get ahead.  Every day she thanks God.  In recent months, she acquired a small location where she can sell delcious dishes of food that she cooks.  This activity is profitable for her.  The townspeople know her delicious flavors because she used to sell her food on a corner of the main plaza in the community.  Now with the support of her communal bank, she hopes to obtain materials for her new restaurant.  Her biggest dream is to establish herself and triumph with what she likes to do most:  cooking.  This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is thankful to her communal bank for supporting and trusting her.  She knows that she will not disappoint them.  With the credit that she will receive, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar since she needs them as supplies to make her dishes.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and other products to continue preparing food.

loans.name: Rick

texts.en:
Rick and Alaycia are the owners of The Pampered Pet Boutique – a mom-and-pop pet supply store. They got the idea for the business after adopting their dog Chopper in 2006 and quickly realizing that there was nowhere in town to buy the pet accessories they wanted. Rick, who had spent 18 years as a store manager for a big company, knew he had the experience necessary to open their own store to fill that gap. “Having my own business is something I’ve always wanted, and I had been thinking about for years,” said Rick. 
 
 Rick and Alaycia have adjusted their store to the needs of the town, as well as the economy. A couple years ago they shifted their focus from pet accessories and expanded the store to include a grooming salon. The Pampered Pet Boutique has since won their city’s “Best of the Best” award two years in a row, and the couple intends to defend their title as long as they can. “We’re offering a service and want to make sure that pets are going home in the best condition possible. Regardless of how the economy is doing, people treat their pets like family,” says Rick. 
 
The Pampered Pet Boutique has over 2,000 clients, so the dryers, clippers, and tubs are always busy. Rick and Alaycia used their own money to start the business and now need capital to maintain their equipment and continue operating. But despite their success, their bank turned them away due to tight lending standards in the credit crunch. 
 
Rick discovered Opportunity Fund through the City of Tracy, which was trying to help its small business owners. With a $5,000 loan they will be able to upgrade old equipment and continue to build up their credit. “I had no idea that there were non-profit groups out there lending to small businesses, so I’m really appreciative of this chance,” Rick said.
 
To find out more about the The Pampered Pet Boutique, visit: www.pamperedpettracy.com

loans.use: Repair and upgrade old equipment and build up business credit

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, the owner of Top Nail in Gilroy, California, enthusiastically states that the relationships she cultivates with her customers are the best part of owning her own salon. “I have owned this salon for three years, and my customers are like a part of my family. I am very lucky.” 
 
Ngoc, who moved to the U.S. from Vietnam in 1995, has been a manicurist for the past ten years. She first began working at Top Nail in 2004, and within three years was able to purchase the salon from its previous owner. Since then, she has successfully managed the business and her four employees. Ngoc enjoys strong ties with her loyal customers, and sees a considerable amount of new business from pedestrians strolling past her nail salon, located in Gilroy’s Historic District. 
 
Ngoc has reached out to the Latina community in her area by specializing in a unique style of nail design, which she learned about when a customer brought her back a catalog from Mexico. She has also begun learning Spanish so that she can more easily converse with her clients. 
 
A $4,500 loan, Ngoc’s first from Opportunity Fund, will help her to make important electrical renovations to her salon that will allow her to install additional equipment and better serve her clients. “This loan will help me a lot right now,” says Ngoc, “and as the economy improves I’ll be able to make more improvements to my business. I want to upgrade my front door next.” Looking further down the line, Ngoc has even bigger dreams: “I’d like to be able to open another salon in a town nearby.”

loans.use: Make electrical renovations to her salon and allow her to install extra equipment

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and their child in their own home in Caserio de Porcon Bajo in the district of Cajamarca. Her community is primarily rural with the majority of the population working in agriculture.

Maria operates a small general store out of her home, in which she sells items to meet basic needs such as soap, cooking supplies, rice, beans, flour, beverages, etc. In addition to the store, she raises cattle on her property and sells them in local markets for their meat. Maria has been involved in these businesses for the last four years. She tells us that the demand for her store is steadily growing and customers often ask her for items she doesn’t have.

This is Maria’s first loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional merchandise in order to expand the selection she offers to her customers in her store. She believes that by increasing her offerings she will be able to draw more customers and solidify her clientele.

Maria is an incredibly hardworking woman and dedicated mother. She is well recommended by neighbors and authorities in the area. She plans to continue reinvesting her profits into her business in order to realize growth as soon as possible. She hopes that she will be able raise sufficient income over the long term to provide for her child’s education and improve her family’s life style.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Ediomar

texts.en:
Ediomar A. M. is 26 years old. He lives with his wife and children in their own home in La Viña near the city of Cayaltí. This is a primarily rural area characterized by farms and animal raising.

Ediomar has been raising animals for over ten years. He is very experienced in the care and raising of various varieties of animals. He is well respected in the area for the quality of the meat he sells, his hard work and the support he provides for his neighbors.

Ediomar plans to use the loan to purchase additional animals in order to expand his herd and also to purchase a balanced feed. He hopes to be able to raise and sell a few of his animals during the holiday season when prices are higher. He hopes to be able to send his children to university one day and make improvements to his home.

The client has worked with our institution previously. He has a good record of repayment and presents sufficient income to manage this new loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals to expand his herd and also to purchase a balanced feed

loans.name: Violeta Roxana

texts.en:
Violeta Roxana C. M. is 31 years old. She lives with her 12-year-old son in her parents' home in the neighborhood of La Victoria. Although this is an urban zone, it is one of the poorest in the city of Chiclayo. The majority of the population makes a living in some form of urban subsistence, selling just enough on a daily basis to meet basic needs.

Violeta works as a street vendor in and around the Mercado A-Z, one of the smaller markets just outside of the city. She sells a wide variety of fruits. She follows seasonal crop offerings in selecting her merchandise. Violeta purchases the fruit from wholesalers in the area and then resells it at retail prices.  She has been running this business for three years.

This will be Violeta’s first loan. She has never worked with a financial institution before. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional fruit at greater discounts by making a large bulk purchase. She expects that this will increase her profit margin and enable her to reinvest a greater portion of her income in growing her daily inventory.

Violeta is well respected in her neighborhood and has good references. She has great dreams of helping her son complete school and become a professional. She hopes her business will continue to maintain the family and support her son in his ongoing education.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruit at greater discounts

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin R. S. is 37 years old. He lives with his partner and their three children in a rented home in La Victoria, one of the poorer neighborhoods of city of Chiclayo. His home has basic services, but the streets nearby remain unpaved, a situation he would like to see improved.

The family participates in a number of income generating activities. Martin´s partner manages a small general store out of the their home, in which she sells basic household items such as soap, dry foods and beverages. They own a mototaxi, which Martin drives on a daily basis in and around the city, transporting people to work, school and stores as needed. Further, Martin has a small plot of land just outside of La Victoria on which he raises crops.  This land is in Campiña Chacupe Bajo, Martin’s childhood home.

This will be Martin’s second credit with our institution. Martin is requesting the loan in order to purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices to expand the selection of the general store. He hopes that this will solidify the customer base and increase profits.

Martin and his family are well respected in the community. They are hard-working and dedicated to improving the lives of their children.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda, who is 40 years old and married, lives with her three adult children in a rural neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo. For the last ten years Hermelinda has sold chicken in the Mercado Modelo, one of the major markets in the city of Chiclayo. She purchases chickens from wholesalers and then processes the meat into appropriate sizes and cuts to sell to her customers at retail prices. In the photo, the chickens that are smaller and slightly darker come from the small farms of local individuals, while the ones that are larger and slightly lighter in color come from large scale factory farms. The small farm-raised chickens sell for a higher price due to their stronger flavor and more natural meat.

Hermelinda has already worked with our institution a number of times in the past, always making punctual payments and completing the requirements of the loan. Her previous loans have been for values between $200.00 and $250.00. This will be the largest loan she has yet undertaken, and she will use it to purchase a larger quantity of chicken from the wholesalers in order to receive a greater bulk discount. She expects to be able to increase her profit margin significantly by completing the bulk purchase, and hopes to be able to continue to improve her business and expand her clientele.

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity of chicken

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.en:
Maria, a 30-year-old single mother with a two-year-old daughter, lives in her parents' home along with her brothers and sisters. Her home, which is made of adobe and has limited access to utilities, is in Santa Rosa, a coastal city about 20 minutes from Chiclayo. Maria has lived there for 15 years.

For the last two years Maria has been selling beer and other beverages out of her home, purchasing her merchandise from wholesalers that pass through the area and then reselling her inventory at retail prices. This business yields a steady stream of income daily.

This will be Maria’s first loan with our institution. She plans to use the funds to expand her inventory and obtain greater discounts through bulk purchases. She hopes that the increase in income will allow her to grow her business and little by little improve the lifestyle of her family.

Maria is a very dedicated mother and is well-respected within the area. Her store is popular amongst the locals.

loans.use: To purchase additional beer and other beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase yuca and corn

loans.name: Gloria Sebastian

texts.en:
Gloria is 28 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Nanchoc in the region of Cajamarca. Nanchoc is a rural area in the mountains of northern Peru.

Gloria raises animals in order to earn additional income for the family. She purchases animals when they are young and then cares for them until they reach an appropriate size to be sold either for meat or for other purposes on other farms. Gloria has been involved in this business for over 10 years and is well known in the region.

Gloria has taken out loans from Edpyme Alternativa previously. She has a good record of repayment. She plans to use this current loan to continue to expand her business by purchasing additional animals and feed. The loan will be in the amount of S/. 1,000.00.

loans.use: Purchasing additional animals and feed

loans.name: Maria De Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar es una madre de familia de 24 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el Centro Poblado Menor Callanca del distrito de Monsefú, la zona se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección y bordado de manteles y faldas. Ella cuenta con una máquina de coser con la cual realiza su trabajo en base a pedidos. El trabajo requiere de mucha creatividad y paciencia. Su actividad cuenta con buena acogida debido a que las prendas que elabora están hechas con artículos de calidad y sus diseños son bastante bonitos. Su esposo trabaja como peón agrícola y adicionalmente comercializa cerdos. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben tratan siempre de salir adelante y progresar.

María desea adquirir algunos insumos para elaborar más bordados y además realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen en la zona le tienen mucha confianza y estima.
texts.en:
María del Pilar is a 24-year-old mother who lives with her husband and young son in the town of Menor Callanca in the district of Monsefú.  This area is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes a living by making embroidered tableclothes and skirts.  She has a sewing machine that she uses to do her work, for which she takes orders.  Her work requires a lot of creativity and patience.  Her work is well-received because the items she makes are of high quality, and her designs are very pretty.  Her husband works as an agricultural worker and also raises pigs.  With the income that they both make, they try to always get ahead.

María hopes to acquire some supplies to embroider more items and to make some improvements to her home.  This is why she has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 PEN.

María is a woman who wants very much to get ahead.  The people that know her in the area have a lot of confidence in her and hold her in high regard.

loans.use: To acquire supplies to embroider more items and to make some improvements to her home.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el caserío Pomape, una zona rural dedicada básicamente a labores agrícolas que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú, conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades turístico – religiosas, situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ella cuenta con cuatro vacas productoras de leche de las cuales actualmente tres se encuentran en producción, la leche que extrae la comercializa entre sus vecinos y también la vende a un acopiador de la zona que revende el producto a una empresa procesadora de lácteos.

Paralelamente trabaja junto a su esposo en labores agrícolas, ellos siembran forraje para los animales y eventualmente otro tipo de cultivos como tubérculos y cereales

María Esther desea adquirir alimento balanceado para complementar la alimentación de sus animales de modo que puedan producir mas cantidad de leche, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles.

Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva anteriormente y se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas que colaboraron con su negocio, gracias a su ayuda pudo adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales y con ello se aseguró una buena producción durante la última temporada.
texts.en:
María Esther is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her husband in son in the town of Pomape, which is a rural area dedicated to agriculture.  It is in the area of Monsefú, which is known at the national level for its tourist-religious festivals.  It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has made a living for 10 years by working in various activities related to raising cattle.  She has four dairy cows, and currently three are producing milk.  She sells the milk to her neighbors and also sells to a retailer in the area who resells it to a dairy processing company.

She also works with her husband in agriculture.  They harvest fodder for the animals and other types of crops like tubers and grains.

María Esther hopes to acquire nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals so they can produce more milk.  This is why she saw the need to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1100 PEN.

She has worked with Kiva funds previously, and she is very grateful to the lenders who colloborated with her business.  Thanks to their help, she was able to acquire nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals, which ensured a good production during the recent season.

loans.use: To acquire nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Pomape del distrito de Monsefú. Una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, específicamente de ovejas y aves de corral. Ella cría a sus animales en algunos ambientes situados en su domicilio, cuando ya ha desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir más ovejas para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Actualmente está embarazada de su cuarto hijo y desea seguir trabajando para poder brindarle lo mejor.
texts.en:
María Margarita is a 26-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the Pomape housing project in the Monsefú district, an area located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For six years she has raised and sold small animals, specifically, sheep and poultry.  She raises her animals in rooms in her house.  When the animals are sufficiently developed, she offers them for sale to dealers in the area.  This enables her to help her husband support the family.

María would like to buy more sheep to expand this business, and thus has found it advantageous to make this first request to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles, in order to achieve her objective.

She is a hard-working woman devoted to her family.  She is currently pregnant with her fourth child, and wants to continue to work, in order to offer the child the best she can.

loans.use: Adquirir más ovejas

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus madre en Pomalca, un distrito cuyos pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de caña de azúcar y que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 6 años mantiene un pequeño puesto informal en los exteriores del mercado de Pomalca en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, especias y aderezos previamente preparados. Este único ingreso económico le ha permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar donde vive con su madre de 65 años de edad, quien depende de ella.

Su negocio esta teniendo bastante acogida por parte de sus clientes. Actualmente su demanda ha aumentado y Sebastiana desea ampliar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Sebastiana ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el Fondo Kiva y su negocio ha crecido gracias al apoyo brindado. Ella se encuentra agradecida con los prestamistas que colaboraron con ella. Actualmente desea seguir trabajando para poder crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 36 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in Pomalca, a district whose residents whose principal work is growing sugar cane and which is located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 6 years she has maintained a small informal stall outside of the market of Pomalca, where she sells vegetables, groceries, spices and previously prepared condiments. This single source of income has permitted her to cover the expenses of their household, where she lives with her mother, who is 65 and depends on her.

Her business gets a good reception from her customers. Now their demand has increased, and Sebastiana wants to expand her business with more products so that she can increase her sales and earn more income. To do this, she thought it would be advantageous to apply to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 PEN.

Sebastiana has worked with Kiva in the past, and her business has grown thanks to the support offered. She is thankful to the lenders who work with her. Now she wants to continue working to be able to grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: Expand her business with more products

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 24 años de edad, tiene un hijo de dos años y reside junto a sus abuelos en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en un taller de mecánica que se especializa en la reparación y mantenimiento de motos lineales y mototaxis (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), este negocio es su fuente de sustento y, debido a su experiencia y capacidad, se ha vuelto muy conocido entre los mototaxistas del distrito, los cuales acuden a él al presentarseles cualquier desperfecto en sus unidades móviles. 

Cristian desea adquirir algunos repuestos para surtir su negocio y de ese modo ofrecer un buen servicio. Para ello ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. 

Cristian es una persona bastante honrada y trabajadora. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Cristian is 24 years old. He has a son who is 2, and he lives with his grandparents in the Oyotún district, an agricultural zone located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

He works in a mechanics shop which specializes in the repair and maintenance of motorcycles and mototaxis (modified motorcycles used to transport cargo and passengers). This business is his source of sustenance, and, thanks to his experience and ability, he has become very well known among the mototaxi drivers of the district, who come to him with whatever problems their mobile units present.

Cristian wants to acquire some supplies to stock his business and in this way to offer better service. To do this, he believed it would be advantageous to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. 

Cristian is quite an honest and hard-working person. He has already worked with Edpyme Alternative in the past, and he has shown punctuality and responsibility immediately upon assuming his payments.

loans.use: Acquire some supplies to stock his business

loans.name: Jose Eleodoro

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 61 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacasmayo, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace veinticinco años a la venta de telas en un puesto ambulante situado en una de las calles del distrito donde reside. Eventualmente las vende en una feria situada en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, aledaño al lugar en donde vive. Durante todos estos años ha podido hacerse conocido en el rubro y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los que piensa adquirir más telas para lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona trabajadora y bastante responsable. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
José is a 61 year old father who resides with his wife and children in the District of Pacasmayo, the capital of Pacasmayo Province. This community is located in the region of La Libertad, which is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 21 years, José has been selling fabrics from a vending post situated on one of the streets in the district where he lives. Eventually he began selling at a fair in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, which is near the place where he lives. During all these years, José has been known in this field and currently has a group of loyal customers.

He wants to expand his business by acquiring more merchandise. Therefore, José is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN so that he can acquire more fabrics to accomplish his goal.

José is a hardworking and responsible person. He has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated that he is prompt and responsible when submitting his payments.

loans.use: Acquire more fabrics

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Hualtaco del distrito de Tambogrande. Una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y que se encuentra situada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo Bertha se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Bertha desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Bertha es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho de mantenerse activa, en la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 34 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in Hualtaco, Tambogrande district.  It is an agricultural area belonging to Piura province located in Piura region.  It is over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital.

She sells catalogue cosmetics.  She has a group of customers who buy regularly from her.  The more orders she places the more points she earns from the firm that supplies the products and thus more profits.  Because of this Bertha works hard to acquire more and more customers each time.

Bertha wants to have stable capital with which to acquire more products and have fixed stock of cosmetics on hand so that her customers can get what they want quickly and not have to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders are filled.  She is, therefore, asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan that will help her reach her goal.

Bertha is a hard working woman who likes to stay active.  In the area where she lives she is quite well known and held in high esteem by her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to expand her order-based business.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María Angela tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el sector Pacanguilla del distrito de Pacanga, provincia de Chepén, situado en la región La Libertad, aproximadamente a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la preparación y venta de comida en un bar – picanteria situado en la zona donde vive. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos y al buen trato que ofrece a sus comensales. Su esposo trabaja fuera de la región y constantemente le envía dinero para garantizarles el sustento. Aun así ella continúa trabajando en esta actividad para ayudar a mantener la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos e ingredientes, los cuales le permitirán preparar más platos de comida y aumentar sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer emprededora que día a día se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y verlos progresar. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer emprendedora y de confianza.
texts.en:
María Angela, 33, is married and lives with her two children in Pacanguilla, Pacanga district, Chepén province, La Libertad region, located about an hour from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital.

For the last three years she has prepared food for sale at a pub-snack bar located in her area.  The business is well received because her dishes are very tasty and her customer service is kind.  Her husband works outside of the region and send her money to insure her support.  Even so, she continues working to help sustain the family.

María wants to expand the business buying more ingredients and supplies that will make it possible for her to prepare more dishes and increase sales.  To reach this goal she needed to request her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is an enterprising woman who daily struggles to support her family and see them succeed.  In the area where she resides people who know her hold her in high esteem and consider her to be an enterprising, trustworthy woman.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Hualtaco del distrito de Tambogrande. Una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y que se encuentra situada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. Al igual que la mayor parte de los pobladores de la zona se dedica a sembrar mango y limón en una pequeña extesión de terreno. Su esposo trabaja como albañil y juntos tratan de salir adelante y encargarse de los gastos de la familia.

Matilde desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo aplicándole algunos fertilizantes y pesticidas, por ello  ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de los productos que necesita.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Matilde, 35, is a mother living with her husband and children in Hualtaco, Tambogrande district, an agricultural area that is part of Piura province, Piura region, located over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital.

She works in farming.  Like most area residents she plants mangoes and lemons in a small field.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and together they strive to get ahead and take care of family expenses.

Matilde wants to care for her crops applying fertilizers and pesticides.  She has applied for a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy the necessary supplies to do so.

She is a mature woman who is quite dedicated to her family.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to gradually improve her quality of life.

loans.use: For mango and lemon crop maintenance costs.

loans.name: Agustin Milciades

texts.es:
Agustín tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijas en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que es la capital de la provincia del mismo nombre y que encuentra situada en la región La Libertad a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace 24 años a trabajar en el comercio ambulatorio de artículos hechos de plástico en los mercados de las ciudades de Chepén y Guadalupe. El se ha valido de esta actividad para poder solventar sus gastos familiares y sacar adelante a los suyos. El tiempo que lleva trabajando en el área le ha permitido hacerse conocida en el rubro y tener un grupo de clientes fieles.

Agustín desea adquirir un puesto estable en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Chepén. Durante los ultimos años ha estado ahorrando para lograr su objetivo y actualmente desea completar la cantidad que necesita para realizar su objetivo. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Agustín es una persona tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a estabilizarse como comerciante adquiriendo el puesto para así poder trabajar de modo seguro.
texts.en:
Agustín, 47, is married and lives with his wife and two daughters in Chepén district, an agricultural area with regular commercial activity that is the capital of Chepén province and is located in La Libertad region over an hour from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital.

For the last 24 years he has been an itinerant plastics merchant in various markets in the cities of Chepén and Guadalupe.  He has relied on this activity to meet family expenses and support his loved ones.  The time he’s been working in this business has made him very well known in the field and he has a group of regular customers.

Agustín wants to get a permanent stand in one of Chepén’s markets.  He has been saving up the last few years to reach this goal and he wants to make up the difference he still needs to do so.  Therefore, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

Agustín is a mature, responsible person.  His greatest wish is to establish himself as a merchant acquiring a stand so that he can work in a more secure manner.

loans.use: To acquire a permanent sales stand in one of the local markets.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque. Se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), con el cual brinda servicio de transporte en las ciudades de Olmos con sus principales caseríos. El negocio lebrinda algunos ingreso con los cuales sustenta la economía de su familia. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura.

Fernando desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vehículo ya que el continuo uso otorgado y el mal estado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Fernando es una persona bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para hacer progresar a su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 32 year old father who lives with his family in the Insculas sector of the Olmos district; an agricultural zone belonging to the Lambayeque province.  It's located more than one hour and fourty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been providing cargo and passenger transportation on his motor-taxi for the past 2 years.  He provides his transportation service in 
the city of Olmos and its main establishments.  The business provies him with some income to economically sustain his household, he also works in agriculture.

Fernando wishes to make some improvements on his vehicle since the continous usage of it along with the poor condition of the roadways in the area have caused it to require urgent repair in order to gurantee proper function.  That is why he found it convenient to solicit Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1500 ($550) nuevos soles.

Fernando is a very responsible person with great will to get ahead.  His biggest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order for his family to progress.

loans.use: Reparation costs and maintenance for motor-taxi.

loans.name: Sar's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar C., 35 years old, is the leader of a group loan, selected by the 5 members located in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province. C. and her husband, Mr. Buth Bunthy, 35 years old, are pig breeders at their home. They are working hard to support their four children aged between 14-6 years old.
 
C. and her husband are pig breeders but now they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their business. Thus C. decided to ask for a loan through AMK to buy pig feed for pig raising. Aside from being farmers they are also have a piece of land to cultivate vegetables so that they are able to earn some profit, together with pig breeding, to support the family.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for pig raising

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Por un lado posee algunas vacas de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para poder venderla al público en general y adicionalmente cría animales menores como pavos, patos y gallinas para comercializarlos a los negociantes de la zona. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Elvia desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales, se modo que se pueda asegurar una buena producción y por ende pueda percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Elvia es una mujer hacendosa y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y consideración.
texts.en:
Elvia is the 52-year-old mother of a family who lives with her husband and their children in the district of Chepén, an agricultural zone with average commercial traffic located in the province of the same name and in the region of La Libertad, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Her work is raising and selling animals. On the one hand, she has some cows that she milks to sell the milk to the public in general, and in addition, she raises small animals such as turkeys, ducks, and chickens to sell to the businesses in the area. With these activities she helps her husband in the economic support of their family.

Elvia wants to acquire balanced food for her animals so that she can be assured of a good production and therefore receive better income. To do this, she believed it would be advantageous to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

Elvia is a diligent woman who very much likes the work that she does. People who know her have much esteem and consideration for her.

loans.use: Acquire balanced food for her animals

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Mrs. Rosita O. is from the Barangay (neighborhood or district) of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and blessed with six children of whom three are now in their adult stage and the other three are still teenagers. To make a living, she is presently engaged in dressmaking activities. She is also receiving support from her husband as a warehouse man in one of the shopping centers here in the city. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (Php) a month from this business activity. Just this year, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program, was given the privilege to apply a loan. She is now requesting a loan amount of Php15,000.00 as her first loan, which will be used for additional capital for her existing dressmaking business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for a future use, paying for her children’s education, making loan repayments, purchasing insurance and possibly expanding her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperative in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing dressmaking business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Chacupe Bajo del distrito de La Victoria. Una zona rural situada a media hora del distrito de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la comercialización y venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en un ambiente de su domcilio. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a que es el único que existe en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Teresa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes para implementar su bodega y percibir mas ingresos. Por ell ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Teresa es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 43-year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Chacupe Bajo section of the district of La Victoria.  This is a rural area, located ½ hour from the district of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, she has dedicated herself to selling basic needs products and groceries from a store located in her house. The business is very busy, as it is the only one like it in the zone.  In addition, she raises and sells small livestock.  With the income she generates, she helps her husband cover the family’s expenses.

Teresa would like to expand her business by buying more groceries with which to supply her store and, therefore, increase her earnings.  For this reason, she has requested her first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to meet her goal.  

Teresa is a calm and responsible woman.  Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur in order to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Mrs. Rosa E. is from the Barangay (neighborhood or district) of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years of age and married. They were blessed with three children, all of whom are now at their adult or teen age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in selling relief goods locally known as “Okay-okay” (secondhand clothing or surplus donated clothing purchased by the container from the developed world). She is also receiving support from her husband, who is a driver. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for five years already and earns an approximate amount of 7,000.00 Philippines pesos (Php) a month from this business activity. Just this year, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program, was given the privilege to apply a loan. She is now requesting a loan amount of Php15,000.00 as her first loan to be used for additional capital for her existing Okay-okay business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for a future use, paying for her children’s education, making loan repayments, getting insurance, making house renovations and possibly expanding the business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperative in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing "Okay-okay" (secondhand clothing or surplus donated clothing purchased by the container from the developed world) business

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra localizada en la provinca de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de distancia de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María trabaja en labores agricolas junto a su esposo desde hace mas de quince años. Juntos manejan una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde suelen sembrar algunos granos y menestras. Adicionalmente cuentan con un pequeño grupo de vacas de las cuales extraen la leche que producen. Con estos ingresos ellos se han encargado de sacar adelante a sus hijos los cuales se encuentran independizados en su mayoría.

María desea adquirir un motor que le permita extraer agua del subsuelo para regar su cultivo durante las temporadas de sequia, antes alquilaba este artefacto a un vecino y constituía un gasto elevado. Por ello se ha decidio a realizar esta inversión de modo que pueda trabajar de mejor modo. Para lograr su bjetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen en lazona le consideran una mujer honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and a mother.  She lives with her husband in the Santa Clara hamlet of the Pitipo District, an agricultural area which is located in the province of Ferrenafe, about an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.  

Maria has worked in agriculture alongside with her husband for over fifteen years.  Together they manage a small parcel of cultivations where usually a few grains and vegetables grow.  They also have a small group of cows from which they get their milk from.  With these earnings, they have been able to support their children, the majority of whom are now independent.  

Maria wishes to acquire a motor that would allow her to pump water from the subsoil in order to be able to water her cultivations during the dry season.  Before, she used to rent one from her neighbor which proved to increase her costs.  As such, she has decided to make this investment so that she can work more effectively.  In order to achieve her goal, she felt it was necessary to seek out a loan of 2000 soles for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa.  Maria is hard-working and dedicated to her family.  Those in the area that know her, consider her an honest and trustworthy woman.

loans.use: Purchase a motor that would allow her to pump water from the subsoil.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina has three children.  She is thirty-nine years old and lives with her husband and children in El Portero near Reque, just outside the city of Chiclayo.  This is a rural region in which the majority of the population has access to electricity due their proximity to the city, but do not have access to running water or other basic services.  The region is characterized by small farms which raise crops and animals.

Martina raises pigs on her property.  She has been raising pigs for roughly fifteen years and has great experience in the business.  She has both male and female pigs, which allow her to continue breeding and maintaining her herd.  She purchases feed from the local farmers in order to ensure that her pigs grow up to be healthy and large in order to receive the best price.

This will be Martina’s first loan with our institution and her first experience working with a financial institution.  She plans to use the loan proceeds construct new corrals for her pigs and to purchase metal roofing for home.

loans.use: constructing new corrals pigs; purchasing metal roofing

loans.name: Maria Ilda

texts.es:
María Ilda es una madre de familia de 63 años de edad, es viuda y reside en el caserío La Hollería, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella cría ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral en un ambiente acondicionado cerca a su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Con estos ingresos ella sostiene sus gastos y aporta a la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas ovejas y alimento balanceado de modo que sus animales se puedan desarrollar de mejor manera y pueda adquirir mayores ingresos al momento de realizar sus pagos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y bastante trabajadora. Las personas de la zona le tienen bastante estima y le consideran una persona honrada y confiable.
texts.en:
Maria Ilda is a mother, a 63 year old widow, and she lives in La Holleria settlement; a rural area in the district of Morrope located in the Lambayeque province.  It is more than 1 hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals.  She raises sheep, pigs, and poultry in an air-conditioned environment near her home and when they have developed sufficiently she sells them to local merchants in the area.  With the income she covers her expenses and contributes to the household.

Maria wishes to expand her business by acquiring more sheep and balanced feed so her animals can develop better and she could then receive greater payouts upon sale.  That is why she has solicited a loan for 1000  ($375) nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative.

She is a very tranquil person and very hard working.  People in the area have great appreciation for her and consider her an honorable and reliable person.

loans.use: Puchase more sheep and balanced feed so her sheep can grow better.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Mrs. Svay C., 41, is a widowed mother in Kompong Chhnang Province. Her husband passed many years ago, and Mrs. Svay C. has been living with her daughter. Mrs. Svay C. is an old local farmer, she has almost spent her whole life in the field. 

Most of her income comes from her daughter, who works at the garment industry, and has a formal salary. Currently, Mrs. Svay C.’s daughter has purposed to open a new business as a tailor in front of her house. As she lacks fund to buy tailoring equipment, her savings are not enough to make it possible. So Mrs. Svay C. has decided to request a loan from Kiva forward to her daughter to purchase tailoring tools for starting a business.

loans.use: purchasing tailoring tools to start a business

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun Y. (pictured), is 30 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sovathana Rin, is 29 years old. They have been married since 2006 and have a two year old daughter. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Mrs. Yoeun Y. sells groceries in her village. Her husband is a librarian at Technical school for Medical care in Phnom Penh. She wants to expand her business, so she is asking for her first loan of $200 to purchase additional grocery items for resale.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath T. (pictured here), and her husband, Mr. Sopha Sun, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000, and have one daughter who is in school. 

Mrs. Sambath T. has been a silk weaver for more than 9 years. Her husband is a construction worker. She asked for a Kiva loan two times already, she now is requesting her third loan in the amount of $200 to purchase weaving materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: purchasing weaving materials

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes B. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 44 years old. Lourdes is married and has one school-aged child. Lourdes owns and operates a recycling service. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling second-hand goods for local businesses and community members. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional second-hand goods to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional second-hand goods to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lourdes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional second-hand goods to sell

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy C. (in the photo) is 52 years old, and her husband, Mr. Nun Bou, is 65 years old. They live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1982 and have five children--two sons and three daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, and the other two attend school.

Mrs. Sophy C. has been selling fruit (mango and sapodilla) for ten years. She buys it under contract from fellow villagers before harvest season, for resale in the local market. Her husband assists her in the business.

Sophy is asking for her first loan of $300 to provide capital to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing M. is a hardworking woman who has spent her life cultivating crops. Mrs. Hing M., 40, is an older woman. She owns a few farmlands in which she grows crops. Her husband works in a private organization in the province of Kampong Chhnang and has a proper salary to cover the family expenses. This couple has four children, all of whom are currently single. Mrs. Hing M. has had great success growing crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Unfortunately, her old cow is getting old, and it can’t support her during the plowing process. Because of that, Mrs. Hing M. is taking out her first loan to purchase a new cow to replace the old one, and the remainder of the loan will be used to buy fertilizers for her crop.

loans.use: To purchase a new cow to replace the old one

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida S. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 58 years old. Adelaida is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Adelaida owns and operates a handicraft business. The main source of income for the business comes from making frames for pictures. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Adelaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Adelaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer D. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 34 years old. Jennifer is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer provides recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2004, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste and junk material to sell

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
The woman is shown in the picture, Yim K., lives in the Siem Reap Province. Yim K. is 58 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than eight years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or she buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. 

Yim K. is married to Rin Voeun, 62, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. This couple has seven children, four of whom are now married and have started new homes. The three remaining are single. 

Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. Because of this reason, Yim K. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing tools. She proposes to use the remainder of loan to purchase a used motor.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing tools and a used motor

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita A. is from the village of Bungad. She is 35 years old. Teresita is married and has three young children. To make a living, Teresita makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling "dirty ice cream" or sorbetes for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech E., 36, is a fisherman in the province of Siem Reap which is the most wonderful place in Cambodia. Her husband's name is Chhoum; he is 39 and works with her in the fishing business.
