The young couple is blessed with eight children who are enrolled in public school;  a few of them help their parents with the same business. They usually need to spend over six hours a day fishing in and around Tunle Sap River. 

Mrs. Pech E. and her husband catch around 7 kilos of fish per day and sell them in bulk to his customers in the market. She said that her fishing equipment is torn and is getting old. Mrs. Pech E. will use her loan to purchase nets and other fishing equipment to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina C. is from the village of Bato. She is 54 years old. Regina is single. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Regina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Regina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Regina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is 47 years old and married with eight children between the ages of three and 25. Six of her children are currently attending school. For the last eight years, Everlyn has been farming in Kitale, Western Kenya, producing milk and vegetables which she sells to the local market. 

Everlyn is requesting a loan of 26,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk from this cow will help her pay school fees for her children. She also faces the challenges of disease prevention and storage facilities to preserve milk. Over the next five years, Everlyn plans to buy more dairy cows and a chuff cutter to be able to supply milk to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Loem H. is a 20-year-old married woman who currently resides in the province of Siem Reap. Loem Hengis has been married for several years, but she doesn’t have any children yet. Loem H. and her husband sell different kinds of products such as perfumes, beauty products, bags and other goods to people who come to buy something in the market. They have experience in this business since 2008, and their business now is running very well because of their good communication skills with all clients, both retailers and wholesalers.

 In order to earn more profit and to make the business more successful, Loem H. will be using the loan she has requested to buy a larger quantity of her inventory items.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 41 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 5 children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been farming for eight years and employs one farmhand. He sells his eggs and vegetables at the local market. He also earns income from his carpentry services at the local market.

John has requested this loan of 25,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. This project will enable him to send his children to good schools since his income will increase through the increase in production of eggs. His biggest challenge has been diseases. He plans to have three dairy cows and 300 chickens and be the main supplier of eggs to the local market in the next five years.

John has been pictured with his dairy cow because it was not possible to take his picture in his poultry farm.

loans.use: For poultry farming

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San T. is a married woman, aged 35, and she and her husband have four lovely children. Three of them are single, and one is married. Mrs. San T. is a local farmer and plate-seller in front of her house. The most of her customers are retailers at her local market. She has a life partner in her husband who has a motorcycle to run a taxi service, picking up tourists who want to visit Angkor Wat Temple, or anywhere else in town. 

This family normally earns an average of US$ 7 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. Presently, she is concerned that her husband's motorbike is getting old and breaks down very often. This has caused frequent interruptions to her husband's operations. Therefore, Mrs. San T. would like a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a used motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her husband’s business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has been practicing mixed farming for thirty-five years in Kisii town, western Kenya. He has employed four farmhands from his community. His farm produces bananas, maize, milk, eggs, pineapples, nappier grass and tea which he sells at the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feed and transportation problems.

Samson recently repaid his previous loan of 30,000 KES and has requested this loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He hopes the income from this loan will enable him to send his children to better schools. In future, he plans to expand his dairy farming and own at least four good quality dairy cows and also expand his poultry farming. 

Samson is 52 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 7 children who are between the ages of 15 and 31.  Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en: Varditer D. is married and has two children in school. She has been in the trading business since 2000. She sells women’s clothing and underwear from a rented trading booth at Malatia market. Although Varditer’s husband works hard, the family's main income comes from Varditer’s business. Varditer has applied for the loan to purchase new inventory.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. He is 32 years old. Oliver is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Oliver owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Oliver has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Oliver joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oliver has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Oliver is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Oliver from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe M. has recently served in the Army. Vahe is living with his large family of 9 people, where apart from himself, his father and brother also work. In 2010, Vahe joined the workforce by opening his own small business. He rents a large booth at Firdusi open air market where he sells sportswear. His mother helps when Vahe is away for goods purchasing. Vahe has applied for the loan to purchase new inventory.

loans.use: Purchase new sportswear inventory

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 51 years old. She is married and has been blessed with three children who are now all adults although her youngest son is currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kisii in Western Kenya. Norah has been farming for the past 30 years and she employs three farmhands to help her produce tea, maize, coffee and vegetables. Her produce is sold through the Kenya Tea Development Authority, the Coffee Board, and the local market. Norah’s primary challenges are exploitation from middlemen who offer low prices for her products, diseases that affect her crop production, and fluctuating weather patterns.

Norah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a posho mill which is used to grind maize into flour. Acquiring a posho mill will greatly improve her asset base. She will use the extra income from this loan to help pay her son’s school fees. Over the next five years, Norah plans to have at least four good dairy cows and, if possible, to build a permanent business facility in her town.

loans.use: To purchase a posho mill

loans.name: Kipas Ole

texts.en:
Kipas Ole K. is 37 years old. He is married to Everline K. and a father of three school-going children. Kipas is a farmer on his own piece of land. He has been farming for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Kipas' dream is do large-scale farming and start dairy farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend 37,500 Kenyan shillings to prepare land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, honey, and other ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Precila

texts.en: Precila B. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Precila is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Precila makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes. Precila has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Precila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Precila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Precila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

Wina Lyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Wina Lyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wina Lyn is requesting her first loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used for corn production. loans.name: Ana Yanira

texts.es: Ana Yanira P. T. de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, así mismo junto a cuatro hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar, con los cuales vive en Tacachico, departamento de La Libertad. Ana posee una venta de  productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como: pan, huevos, leche, granos básicos y otros más. El negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación, debido a que se encuentra frente a la calle principal lo que la hace muy visible para muchas personas, esto le beneficia en gran manera, ya que le permite contar con muchos clientes fijos, ya que es un lugar el cual siempre esta lleno de muchas personas. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, de manera que pueda ofrecer más a sus clientes. Este negocio es de mucho valor para ella ya que es una fuente de ingresos muy importante para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Yanira P. T. is 42 years old and lives with her husband, who works as a farmer, and their four young children, who attend school.  They all live in Tacachico, in the Libertad department.

Ana has a food and primary needs products store and sells things such as bread, eggs, milk, basic grains, and other items.  The business is in a good location, on the main street, making it visible to many people.  This is of great benefit to her because it’s in a place where many people gather and she has steady customers that she can count on.

Ana is asking for this loan so that she can increase her inventory and be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  This business is very valuable to her because it’s an important source of income with which she supports her family.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine M. owns and operates a grocery store. She is 45 years old, married and has six school-aged children. They are from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga. Josephine has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase new stock to sell. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús C. D. P. D. 50 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo que se dedica a estudiar, y junto a quien vive en San Martín departamento D. San Salvador. Teresa posee un comedor en el mercado municipal D. San Martín, lugar en el cual posee muchos clientes, los cuales en su mayoría son personas que trabajan en el mismo lugar. Ella se encarga D. elaborar desayunos y almuerzos y diferentes tipos D. bebidas naturales. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. frutas, verduras, granos básicos y otros más, los cuales son la materia prima para elaborar los platillos. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder mejorar sus ventas y D. esta manera contribuir con los gastos del hogar, y brindarle todo lo que su hijo necesita como alimentación ropa y hogar.
texts.en: Teresa D. Jesus C. D. Perez is 50 years old and lives with her husband and their son, who is currently studying in school. They live in San Martin in the state of San Salvador. Teresa owns a diner in the San Martin town market, where she has a lot of clients, the majority of whom work in the same place. She is in charge of making breakfast, lunch, and different types of natural drinks. Currently, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a greater quantity of fruits, vegetables, basic grains, and other things, which serve as the main ingredients in the meals she prepares. She is doing all of this with the desire to improve her sales and thereby help with the domestic expenses and proviD. her son with everything he needs, such as food, clothing, and shelter.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruits, and basic grains to prepare food.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina P. owns a motorcycle transport business. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of El Paraiso. Rosalina has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Rosalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosalina is requesting her first loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. Genelyn has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,300 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. loans.name: Koitumet

texts.en:
Koitumet K. is a 28 year old farmer and he supports a family of three children. His spouse is Nemuta K. and she works with her husband. Their children are between the ages of one year and ten years old. Koitumet had been farming for the last eight years.

He learned about Kiva's partner, the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend to prepare land for planting wheat. Wheat has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Koitumet’s dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for wheat farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend Ksh 50,00 to prepare land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia B. is from the village of Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a food sector business making and selling food. While not her only means of generating revenue, Ofelia’s main source of income comes primarily from making and selling a variety of food products, especially food delicacies, or viands. Ofelia also sells rice by the kilogram in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Ofelia joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) in 2010 to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be Ofelia’s second loan from HSPFI. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP that she used to expand her business. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell and also to use as working capital. Ofelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Cecilia Margarita

texts.es: Cecilia Margarita Z. D. M. D. 42 años D. edad, es una persona muy responsable  y trabajadora la cual posee su propio negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en el mercado D. San Martín, mismo municipio en el cual vive junto a dos hijos. Celia comercializa embutidos como: salchichas, jamón, chorizo y así mismo, alitas D. pollo congeladas, así mismo venD. carne D. pollo y bolsas D. aceite para cocinar. Cecilia solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. poder surtir aún más su negocio, ya que el mayor sueño D. ella es el D. poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que como ella es madre soltera, es la única que vela por el bienestar D. sus dos hijos, por lo que es D. mucha importancia obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Cecilia Margarita Z. D. M. is 42 years old, a very responsible and hardworking person who owns her own business in the San Martín market, the same town she lives with her children in. She sells cold cuts such as: sausage, ham, chorizo (highly seasoned pork sausage) and likewise sells frozen chicken wings, chicken, and bags of cooking oil. Cecilia requests the loan with a great desire to supply her store even more since her biggest dream is to improve her sales. Since she is a single mother she is the only one who can watch over all of her children’s welfare making it even more important to make profits.

loans.use: To buy cold cuts to sell.

loans.name: Lucio Enrique

texts.es: Lucio Enrique R. C. de 36 años de edad, reside en Tacachico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y así mismo le ayuda a Lucio a atender el negocio. Él posee una tienda en la cual comercializa alimentos enlatados, pan, embutidos, bebidas y muchos otros productos que son de primera necesidad tanto alimenticias como para hacer los quehaceres del hogar. Desde hace 4 años y medio que el posee su propio negocio, el cual le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario para seguir adelante. Lucio solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder surtir la tienda, con todos los productos que sean necesarios para poder incrementar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee, Lucio desea poder agrandarlo y de esta manera poder crecer tanto como persona así como propietario de un negocio, el cual ha sido muy rentable, ya que no posee mucha competencia en el lugar.
texts.en: Lucio Enrique R. C. is 36 years old, lives in Tacachico located in the Libertad (Liberty) department. He live with his wife who is a housewife and helps Lucio attend his business. He owns a business where he sells canned goods, bread, cold cuts, beverages, and many other products which are primary essentials as well as useful for household chores. He has owned his own business for 4 years which has provided him with resources to succeed in life. Lucio requests a loan to be able to supply his store with all of the necessary products that will increase sales since this is his only means of making money. Lucio wishes to expand his business and this way be able to grow as a person as well a business owner, which has been very profitable, since he does not have much competition in his area.

loans.use: To buy perishable goods.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly M. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba. She is 36 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Merly owns and operates a business in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables in the local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merly joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for her business. Merly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase [feeds]. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merly from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon R. is 54 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Ilaya within the barangay of Balulang, a part of Cagayan de Oro City in Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Corazon runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Corazon has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Corazon is requesting a new loan, her second from HSPFI, of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Mrs. Pilar E. is 63 years old, a widow and blessed with three children who are now adults. She is from Bernad within the barangay of Aguada, a part of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Pilar is presently engaged in selling barbecue and in RTW (ready-to-wear or used clothing) sales. She also receives a monthly pension and support from her son. She’s been in business for two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007 Pilar joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. As a member of PMPC under the pension loan program, Pilar was allowed to apply for a loan, her second from PMPC, of 30,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her barbecue business and RTW sales. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, buying insurance and possibly expanding her businesses.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Fely Laranjo's Group

texts.en:
Fely L. is 29 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of Misom, a part of the barangay of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Fely is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fely runs a grocery store. She has been in business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fely is requesting a new loan, her fifth from PMPC, of 14,500 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to pay her child’s tuition fees.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Deysi Mavel

texts.es: Deysi Mavel C. de 57 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, junto a su esposo quien trabaja como taxista y junto a tres hijos. Deysi posee un comedor, en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales los comercializa con las personas del lugar. Debido a que cuenta con una ubicación muy buena, por el hecho que esta rodeada de escuelas y fábricas, posee muchos clientes quienes a diario asisten a su negocio a consumir sus platillos. Deysi solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar verduras, arroz, frijoles y maíz, carne, pollo y otros productos más, los cuales son muy necesarios para la elaboración de comida. Para ella es de mucha importancia poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que la ayuda que le brinda a su esposo es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Deysi Mavel C., aged 57, lives in the municipality of Soyapango with her husband, a taxi driver, and their three children. Deysi owns a restaurant where she serves breakfast and lunch to local people. Because of the excellent location—her restaurant is surrounded by schools and factories—she has many customers who come every day to her restaurant and have a meal.

Deysi applies for a loan to buy vegetables, rice, beans, corn, meat, chicken and other ingredients, which she needs to prepare her dishes. As far as she is concerned, it is very important to improve the working conditions of her business, because the assistance she gives to her husband is most useful for providing for the household.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her dishes

Filomena D. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Filomena is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Filomena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products. Filomena has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Filomena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Filomena has successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Filomena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan is Filomena's second loan taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es: María del Pilar G. de 26 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee un negocio propio en el cual se encarga de elaborar y vender pupusas, uno de los platillos típicos salvadoreños que tienen mayor demanda por parte de las personas de este lugar. Su negocio está ubicado en las afueras de su casa de habitación, en donde cada día María saca de su hogar la cocina, mesas, sillas y todos los utensilios necesarios para iniciar su trabajo. Ella es una mujer con mucha experiencia, ya que posee 5 años de realizar este oficio, razón por la cual posee muchos clientes, los cuales prefieren sus pupusas ya que es una persona la cual se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, frijoles, chicharrón y queso, los cuales son la materia prima para la elaboración de las pupusas, así mismo desea surtir el negocio con bebidas heladas y calientes, esto con el fin de que las personas no solo compren su productos para llevar a sus casa, sino también para que ellas opten por comer en el lugar, esto le brindaría  muchos beneficios a María puesto que aumentaría sus ventas los cual es de mucha ayuda para su economía familia, la cual necesita mejorar en gran manera.
texts.en: María del Pilar G., 26, lives in the municipality of San Martín with her 2 children aged 10 and 9.  They are both in school.  She has her own business making and selling pupusas, a traditional Salvadoran dish for which there is a lot of demand on the part of the people who live in this area.  Her business is located outside her house, where every day Maria takes from her kitchen tables, chairs and all of the utensils she needs to start her work.  Since she has been in this line of work for 5 years, she now has a lot of experience, and as a result she has a lot of customers who prefer her pupusas because she has gained the confidence of her customers.  Maria requests a loan to buy a large quantity of corn, beans, pork rinds and cheese, the raw materials to make pupusas.  She also wants to stock her business with hot and cold drinks.  She wants to do this so that people will not only buy her products to take to their houses, but also will eat at her establishment.  With the increased sales that this would bring Maria would benefit, because this would help her family's finances, which are in great need of improvement.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork rinds and cheese

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine M., from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City, is 45 years old, widowed and has five grown children. To make a living, Elaine owns and operates a business venture buying and selling boiled duck eggs or balot in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elaine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her second loan for 7000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elaine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana Beatriz M. D. L. D. 28 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Unión, en donD. vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos D. 6 y 3 años D. edad, y junto a sus padres. Ana es una persona muy detallista, la cual posee un negocio en el cual se encarga D. elaborar recuerdos, centros D. mesa, ramos para fiestas, y adornos para decorar recepciones y fiestas. Su trabajo es muy delicado y bonito por lo que llama la atención D. muchas personas, las cuales la toman en cuenta para cualquier celebración, así mismo Ana procura mantenerse con todas las tendencias D. arreglos, D. manera que sus clientes siempre la prefieran y D. esta forma la pueda recomendar con otras personas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para elaborar su trabajo, elementos como: globos, flores, telas y otros más son lo que ella desea comprar por mayor y D. esta manera percibir más ganancias.
texts.en: Ana Beatriz M. D. L., 28, lives in the La Union department with her husband and his parents and their two children who are 6 years old and 3 months old.  Ana is a very detail-oriented person, who has a business where she makes keepsakes, centerpieces, flower arrangements for parties, and decorations for receptions and parties.  Her work is very delicate and pretty, which is why it captures the attention of a lot of people who keep her mind for when they have any type of celebration.  In addition, Ana seeks to keep up with all of the trends in arrangements so that her customers always prefer her and are able to recommend her to other people.  She requests a loan to buy all types of raw materials for her work, items such as: balloons, flowers, fabrics, and other items that she wants to buy at wholesale so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy balloons, flowers and other materials to make arrangements and keepsakes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, age 39, is married to Peter Obiere who is also in business.They live in Njiru, a Nairobi suburb. Esther operates a hardware shop in Njiru, which is fairly urban--most of her clients are low-income earners in Njiru. She has done this for the last three years. With this loan, she plans to buy cement and other items for the shop. She has borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open other outlets.

loans.use: Esther plans to buy cement for Kshs 50,000, and other stock items for Kshs 10,000.

loans.name: Elba Alicia

texts.es: Elba Alicia S. D. G. D. 50 años D. edad, siempre se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y humilD. quien ha luchado mucho por salir adelante. Vive junto a su esposo, un hijo quien trabaja y un nieto D. 15 años D. edad, junto a los cuales vive en Ciudad Delgado. Elba posee un bazar en el cual comercializa juguetes, trastes, ropa, sandalias, recuerdos, cosméticos, cremas para el cabello, pegamentos, colas y ganchos. DesD. hace 25 años que ella posee este negocio, en el cual cuenta con varios clientes. Elba solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. surtir aún más su bazar, el cual lleva por nombre “bazar Elba’s”. D. esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ganancias y así poder vivir mejor junto a su familia, en la cual todos sus miembros se dedican a trabajar por el bienestar D. ellos y del el pequeño nieto D. Elba.
texts.en: Elba Alicia Solis D. G. is 50 years old. She has always stood out for being a very hardworking and humble person who has struggled hard to advance herself. She lives in the city of Delgado with her husband, a son who works, and a grandson who is 15. Elba has a market stall where she sells toys, dishes, clothing, sandals, souvenirs, cosmetics, hair creams, glues, soft drinks, and hair pins. In the 25 years that she has had this business, she has had a variety of customers. She is applying for a loan with the great desire to stock her store, which has the name "Bazar Elba's," even more. In this way she hopes to increase her earnings so that she and her family can live better. All the members of the family work for their own well-being and that of Elba's little grandson.

loans.use: Buy various products to stock her shop.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es: Francisco José C. B. reside en Mejicanos, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, vive junto  a un hijo quien se dedica a estudiar y a trabajar. A sus 67 años Francisco trabaja comercializando medicinas naturales, las cuales vende en su casa de habitación con varios clientes fijos, así mismo las comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias, en donde ya posee una ruta trazada de clientes quienes siempre están a la espera de Francisco. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de medicinas y de esta forma cubrir todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Francisco desea mejorar su negocio ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que le permite solventar todos sus gastos personales.
texts.en: Francisco José C. B. lives in Mejicanos, located in the San Salvador department. He lives with a son who studies and works. At 67 years old, Francisco  sells natural medicines. He sells them from his house to regular customers. He also sells them through a mobile business in different districts. He has a route with clients who are always waiting for Francisco. He is requesting loan, so he will have the money necessary to buy more medicines. He will then be able to fill all of his clients’ orders. Francisco wants to improve his business since this his only for of income which allows him to cover all his personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is an active member of the Jitahidi Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for 15 years and employs three farmhands. Her mixed farm produces tea, coffee, maize, beans and vegetables which she sells locally and through Kenya Tea Development Authority and Coffee Board of Kenya.

Anne is 37 years old. She is married with one 10-year-old child who attends school.

She has requested this loan of 30,000KES to expand her cereal business. She says that her income base will improve with the profits from this loan and this will enable her pay school fees for her child. Her major challenges have been transportation, low market prices and hailstones which affect the growth of her crops. She hopes that in five years' time, she will have expanded her cereal business and ventured into new markets. She also plans to lease more land and plant vegetables in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mrs. Jane F. is from the Barangay of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 51 years old, widowed and blessed with four children, all of whom are now adults with their own family. To make a living, she operates a sari-sari store. She also receives a monthly SSS Pension from her late husband. She’s been engaged in this business for ten years already and earns approximately Php5,000.00 a month from this business activity.

In 2009, Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Jane is an active member of PMPC under the Pension Loan program, and has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php50,000.00. She is now requesting a loan amount of Php50,000.00 as her fifth loan to be used for additional capital for her existing sari-sari store business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, save for future use, make loan repayments, provide insurance, and pay for her grandchildren’s education and possible business expansion. 
		
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing Sari-sari Store

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam R. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old. Meriam is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Meriam owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida G. is SEF International's longstanding client. Aida is married with four children. Aida’s husband is working as a physicist in Russia. Two of her children live separately and the other two are students and live with their mother. Aida has been managing her current business since mid 2010. She sells women’s clothing from a rented trading booth at Malatia market. The business income supports the household and the students' school fees. Aida has applied for the loan to purchase new clothing stock.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 31 years old and single, living in Kiwanja near the Kenyatta University. George operates a butcher shop at Kiwanja with mostly middle-class clients. He has done this for the last two years. With this loan, he plans to buy more meat for sale so as to meet his customers' demands. His customers are mainly university students and residents of the area. He has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by opening another butcher shop.

loans.use: He wants to buy more beef for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make lunches

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Mrs. Merlinda B. operates a mini boutique with bartered goods from Zamboanga City as her main products. Together with her husband, she opened up a stall in one of the malls of the city. She is 35 years of age, married and blessed with one child. They are from the Barangay (village) of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She’s been in this kind of business for four years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Just this year, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC in the Regular Loan program, she was given the privilege of applying for a loan. She is now requesting a first loan of 30,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her mini boutique business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially to meet their basic needs, to save for a future use and to pay for her child’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for a mini boutique business

She is 30 years of age and blessed with one child who is still an infant. She is from the Barangay of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Aljane’s been in her business for three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Just this year, Aljane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program, she is now requesting a first loan of 20,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her direct selling business and for full payment of her installed motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for insurance, advancing her children’s education and possibly expanding her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. She is also receiving support from her husband as her partner in their business. She is 38 years of age and blessed with two children now of school age. They are from the Barangay of Sangay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She’s been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Just this year, Emma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program, she is now requesting a first loan of 15,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her Okay-okay business. She plans to use additional revenue to improve general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for insurance, advancing her children’s education and possibly expanding her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita P. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Sherlita is widowed and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Sherlita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized store. While not her only means of generating revenue, Sherlita’s main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, and also selling dried fish in the local community.Before shes engaged into a sari sari store business and later shifted to fish vending business.

Sherlita joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in businesrs activities. Sherlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP on Kiva that was her 2nd loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sherlita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase addtional product for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sherlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her retail store.
 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional product for sale

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorna T. is 47 years of age, married and has no dependents. She is from the barangay of Gata Daku within the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Lorna is engaged in vegetable gardening and coconut vinegar production. She also receives support from her husband, a farmer. She’s been in business for ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Just this year Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the regular loan program, she has been given the privilege to apply for a loan and is now requesting 4,000 PHP as her first loan to be used for additional capital for her gardening and vinegar production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments, paying for insurance and possibly expanding her businesses.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites Bonite is a 44-year-old widow with four children and is a resident of San Roque within the municipality of Panaon, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Her husband was a farmer. After the death of her husband, she decided to venture into the cosmetics business to augment the family's income. Her loyal customers are her neighbors and friends. She sometimes cooks "barbeque" in the afternoon for additional income.

In 2005 Marites joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access its financial aid. Marites became a member in good standing, religiously paying her loans. Now, she is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP for additional working capital. She hopes that her growing business can send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To obtain additional working capital

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Mrs. Estela F. is 54 years of age, married and blessed with five children who are now adults and have their own families. She is from Bangkal within the barangay of Aguada, a part of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Estela runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been in business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Her husband also contributes support for the family.

In 2009 Estela joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. As an active member of PMPC under the regular loan program, Estela successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 8,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for insurance, advancing her children’s education and possibly expanding her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita A. is from the village of Villaflor. She is 44 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Pacita owns and operates a "sari-sari" store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Pacita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik G. has been living in Germany for the last 15 years. A year ago he returned to Armenia to attend his father’s funeral and decided to stay in Armenia. Andranik decided to start production of cleaning lint rollers for clothing and soft upholstery. Some parts for the rollers come from China, and the others are ordered locally. 

At first Andranik was using pure ABS plastic material for the stamped parts. Then he started using recycled material, which is much cheaper and increased the profit margin to 60%. Andranik delivers the rollers to more than 30 stores. The highest demand for the rollers is during late autumn and winter, when people wear woolen clothing. Andranik has applied for the loan to order some roll parts from China, to receive the goods in 2-3 weeks and start the production before the peak season.

loans.use: ordering parts for his lint rollers

loans.name: Suubi Lya Mukama Women's Group 1-Lugazi

texts.en: Deborah N.'s first business was poultry. That was approximately five years ago, before she came up with the idea of setting up her current retail business in Kitigoma-Lugazi. She sells a variety of general merchandise like sugar, posho, cooking oil, and soap. Her weekly profits are up to 150,000 shillings. Deborah belongs to Suubi lya Mukama women’s group-Lugazi. She also farms and has a poultry business, though at a smaller scale than before. She is requesting this loan to purchase more general merchandise for resell at her shop.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail merchandise such as sugar, salt, soap, maize flour, and cooking oil, for resell at her shop.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy A. is from the village of Canitoan, Lingatong, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Percy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Percy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products, and also buying and selling charcoal in the local community. Percy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Percy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Percy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Percy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be her seventh loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is 40 years old and a single mother of one.  She joined Faulu Kenya through the Funga Leso group. She has benefited from Faulu Kenya by saving her money. She runs her business in the Kiserian open-air market. She runs both a grocery store and cafeteria to earn a living. She has one and a half years of experience in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables, fruit, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty A. is from the village of Canitoan, Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Letty owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Letty is just starting this business.

In 2008, Letty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Letty is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Letty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A., 37 years of age, is a dynamic and hardworking mother of three children in Barangay Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Erlinda is happily married. Since her husband’s income is not enough to meet their daily expenses, she helps out by selling snacks every day in a nearby school in their municipality.

In 2009, Erlinda became a member of Paglaum MPC and attended training sessions about how to run a business.She wants to obtain financial assistance amounting to PHP 8,000 for house renovations. Someday, she wants to see all her children become successful in their chosen careers. Maintaining her credit worthiness is what she values most.

loans.use: for house renovation

loans.name: Suubi Lya Mukama Women's Group 2-Lugazi

texts.en: N. Hanifa, 27 years old, has called upon painstaking effort and pro-active solutions to develop her boutique business in Kitigoma-Lugazi. Hanifa is an industrious woman who always wanted to emulate her conscientious parents who were her role models. She got her first work experience doing trivial domestic work for her parents. Hanifa's clients are a cross section of individuals of all ages. In a week, this mother of 2 says her profits total up to 80,000 UGX. She also runs a shoe sales business. With this loan, Hanifa will buy more clothes to resell at her boutique. She reckons her prospects will improve upon using this loan. She also belongs to Suubi Lya Mukama Women's Group-Lugazi.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn P. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 23 years old. Renelyn is married. To make a living, Renelyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Renelyn has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Renelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Renelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. Renelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Renelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Arcele

texts.en:
Arcele A. is from the village of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Arcele is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Arcele owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Arcele has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arcele joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arcele has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arcele is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Arcele from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en: Selling produce is a popular small-business venture in Uganda. This is what N. Deogratias has decided to do--and where he has invested his savings--in order to earn more profit. The married father of five children started a grocery store 18 years ago in Kakasi, Ibanda. He sells primarily dry foods, especially cereals, and produce. Due to his hard work and determination, he has been able to run this business, earning 220,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. With this loan he is looking forward to restocking the business with more maize and beans. He plans on expanding his business further into wholesale; he says this will attract many customers to his shop. His main goal is to earn more revenue and expand his business so that he can support his family and educate his children.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of maize and beans

loans.name: Maomanyi

texts.en:
Maomanyi has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces maize, beans, coffee, milk and tea. He sells his products to the local market and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He has been practicing mixed farming for five years. He is also a mason. His biggest challenges in farming have been transportation and the fluctuation in the prices of milk.

Maomanyi is 48 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children who are now between the ages of 17 and 26. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his cereals business. The extra income from this loan will help him build a better house and pay school fees for his children with ease. He plans to expand his dairy business in the future by buying three quality dairy cows and a posho mill to ground maize into corn flour.

loans.use: To expand his cereals business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa B., age 26, owns and operates a specialized retail store, where she primarily sells seafood products like fish and shrimp in the local community. Luisa is just starting this business.  She and her husband have four young children and live in the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. 

Earlier this year, Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted  to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and utilized as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of onrthern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to obtain working capital for her business

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Long's Group
loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment for her fishing activities.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
GILDA M. nasceu na Catembe, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira mãe de 4 filhos já em idade escolar. Fez o ensino primário e não continuou devido a guerra de desestabilização. Vive na casa da mãe com seus filhos e ajuda a mãe nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Moçambique para a Republica da África do sul a procura de melhores condições de vida, volta a Moçambique com perspectivas de iniciar uma actividade comercial. Compra e vende roupas na África do Sul e revende em Moçambique ha mais de 5 anos. Tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua mãe que também foi cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar mantas, cobertores, cortinas, lençóis e outros para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Esta confiante que vai liquidar o mais rápido possível e segundo o calendário de amortização. No futuro pretende solicitar mais créditos para construir uma casa própria, assim como aumentar cada vez mais o seu negócio diversificando mais produtos.
texts.en:
Gilda M. was born in Catembe, a district located in the province of Maputo, in Southern Mozambique. She is the single mother of four school-age children. Her studies were interrupted after elementary school due to the destabilizing war that devastated the country. She left Mozambique for South Africa in search of a better life but ended up moving back to Mozambique. She and the children currently live in her mother's house.

For the past five years she's been in the business of selling clothes, bedding and window treatments that she buys in South Africa to resell in Mozambique. She learned about Hluvuku from her mother, who used to be a client of the institution. This is Gilda's second loan with Hukuvuku, and she plans to use the 16.000.00mt to buy more blankets, quilts, sheets, curtains and other items to resell. Her first loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, was used for the same purpose. She is confident that she will be able to pay back this loan according to the agreed-upon terms.

loans.use: to buy blankets, quilts, curtains, bedding, etc

loans.name: Mhark

texts.en:
Mhark M. is 29 years old and single. He is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. Mhark runs a food stall from which he makes and sells specialty foods like chicken and pork barbecue to the local community. Mhark has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Mhark joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services.  He is requesting a loan, his first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and for working capital

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Mane

texts.en: Mane P. is married with one child. Together with her husband, she operates a billiard club, a roomy clean place for this refined sport. The billiard club hosts billiard competitions and has its permanent clientele. The club requires one additional table for its clientele. Mane has applied for this loan to purchase a billiard table.

loans.use: purchasing a billiard table

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith A. is 31 years old, separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Villa Verde within the barangay of Balulang, a part of Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Bernadith runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Bernadith has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Bernadith joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca K. is forty-three years old and married. Her husband is a lecturer at Egerton University, and they have five children aged between twenty-four and seven years old. She has a barber shop which is located in a busy residential area in Nairobi. She also provides hair salon services to ladies in the same shop. She describes herself as ambitious.

Rebecca has been in business for a year now, and she says that this business is profitable but that the major challenge she has is a lack of enough capital. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy blow driers to service her increasing volume of women customers. She hopes to have many business outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy blow driers

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D., age 37, owns and operates a specialized retail store, where she buys and sells second-hand clothing and shoe products. She is also a dealer of Natasha and Avon products, which she sells in her store. Fe has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. She and her husband have five school-aged children and live in the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. 

Earlier this year, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old and married with four children, who are now between the ages of ten and eighteen. All her children attend school. She is a farmer from Kitale in western Kenya, where she has been farming for ten years. Her farm produces milk, maize and beans which she sells locally. She is also a fruit vendor.

She has requested this individual loan of 40,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farming. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her biggest challenge has been fluctuation in the market prices of her products. In the future, she would like to expand her poultry farming from the current 30 chickens to 300 chickens and also keep exotic birds.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is married. Her husband is employed as a company driver and they have four children aged four to thirteen years old. She has a general store in a residential area in Nairobi.
