Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Emma S. (on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in a village called Koya 45 years ago. Emma is married and has seven children. Her husband is a diamond miner and her children are attending schools: three are in secondary school, two are in primary school and the rest are no longer attending school. 

Emma sells groundnuts and palm oil. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. She will use her share of the loan to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is a hardworking man.  He has been a tailor for three years.  He has been able to improve his business – and hence his living standards – through Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy textiles and a sewing machine.  He hopes to start sewing school uniforms in the future.

loans.use: to buy textiles and a sewing machine

loans.name: Ruth Wangui

texts.en:
Ruth, 41, has operated her tailor shop in Naivasha town since 1985.  She is married to Geoffrey Mwatha, and together they have three children.

Ruith was introduced to KADET by a friend. This will be her second loan.  She paid her first loan of KES 20,000 in good time.  She plans to use this new loan to buy more fabric to make new clothes; she hopes to cash in during the coming festive season. In the future, Ruth hopes to have a bigger shop in which to sell her wares.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to make new clothes

loans.name: Lhaasuren

texts.en: Lhaasuren N. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his daughters attend a local secondary school. Lhaasuren owns and operates a consumer goods retail business in his town. He started his business in 2007 by selling a variety of consumer goods in a rented stall at the "Undrah" trade center. Since then, his business was successful enough to purchase a container where his wife has been operating a retail clothing business. They have found success with both businesses and their working capital has reached 2,000,000 MNT today. His earnings have enabled him to purchase a fence and a car for his family as well as the container for his business. Lhaasuren is a very modest and hardworking man and is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory goods for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory goods

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town since 2006. She is 30 years old and married to Peter. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy a motorcycle for transportation. She will employ somebody to operate it for her.

In the future, Ann hopes to grow her business from retail to wholesale.

loans.use: To a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Henry Nyabuto

texts.en:
Henry has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 46 years old, married to Loyce Njambi and they have eight children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to rent a piece of land for farming.  This will increase his yield.

In the future, Henry hopes to open a retail shop to supplement his farm income.

loans.use: To rent a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Paul Ochiel

texts.en:
Paul has been in auto repair in Naivasha town since 1996.  He is 35 years old, married to Hellen Akinyi and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time.  He plans to buy a battery charger and open a clothes shop for his wife with the loan.

In the future, Paul hopes to open his own auto garage and be self-employed.

loans.use: To buy a battery charger and open a clothes shop for his wife.

loans.name: Mary Atieno

texts.en:
Mary Atieno A. is 47 years old and a widow. She has eight children who she is taking care of. They live in Migori town.

Mary does a business of selling clothes fabric/materials in the open air market and has been in this business for the past ten years.  She is applying for her seventh loan of Kshs 70,000 from Kadet Ltd and has a good credit history with us through the years. Mary wants to use the money to buy several materials to add to her stock to be able to meet the demands of her clients.

Her hopes and dream is to expand her business and establish a store where she will be able to sell directly to people instead of hawking.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Faithful” group from Makeni. They are small-scale businesswomen who are based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each of them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ramatu K.. Ramatu is 30 years old and was born in Bombali district. She is married to a businessman and they have two children. 

Ramatu sells palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil). She has been running this business for many years now. She will use her share of this loan to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline M. is 26 years old, married to Martin Simiyu and they have a son who is called Kevin. He is four years old. He is in a baby class. They live in the Lugulu area in the outskirts of Kakamega town.

Caroline does a salon business where she also has a display on one side where she sells new shoes as well and she is applying for her first loan as she is in dire need of hair chemicals and rollers for the salon business. She has been running the salon for the past two years and her monthly income is Kshs 6,000. 

She hopes to open up a boutique to run alongside the salon to enable her to make extra profits.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and rollers to add to her stock

loans.name: Elijah Kariuki

texts.en:
Elijah has been operating his motorcycle for transportation in Naivasha town for the last 3 1/2 years.  He is 24 years old, married to Esther Wanjiru and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 67,500 well and on time.  He plans to use the loan amount to open a retail shop, which will be run by his wife.

In future, Elijah hopes to own his own lorry, which he will be use to transport goods for people.

loans.use: To open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.name: John Ngaruiya

texts.en:
John has operated a transport business in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is 33 years old, married to Ann Njeri and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He has paid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to buy a new motorbike with the loan.

In the future, John hopes to own a lorry, which he will use for transporting goods.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Lydia Ailo

texts.en:
Lydia Ailo O. is a 43-year-old skilled and experienced businesswoman who has a longstanding relationship with her school. She operates her own Private School where she earns a living. She is married to Kaloli Wandera. They have five children aged 25 years, 21 years, 17 years, 16 years and 8 years, respectively. They live in Kabiyemit Eldoret, Kenya

Lydia started her business in 2005 with Ksh. 25,000 startup capital. She has been in this business for the past five years with an income of Kshs. 60,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of Kshs.25, 000 with KADET LTD. With her loan, she plans to buy stationary and desks.

loans.use: To buy stationary and desks.

loans.name: Jacinta Mugore

texts.en:
Jacinta is married and they have three children who are going to school. They live in Ngong. This is where the business is located and most of her customers are area residents.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients and she is taking a third loan from KADET after paying her previous loans successfully. She has no history with any other Micro-Finance Institution, Jacinta has been in the retail business for two years. With the loan, she will increase her stock of  assorted cereals (e.g. beans, green gramms) since cereals have a huge profit margin and are very much in demand as this is the most common source of affordable food for most people.

With the extra profits, she will purchase her own piece of land as her hope and dream is to build rental houses. Jacinta describes herself as enterprising.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals

loans.name: Violet Lukwa

texts.en:
Violet Lukwa L. is a hardworking lady of 39 years married to Titus Amako Omuse. Together they have five children aged 16 years, 15 years, 13 years, 11 years and 9 years. She has been selling vegetables and fruits for the past eight years and she earns a monthly income of Kshs. 4,000. They live in Eldoret, Kenya.

When she learned about KADET LTD and had no history with any other MFI, she immediately applied for her first loan of Kshs. 10,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to purchase vegetables and fruits. She plans to use the profits to expand her business.

Violet hopes to grow her business and see their children realize their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Isaac Murugu

texts.en:
Isaac, 40 years old, has operated his butcher shop, specializing in goat meat, in Naivasha town for the last five years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He has paid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use this cash to add more goats to slaughter and sell the meat.

In the future, Isaac hopes to become a supplier of goat meat to other butcher shops.

loans.use: To buy goats for slaughtering

loans.name: Cherono

texts.en:
Cherono B. is a hardworking lady of 37 years who is married to Philip Tanui, a civil servant. Together they have four children aged 16 years, 13 years, 7 years and 5 years. They live in Cheplasgei Eldoret, Kenya. She has been farming (dairy farm & poultry) for the past 10 years and she earns a monthly income of Kshs. 15,000.

When she learned about KADET LTD, she joined a group and got her first loan. She had no previous history with any other MFI when she joined KADET. She repaid her fist loan well and currently she has applied for her second loan of Kshs. 80,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to buy more poultry chicks and a dairy cow. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to increase the number of dairy cows for dairy farming, which is also very marketable in this area.

Cherono hopes to grow her business, become the leading local investor and see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy more poultry chicks and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Duncan Samwel

texts.en:
Duncan has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 20 years. He is 65 years old and married to Peris Wanjiru. They have six children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to plant vegetables on his farm.

In the future, Duncan hopes to own a large tract of land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To plant vegetables

loans.name: Able Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Able” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve.

 Mariatu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. Mariatu was born in one of the several villages that make up Yoni. She is 34 years of age, married and has four children: two are in primary school and two in secondary school. Mariatu sells palm oil, rice, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Cornelius Moturi

texts.en:
Cornelius has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last 15 years. He is 34 years old and married to Christine Nyaboke. They have five children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to plant onions and tomatoes, which he will sell.

In the future, Cornelius hopes to open a cereals shop to be run by his wife.

loans.use: To plant onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina O. A. is 36 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 12 years old respectively, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. 

Her business is located at the Bamburi Mwandoni estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and it is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean's white beaches. 

She makes clothes for adults and children. She provides tailoring services to the local people. She has been doing this business for the last five years now and has managed to provide employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that people are keen to have clothes made only during the festive seasons, therefore, during other times, business is low with low returns. 

However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy materials for making curtains and bed covers. She hopes to grow her business and eventually open a boutique with the best fashion designs. She also sees herself opening a tailoring college. She describes herself as very creative.

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Mashibei Kiparmet

texts.en:
Mashibei is married with four children whom she and her husband support.

Mashibei joined KADET through a credit officer. She is taking a first loan with KADET LTD and is not involved with other Micro-Finance. Mashibei has been in the livestock business for two years. With the loan she intends to increase the number of livestock she has. Mashibei's business is located near a busy market, giving her many customers.

With the extra profits, Mashibei hopes to send her children to university. In the future, she hopes to transport her livestock to Kenya Meat Commission for sale. Mashibei believes she is hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase livestock.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 40-year-old married man with two children.  He sells stationery supplies to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has managed to employ two people.  He also sells fish for extra income.   He was previously selling tailoring materials such as zippers and buttons.  He has requested for 50,000 KES to buy books and pens to sell.  He hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.  In five years, he wants to expand his business and employ more people.

loans.use: To buy books and pens

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del segundo ciclo, y han retirado su segundo crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya, algunas para invertir y mejorar su negocio y otras para comenzar con alguna actividad.
Sobre el grupo se puede rescatar la responsabilidad que tienen las señoras con el grupo y el cumplimiento de las obligaciones como el pago de las cuotas, asistencia a las capacitaciones y otros.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Margarita R. quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles, ella comenta que  acude hasta los lugares con mucha concurrencia de gente para ofrece sus comestibles.
En todas las actividades que ella realiza la ayudan sus hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que ella utiliza para la elaboración de los comestibles como carne, aceite, harina ya que estos son los principales para prepara empanadas, milanesas, marineras y otros, muy consumidos por los clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is working towards their second cycle, and they have received their second loan from the Fundación Paraguaya. Some members will use the loan money to invest and improve their businesses and others will be starting new ventures. 

The group is notable for the responsibility of the women, their punctual payments, and their attendance at trainings, among other things.

One of the members, Mrs. Margarita R. works selling food. She sells her products by going to heavily trafficked areas to sell her meals. Her children help her with all of her business activities. 

She will use the loan money to purchase ingredients to make her meals like meat, oil, and flour because these are the principal ingredients for empanadas, milanesas (breaded meat), and other dishes that are popular with her clients.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food like meat, flour, cooking oil.

loans.name: Justinah

texts.en: Justinah is a member of the Dandora Success group in Faulu Kenya.  She supplies rice mainly to hotels.  She was previously selling second-hand clothes to earn a living. She has been motivated through Faulu Kenya and she has now become more focused in her business.  She sees herself owning a cereal store in the future.  She has requested 18,000 KES to buy rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is house rent.  

He has been operating M-pesa (mobile money transfer services) for the last year. His potential customers are the town dwellers and passersby. Mike faces the major challenge of competition because of the many shops with similar products. Mike hopes to open at least three more mobile money transfer shops.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase airtime scratch cards and purchase a photocopier machine. He decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase airtime scratch cards and a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with a teenage son Alexander. She is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka where she grows early spring vegetables, i.e. tomatoes, radishes, etc. Yuliya owns two spacious arch greenhouses. She has been in the farming business for 15 years. Currently she has already invested about 40,000 Grivnyas in this business. The annual cost of seeds and polyethylene film amounts to 5,000-7,000 Grivnyas.  

Yuliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to finish construction of the third greenhouse and purchase quality polyethylene film for it. Yuliya is hoping to grow tomatoes in the new greenhouse. Yuliya loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given, not only to provide for herself but also to help her family.

loans.use: To finish construction of a new greenhouse & purchase polyethylene film for it

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. is 41 years old and married to Dalmas Okeyo. They have six children who are above 18 years old. They live in Kisumu city where she runs her business.

Christine is a fishmonger and she has been running this business for the past 15 years. She has created a huge clientele because people have a good rapport with her and because she is reliable. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, having been introduced by a friend who is also a client here.

Her desire is to expand the business and be able to sustain her family from the profits that she makes from her business.

loans.use: To buy fish to add to her stock

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He rents a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is electricity.

He has operated his green vegetable stall for more than four years, selling to his neighbours and passers-by. Joseph faces the major challenge of seasonality. During rainy seasons, vegetables are scarce in supply. He hopes to start a motorcycle business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase green vegetables (sukuma wiki) and a sack of tomatoes for resale. Joseph decided to join Yehu because of accessibility to sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and a sack of tomatoes.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are house rent and school fees.

He has been operating his laundry business from home for the last 11 years. Previously he was employed at an oil company. He hopes to open a boutique to sell clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase a washing machine. Alex decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two daughters, who are 11 and 13 years old. She is a market vendor who owns two vending locations in two different markets of Ivano-Frankivsk: Central marketplace and Novgorodskyi market. Ludmila runs a teenage clothing sales business. She launched her venture eight years ago through lending assistance for start-ups. Currently, her monthly income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas.

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to purchase 100 sweaters, 50 body shirts, 50 pants and 50 jackets to re-stock her merchandise. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Ludmila is planning to continue expanding her trade and to open a new vending location in the future. Profits generated will be used to finish construction of her private house which is still in process.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sweaters, 50 body shirts, 50 pants and 50 jackets

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice Adongo is 43 years old and married to Barnabas O.. They have four children: Elizabeth, 22; Martin, 18;, Clinton, 15; and Brian, 12. They live in Nyamasaria area in the outskirts of Kisumu city.

Eunice has a hotel where she basically sells junk food, especially chips. She is in dire need to buy more sacks of potatoes to enable her meet the demands of her clients and has thus applied for a loan of Kshs 50,000. This is her first loan that she is taking from KADET LTD after being introduced by a fellow client.

Her desire is to be able to buy a piece of land and in the future to be able to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to add to the stock

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a grown daughter, Maryana. She is a private entrepreneur from Stryi, Western Ukraine. Galina sells groceries, i.e. cereal, noodles, spices, etc., in the local food marketplace. She offers a nice selection of groceries in her vending kiosk. Galina has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, she has 10,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Net profit is over 1,000 Grivnyas a month.

Galina is planning to invest a loan of 3,000 Grivnyas in the purchase of food merchandise for her kiosk. Many Ukrainians buy groceries in store for winter. The type of inventory Galina offers for sale in her kiosk is the most popular kind of products people usually buy, like canned food, noodles, sugar, flour and tea. Galina is hoping to sell up this batch of items and earn additional income as a result.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Euphemia

texts.en:
Euphemia is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has operated her retail shop business for over three years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Euphemia faces the challenge of theft because of insecurity in the area. She hopes to purchase a piece of land to construct rental houses in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, rice, maize flour and bundles of wheat flour.
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, rice, maize flour and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Nzioki

texts.en:
Nzioki is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a beauty salon business for over two years. In addition she has a posho mill that is used for grinding maize into corn flour which contributes another source of income.

Nzioki faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the months of February and March, customer turnover is very low compared to holiday seasons when parents go for vacations and they purchase hair weaves. She hopes to purchase another posho mill in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase an electric hair dryer, hair weaves and hair oil. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the society.

loans.use: To purchase an electric hair dryer, hair weaves and hair oil.

loans.name: Mburucuja Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del  decimo primer ciclo, todas ya con mucha experiencia en las actividades que realizan.
Realmente es un comité muy unido ya que han superado varios inconveniente para continuar con el grupo.
Una de las integrantes  es la señora  Fernanda F. con 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la  venta de ropas que distribuye en las tiendas  el de la ciudad de Lambaré y en otras localidades cercanas lo realiza en la hora de la tarde  y regresa a su casa ya cuando oscurece .
Es una señora muy trabajadora y valiente porque lucha para el día a día y de esa forma poder salir adelante con sus hijos.   
Lo que anhela  es tener su propio local comercial. 
Con su trabajo ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que estudian. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, blusas, camisas, shorts, soleras, zapatillas, y otros.
texts.en:
This group is currently on their tenth loan cycle and each member has acquired a great deal of experience in their individual businesses. The members of the group are very close having faced many difficulties together. 

One of the members is Fernanda F.. She is 59 years old and she has 2 children. She sells clothing, distributing to the various stores in the city of Lambare and other neighboring regions. She works in the afternoons, only returning home when the night has fallen. She is a very hard working and brave woman, for the struggles she faces day after day for the sake of her children. 

Her goal is to have a store of her own. 

She is able to cover the household expenses and her children's tuition with her business. She requests a loan to purchase jackets, blouses, shirts, shorts, sun dresses, and shoes among other clothing merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are house rent and school fees.

He operates a bicycle repair business at his workshop, where neighbors and passersby are his potential customers. He faces the major challenge of transportation, because high costs are incurred during the transportation of spare parts to his place of work. He hopes to open a welding shop in the future. 

Martin decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the society. With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase spare parts for bicycles for his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Gune

texts.en: Gune L. is currently in the business of selling onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more onions to sell.  Gune is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is part of the Government of Southern Sudan staff. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: Stock more onions to sell

loans.name: Zaituny

texts.en:
Zaituny is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity bills.

For two years, she has operated a food vending business, cooking chapati (flat bread) and beans to sell. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Zaituny faces the major challenge of competition from neighbors who operate the same business. She hopes to build real estate houses in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase beans, cooking fats and wheat flour. Zaituny decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the society.

loans.use: To purchase beans, cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is 39 years old and the single mother of three children who are all below the age of 18. They live in Kisumu City where she runs her business.

Alice has an electronics shop where she sells electronic accessories and has been running this business for the past year and has seen her business grow. The first loan that she applied for earlier on really helped her to expand her business, and now there is a need to take out a second loan. She has a good credit history with us. She intends to use the money to buy electronic accessories like electric bulb sockets, adaptors, etc. to add to her stock. Alice's monthly income comes to approximately $188.

Her desire is to be able to open up another electronics shop in the neighboring town.

loans.use: Buy electronic accessories.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while three have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated her business of selling natural juice, soft drinks and ice blocks for two years. Khadija faces the major challenge of seasonality. During rainy winter seasons the demand for ice blocks and cold drinks is low compared to hot summer seasons. She hopes to be a wholesaler of charcoal in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to repair her refrigerator and purchase a container for storing ice blocks to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the society.

loans.use: To repair her refrigerator and purchase a container for storing ice blocks to sell.

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya M. is a 50 year old widow and mother of 6 children. She sales ice blocks as well as charcoa to earn herincome from Malindi town dwellers where her businesses are situated. This is the third time that Zakiya has taken a loan from KADET LTD and it is of Kshs. 50,000. She plans to use the money to expand her nine year old businesses by increasing her stock of charcoal and buying a modern freezer for her ice business.
The lady was introduced to KADET LTD by another client from the company and wishes to use the anticipated profit from her business to help educate her children and further expand her ever growing businesses.

loans.use: To expand the business by adding more supplies of charcoal and  buy  a modern freezer

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with ten children, three of whom attend school while the others have graduated. She lives int her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She operates a vegetable stall selling green vegetables and tomatoes. In addition she has houses for rent which contribute as her other source of income. Halima faces the major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators. She hopes to build three more houses for rent in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase iron sheets to renovate her leaking roof and a sack of sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and tomatoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets to renovate her leaking roof and a sack of sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is 42 years old and married to Jackson K. and they have eight children who are over 18 years old. They live in Chemursoi which is in Kisumu city.

Margaret has a business selling maize and has done this business for the last 10 years. She is applying for her fourth loan and has been a good client with a good credit history with us. Her monthly income comes to Kshs 10,000. She intends to use the money to buy more maize to add to her already existing stock. Her profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to see her business grow and be able to employ someone to help her run it.

loans.use: To buy maize to add to her stock

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent.

He has operated his business of selling fresh water for over six years which he distributes with his hand cart to the neighboring community. Mohamed faces the major challenge of seasonality. During rainy winter seasons the demand for water is low as nearly all water dams are full of water. He hopes to construct a permanent house for his family in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to start another business of selling fish and purchase a sack of dried fish for resale. Mohamed decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility to sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To start another business of selling fish and purchase a sack of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, maize, rice and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Mrangirangi Group

texts.en:
Esther A. is in her late fifties and is married with three children. Since 1997, Esther has been running a charcoal business. The shop is open daily between 6 am and 6:30 pm and earns Esther a good monthly profit. 

This will be Esther's 8th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Esther's previous loans were all used to increase her supplies of charcoal. These loans have all been successfully repaid. Esther aims to use her 8th loan to once again increase her stock of charcoal.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group Mrangirangi, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Esther can be seen on the far right in the back row.

loans.use: Increase stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa B. lives in the Naguru neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (Sisters, Nephew and Nieces).  Hanifa has a business of sewing school uniforms and clothes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Hanifa sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Hanifa has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more clothing materials and also another modern sewing machine.

The main business challenge(s) for Hanifa include unstable prices of clothing materials and also clients taking long to pick finished clothes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are owning three electric sewing machines and also educating her children up to university.   Hanifa lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materias

loans.name: Ejidia

texts.en:
Ejidia is a married woman with two children; one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated her vegetable stall business for the last one year where she sells vegetables and bananas. She faces a challenge of competition from other operating vegetable stalls. Ejidia hopes to open a cereal shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to open a cereals shop, purchase maize, beans and cow peas for resale. Her main aim of working with Yehu is to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To open a cereal shop, purchase maize, beans and cow peas for resale.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school.  He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and house rent. 

For over ten years, he has operated his retail shop selling sugar, tea leaves and wheat flour to his neighbours. Bakari faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business due to fluctuation of prices of the commodities. In the future he would like to build real estate houses. 

Bakari decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation from the society. With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bags of sugar, rice and beans.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar, rice and beans.

loans.name: Bustani One Group

texts.en:
Lucy M. is in her late thirties and is married. She has been running a her tailoring business since 1999. Lucy specialises in women's suits, mainly made of linen. The business is open daily between 9 am and 7 pm and earns a good monthly profit. 

This will be Lucy's 2nd Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Lucy used her first loan to increase her stock of linen in order to meet rising demand for her suits. Lucy aims to use her second Motisha loan to once again increase her linen stock. Lucy's dream is to be able to go for further studies, as well as expanding the business by receiving new orders from Arusha and Morogoro.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group, Bustani One, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Lucy can be seen standing on the far left in the back row.

loans.use: Increasing Linen stock.

loans.name: Mashineya Maji No 5 Group

texts.en:
Salome A. is in her mid-40s and is married with five children. Nine months ago she opened her own grocery store where she sells beer, soda and several other goods. The shop is open daily between 8am and 11pm and earns Salome a good monthly profit.
This will be Salome's first loan with Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Salome aims to increase the variety of goods in her store, as well as stocking up on existing goods. Salome's dream is to earn enough profit to make improvements to her store one day.
Salome will share this loan with her loan group Mashineya Maji No 5, which totals 26 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.
In the picture, Salome can be seen wearing an orange and white scarf, first on the left.

loans.use: To increase stock of goods

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
commerçante de 49ans mariée et mère de 2 anfants agés de 34ans et 31ans at ayant 2 personnes à charges.elle débute son activité en 1982 avec un capital de 2000frs.ses recettes sont de 45000frs par jours.

Elle à pour stategie d'être toujours souriante, de faire la varition des menus, de satisfaire les clients en les offrants les meilleurs plats.

avec ce pret elle achetera des poissons fumés,poissons salé,des legumes,des poissons girel, poissons d'eau douce, des barbillons,de la soles, carpes.
Avec ses éparnges elle aimerait en avenir élargir son activité en offrant à ses clients un grand restaurant plus moderne et veut aussi que ses enfants exerce un metier digne de ce nom, il veut qu'ils vivent mieux.

son antourage se plein dès lors qu'elle ne vend pas. Elle est aussi beaucoup respecter.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 49 years old, married and the mother of two (34 and 31 years old), with two dependents. She launched her business in 1982 with a starting capital of 2000 West African Francs. Her sales are 45,000 Francs per day.

Her strategy is to be always smiling,  prepare a diverse menu and  keep her customers happy by offering them her best cooking. With this loan she will purchase smoked fish, salted fish, vegetables, rainbow wrasse, freshwater fish, barbel, sole, and carp.

With her savings she would like to expand her business to open a large, more modern restaurant for her customers. She also would like that her children have a real profession and lead a better life.  Her friends and family complain when she stops selling her food. She is well respected.

loans.use: Purchasing fresh, salted and smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase milk products and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bale of window curtains and bedsheets for resale

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su decimo tercer ciclo, trabajando en conjunto entre las integrantes. Cada una de ellas realiza un trabajo independiente adema de los trabajos que realizan como grupo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sra. Evangelista G. con 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a vender sus productos de limpieza  por la mañana en un bolso y de paso junta  los envases reciclados luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su venta de reciclajes.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que utiliza para elaborar los productos de limpieza que ella venda como detergentes, desodorante de ambiente y otros.
texts.en:
The group is currently on its tenth loan cycle. Each of the members has their own business but they also have work that brings them together as a group. 

One of the members is Mrs. Evangelista Gonzalez. She is 50 years old and she has 2 children who stay at home while she goes out to sell cleaning products in the mornings. She carries the products in a sack that she later fills with empty bottles for recycling. She comes home to have lunch ready and she goes out again afterward to sell the recyclable goods. 

She is a much stressed woman, having to go out day after day with a very heavy load. When she comes home from work she has to do housework, doing all of this for the sake of her children.  She is a single mother. 

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to be used to make the cleaning products she sells, such as detergents and household air fresheners among other products.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make cleaning products.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is part of the communal bank “Luz de Esperanza” and resides in the city of Concepción. María makes empanadas and sells them wholesale to a business, a fixed client. She complete orders and delivers at weekends. María also produces baked goods, such as tarts and candies, when she receives pre-orders. In the summer María makes corn pot pie (similar to chicken pot pie but with a freshly made corn crust) and humitas (corn tamales). For many years María has owned an industrial oven. At first, she purchased it without any intention of using it for business reasons, but when her husband died, about 13 years ago, she began to use it to cook and soon after started selling her products. In the future, María dreams of owning a small restaurant, occupying a space in her home.
With this loan María will purchase materials out of stock and would like to start gathering materials for mid-November, to make panettone bread for Christmas. She has valued the weekly payment structure of Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, which helps her remain organized with her accounting. María has benefited from lessons on business administration.
Concepción sits in the mouth of the BioBío River, one of the largest in the country, south of Chile, within the BíoBío region. Concepción has had an important role in the history of Chile, as home to major battles and important settlements, especially during the War of Arauco, and borders the Mapuche territory (indigenous settlement). Currently, the city has an important economic and demographic, administrative, financial and most important commercial relevance for Chile, right after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: To purchase baking materials

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El señor Rubén  es soltero vive con en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente tiene 38 años, está trabajando en tramites legales; Ruben estudiará un curso de tres meses de medicina forense, y el crédito lo utilizará para pagar la matricula y las pensiones.
El señor Rubén trabaja como tramitador la ciudad del Alto.
Es su tercer crédito con IMPRO y su historial de pagos es bueno. El análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ruben is single and he lives together with his parents in the region of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. 

He is 38 years old and he works as a paralegal. Ruben will enroll in a three-month course specializing in forensic medicine. The loan will be used to pay for the tuition of the course.   Ruben works for the city of Alto. This is his third loan with IMPRO (Kiva Field Partner) and his history has been good. His socioeconomic analysis reveals that he is eligible to receive a loan.

loans.use: To pay for tuition expenses.

loans.name: Nyiikira Okole Women's Group-Kampala

texts.en:
Youthful and industrious hard work, energy, buoyancy and resolve have been 28-year-old N. Betty’s calling cards and her advantage in her six years of operation in her Pub and Restaurant business along Entebbe road-Kampala. She has been holding on tenaciously to this purpose ever since she got pep talk encouragement from friends to obtain a footing in this business. Striking a happy medium in business is always a tall order, but with a sense of determination, one will always prevail. Once she got into her stride back then, it’s been hard for even the hardest of circumstances to throw her out of gear. 

Betty previously operated a shop. She says her clients are mostly working class individuals. Her husband, she says, has always been at her beck and call. What is on the horizon for Betty is the opening up of another Pub in the near future. Over $67 is what she makes in a week. With this loan, Betty says she is going to be financially empowered to smoothly shoulder most of her responsibilities like paying her kids' school dues.  Betty is the mother of three and is affiliated with the Nyiikira Okole group-Kampala.

loans.use: The school dues of her three kids

loans.name: Banche  Mireille  Aimée

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 40ans mère célibataire de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie de 22ans à 9 ans et ayant 1e  personne en charge tous scolarisés. En 1999 elle se lance dans la vente des produits pharmaceutiques avec un capital de 150000frs. Ses ventes sont de 15000 à 60000 frs par jours.

Sa stratégie est d’épargner pour aller de l’avant. Elle aimerait être fournisseur et bien scolariser ses enfants afin qu’ils deviennent l'une des grand cadre de ce pays.

Réputée dans lla pharmacie, avec ce prêt elle va acheter des quinines,des seringues,de l'alcool, du paracetamol, de la nivaquine,des sirop. 
Elle à une bonne réputation dans son entourage elle on l'appel maman docteur.
texts.en: This shopkeeper is a single 40 year-old mother of four, whose children and one ward are aged 9 to 22 years old and all attend school. In 1999 she started her own business selling pharmaceutical products, with base funds of 150,000 FRS. She generates between 15,000 and 60,000 FRS of sales every day.  Her strategy is to save money going forward; she would like to be a supplier and pay for her children's education so that they will be successful in life. She has an excellent reputation in her field, and aims to use this loan in order to purchase quinine, syringes, alcohol, paracetamol, nivaquine and syrups. She is held in such high esteem that those around her call her 'Mother Doctor'.

loans.use: Achat nivaquine, aspirine,paracetamol,seringue

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is part of the communal bank “Peulla Brotes Nuevos” and resides within the city of Viña del Mar. Teresa sells used clothing, at customer's houses and in her own home. In addition, she also started selling lingerie a year ago. Teresa is partners with her daughter, a seamstress who makes alterations to clothing items and sells workout clothing in a school. Teresa's other daughter is also an entrepreneur and runs a hair salon and gym. All three of them belong to the communal bank of Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, and are progressing in their respective businesses. With the loans they have received, they have been able to purchase machines, products and necessary materials.
With this loan, Teresa will purchase school uniform blazers to sell, and also beans (a food product that is currently low in price but will rise in the months ahead). Teresa dreams of a business that is established in her house.
Viña del Mar is a city and community located in the central coastal region of Chile, known as the "Garden City" because of its beautiful parks and gardens. The city is in the Valparaíso region, known for its temperate climate. This region is known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To purchase school blazers for resale

loans.name: Limber

texts.es: El Sr. Limber Vive en localidad de el Torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacido en la provincia florida, de los valles cruceños, se dedica a la construcción de casas en la ciudad, es albañil hace unos dos año, el destino del crédito es para comprar una motocicleta y realizar el servicio de transporte urbano, ya que su actividad en algunas épocas es baja, por lo que alternara con esta nueva actividad, vive en la casa de su madre, su esposa se dedica a la agricultura, en la localidad de Guarayos, del departamento de Santa Cruz, no tienen hijo , pero su esposa tiene una pequeña de su antiguo esposo, ya que quedo viuda y recién están haciendo una vida juntos, el Sr. Limber es una persona muy Trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Limber lives in the region of Torno, located at a distance of 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He was born in the province of Florida, in the Valles Crucenos region. He is a construction worker who builds houses in the city. He has been in the business for about two years. The loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle to provide public transport in the city, this business to supplement his income for those times he finds himself between construction contracts. He lives together with his mother. His wife is an agriculturist in the city of Guarayos, in the region of Santa Cruz. He doesn't have any children but his wife has a little girl from her first husband. She was widowed but they are building a life together. Limber is a very hard working person and he is very grateful with the organization for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Leticia Yamileth

texts.es:
la señora Leticia Yamileth H. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Ruben Dario Sarmiento tienen dos hijos. Leticia y su esposo tienen casa propia y viven comodamente.
Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, es una tienda general en la que vende cosmeticos, perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, ganchos, sandalias, y muchas cosas mas. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años.
sus clientes son los vecinos, amigos y hermanos de la iglesia a la que asiste.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para tener mas surtido su negocio y asi tener mayores ventas y mas ganancias.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que sus hijos son muy sanos y que todo le esta saliendo bien.
texts.en:
Leticia Yamileth H. is 34 years old and she is married with Mr. Ruben Dario Sarmiento.  They have two children together. Leticia and her husband own their own home and they live comfortably. Her business is located in their home and it is a general store from where she sells cosmetics, perfumes, deodorants, skin creams, hair accessories, sandals and many other items. She has had this business for the past 3 years.

Her clients are her neighbors, friends and her church family. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to have a greater variety of products in her business and in this manner, ensure greater sales and improved profits. 

She is very happy especially because her children are healthy and everything seems to be going well.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
la sra. Sonia Patricia M. Z. tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos y su pareja trabaja en la iglesia como operador de maquinas, vive en una casa de su madre ya que ellos no han podido tener su propia casa. 
Sonia lleva mas de 6 años dedicandose al negocio de venta de ropa, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mas ropa, nos comento que dentro de dos meses estaremos en la epoca del año que las ventas son muy buenas y quiere estar preparada para dicha epoca.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa, nos dijo que ya habia comprado el terreno donde va a construir.
texts.en:
Sonia Patricia M. Z. is 28 years old and she is the mother of three. Her partner works in the church as a machinery operator. They all live together in her mother's house having failed to have one of their own. 

Sonia has had 6 years in business selling clothes. She will use this loan to purchase more clothing. She indicated that in six-month's time they will experience the yearly high in sales and she wants to be ready for the season. 

Her dream is to build her own home. She has already bought the land where they will build.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ely

texts.es: La Sra. Ely Vive en la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace uno 15 años que vino a vivir a la ciudad de Santa Cruz buscando mejores días para ella y su familia , hace 20 años que se dedica a la actividad de la costura, el destino del crédito es para comprar tela y accesorios, su esposo se dedica al transporte de equipo pesado, tienen dos hijos en edad escolar, están en el proceso de la construcción de su casa ya que se encuentra en estado, rustico, el deseo de la Sra. Ely es de ver terminada su casa, por esta razón trabajan duro ella y su esposo, esta muy agradecida con la Institución por el apoyo Brindado.
texts.en: Ely lives in the region of La Guardia, located at a distance of 20 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She is originally from the region of Cochabamba but about 15 years ago she came to the city of Santa Cruz in search for a better future for herself and for her family. For the past 20 years she has been a seamstress. The loan will be used to purchase fabrics and accessories. Her husband is a transport truck driver. They have two school aged children. They are in the process of having a house built for them. The one they currently live in is rustic. Ely's dream is to see her home finished and to this end she and her husband work very hard. She is very grateful to the organization for the support they provide.

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Léon Serge  Galixte

texts.fr:
homme de 42ans marié et père de 2 enfants agé de 4ans à 17 mois.il se lance dans la vente des pains en 1999 avec un capital de 13000frs. sa recette est de 50000frs par jours.

avec ce prêt il va acheter des pains, du beurre, du paté de campagne,du saucisson sec, du jambon,du fromage.

il reserve un bon acceuil à ses clients,fait une bonne presentation de ses clients.

il veut prosperer car il à de la volante dans ce qu'il fait. il veut que ses enfants aient une bonne scolarisation ainsi que mettre son épouse dans une école de formation.
texts.en:
This 42 year married father has two children aged 17 months and 4 years old. He began selling bread for a living in 1999 with base capital of 13,000 FRS. He now makes around 50,000 a day. 
He intends to use this loan to purchase bread, butter, paté, cured sausage, ham and cheese. He is always very welcoming to his customers. He would like to prosper so that his children can receive a good education, and so that he can also send his wife to training school.

loans.use: Purchase bread, butter, dried sausage, ham and cheese.

loans.name: Sixta Marina

texts.es:
la señora Sixta Marina F. tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada y ya no tiene hijos que dependen de ella.
Su actividad es la venta de ropa usada y venta de tarjetas para recargas de celular, doña Sixta es una mujer
muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene casa propia y su negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa en donde sus clientes le llegan a comprar la mercaderia y los fines de semana sale con unos de sus hijos en el carro a los barrios y colonias a vender el producto de casa en casa.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un fardo de ropa y tambien para comprar recargas de celular.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sixta Marina F. is 54 years old and she is married. She doesn't have any children that still depend on her. 

She sells used clothing and she sells prepaid cell phone cards. Sixta is a very responsible woman and she is very hard working. She has her own home and she also runs her business there.  Her clients can come and purchase merchandise and on the weekends she goes out with one of her children in a car to all the different colonies and districts to sell door to door. The loan will be used to purchase a load of clothing and to purchase more prepaid cell phone cards.

loans.use: To purchase a loan of clothing and prepaid cell phone cards for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Senovia

texts.es: La Sra.  Senovia es una ama de casa preocupada por darles una mejor condición de vida a su familia y a sus hijos, es por tal motivo que ella desde ya bastante tiempo viene trabajando de forma independiente con la comercialización de diferentes productos como por ejemplo: limones, queso y leche; además de aquello ella cuenta con una surtida tienda de abarrotes en la zona en la cual vive con la cual a venido trabajando desde hace unos 3 años. Doña  Senovia es cliente antigua de la institución y es por tal motivo que ella se acerco a nuestras oficinas para que le podamos facilitar un crédito y así surtir su tienda de abarrotes, esto debido a la necesidad que tiene de hacerlo ya que cuenta con una creciente clientela. Doña Senovia ha sido cliente asidua de la institución desde hace muchos años y además de aquello cuenta con casa propia y un buen historial crediticio, razones suficientes como para haberle otorgado el crédito que necesitaba.
texts.en: Senovia is a housewife and she works to provide the best quality of life for her family and her children. For their sake she spends a great deal of effort selling interpedently a variety of products, including: lemons, cheese, and milk. She also has a grocery store in the neighborhood where she lives, one she has had for the past 3 years. Senovia is a long time member of the organization and she approached our offices to access a loan.  She wishes to stock her grocery store to satisfy her significant client base. Senovia has been a member for many years and she has her own home and a good credit history. These reasons suffice to grant her the loan that she requests.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Ivania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ivania está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes tienen años de trabajar con Adim. La coordinadora del grupo es Ana Julia S. de 54 años quien en el 2005 inicio su pequeño taller de costura y una comideria. Este negocio lo comenzó con poco pero gracias a los créditos ha ido mejorando, ella piensa invertir en telas, lentejuelas, aplicaciones etc. especialmente por la época que vienen las promociones, casamientos… etc.

Las otras integrantes son Petrona G. de 51 años, señora jovial quien desde hace 7 años comercializa Frutas como sandilla, melón, piña, papaya etc. y por las tarde tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita, e Ivania Valladarez de 33 años desde los 11 años trabaja realizando tortillas bastimento por excelencia en la comida nicaragüense.
texts.en:
The Ivania group is made up of three hardworking, dedicated and enterprising women who have worked for years with Adim. The group coordinator is Ana Julia S., who is 54. In 2005, she started her small sewing workshop and a restaurant. She started this business little by little, but thanks to the loans she has improved. She plans on investing in fabric, sequins, appliques, etc., especially for the coming graduation and wedding season.  

The other members are Petrona G., 51, a jovial woman who for 7 years has sold fruit such as watermelon, pineapple, papaya, etc. In the aferrnoon, she has a fritanga, a poplar restaurant where she sells fried food. Ivania Vallardez, 33, has been making tortillas for 11 years, which is a base of Nicaraguan cuisine.

loans.use: For fabric. appliques, etc.

loans.name: Nyiikira Okole Women's Group 2-Kampala

texts.en:
"Rise up to the occasion" She truly has been a testament to that. This is the simple business story of 37-year-old Rose L., an enterprising retail businesswoman operating along Entebbe road in Kampala. 

She is happily married with four children. As proof of the fact that she has what it takes to take care of all of them, she says he has seen her first and second born children through school. It’s a flourishing 12-year-old business that has helped her make significant ends meet on weekly profits of about $66. 

In spite of the achievements she has registered, she is still behind schedule in many of her other set objectives, like her poultry business. It’s for this reason that she wants this loan. She figures she will be able to purchase more retail items in bulk, such as beans, ground nuts, rice, plastics, etc. that she will eventually resell. She also intends to improve her poultry business. Rose belongs to the Nyiikira Okole Women's group 2-Kampala.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail items such as beans, rice and plastics for resale.

loans.name: Christelle Evedith Florida

texts.fr:
Femme célibataire âgée de 29ans mère de 1enfant dont l’âge varie de 5ans. Depuis 18ans, elle vend de la layette au marché.

Son étalage et ses articles pour les enfants attirent les futures mamans et parents.
Par jour, elle vend  7000f minimum et 20000f maximum.
Le prêt va lui permettre de renouveler son stock de marchandises pour vendre plus en achetant : 10douzaine de couches, 10 ensembles tricots, 10ensembles « petits bateaux », 
5 douzaines de paires de chaussons, 20robes fillettes, 10bermudas, 5lots  de tee-shirts  et 
Chaussettes mixtes.

Elle voudrait un jour  avoir 2 ou 3 autres étalage et devenir femme d’affaire dans ce domaine.
Avec les revenus  qu’elle va générée, elle va s’occupée de la scolarité des son enfant et vivre dans des bonnes conditions.
Elle prise comme exemple dans  son quartier
texts.en:
Christelle is a single 29 year old mother of a 5 year old child. For the past 18 years, she has sold children's clothing in the the market. Her display in the market and the items she sells attract future mothers and parents. Each day she sells 7,000 to 20,000 francs worth of goods. This loan will enable her to re-stock her merchandise to sell: 10 dozen coats, 10 sets of sweater, 10 sets of babies clothing, 5 dozen pairs of slippers, 20 girl's dresses, 10 pairs of bermuda shorts, 5 lots of tee-shirts and mixed socks. 

One day she would like to have two or three shops and become a business woman in this area. With the earnings she generates, she would like use the money for her child's schooling and for improved living conditions. She is a positive example within her neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, women's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Pitaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo pitahaya lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras originarias de Masaya cuidad de la flores y cuna de folklore nicaragüense. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Antonia M. de 43 años ella se dedica a la crianza de animales de patio como pelibue, vacas, cerdo y gallinas con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos y un nieto. Ella en la actualidad con el préstamo piensa invertir en sandalias para diversificar su negocio.

Una de las integrantes es Jeissel B. Carballo de 29 años trabaja desde hace tres años en el comercio de productos Avon marca reconocida por su ventas vía catalogo, ella con el crédito desea mejorar su negocio y cumplir con sus encargos. Mientras  Auxiliadora Mejía hace diez años inicio una pequeña venta en la que en comienzo vendiendo pan, gaseosa y helado actualmente es una pulpería donde distribuye de todo un poco desde granos básicos, carne y cuadernos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The Pitahaya group is made up of three hardworking women from Masaya, city of flowers and Nicaraguan folklore. The group coordinator is Mrs. Antonia M., who is 43. She raises farm animals such as pelibuey sheep, cows, pigs and chickens with the help of one of her children and a grandson. She is planning on investing the loan in sandals to diversify her business. 

One of the members is Jeissel B. Carballo, 29, who for the last three years has worked selling Avon products. She has been recognized for her catalog sales. She wants to improve her business with the loan and fill her orders. Auxiliadora Mejía has had a small store for ten years where she sells bread, soft drinks, and ice cream. She distributes basic grains, meat, and notebooks, among other products.

loans.use: To purchase sandals

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 37 ans, marie et pere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 21 ans,il commence ce commerce en 2002 quand il perd son travail lors de la faillite de lusine ou il travaillait.

Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente, ses clients sont les entrepreneurs, les fonctionnaires qui sont entrain de construire des maisons.
En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours
Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer en achetant , des sanitaires,des robinets,des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des pointes de toute taille..
A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise au Cameroun, Nigeria et Dubai 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
Michel is a young 37 year old man, he is married and the father of three children between the ages of 5, and 21 years old. He started his business in2002 when he lost his job when the factory he worked for went bankrupt. In order to overcome this and take care of his family's needs, he launched his hardware business. 

He has several sales strategies and his clients are entrepreneurs and public servants who are trained to build houses. On average, he sells between 5,000 and 50,000 francs of goods. With this loan he will be able to increase his stock; he intends to purchase toilets, faucets, switches, fuses and nails of all sizes. In the future he intends to start a wholesale business and, with his savings, he will open a large store. He will travel to Cameroon, Nigeria and Dubai to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: Achat des interrupteurs, des fusibles

loans.name: Olinto Valle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Olinto V. está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas una de ellas es Juana Castellón, coordinadora del grupo, quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, prendas y cosméticos. Ella aprendió este oficio desde pequeña, ya que su abuelita trabajaba en ello viajaba a Guatemala y traía mercadería de venta.
Castellón desde hace 10 años trabaja sola en el comercio de mercadería especialmente de prendas de oro y plata la cual tiene mayor demanda. La meta de ella es tener una tienda y comprar ella su mercadería, ya que así los costos son más accesibles. 

Las otras dos integrantes son Liliam Suárez de 39 años quien comercializa ropa y cosméticos y otros productos que le encargan, el sueño de ella este contar con un local para comercializar sus productos y Roxana V. de 31 años hace 10 años puso una pequeña venta la cual ha ido creciendo hasta convertirse en una pulpería, la meta de esta señora es hacer más grande el local del negocio.
texts.en:
The group Olinto V. is comprised of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women. Juana Castellón, one of the women, is the coordinator of the group and dedicates herself to selling clothing, jewelry and cosmetics.  She learned this business from a young age, as her grandmother worked in the same type of enterprise traveling to Guatemala to obtain merchandise to sell.  For the past 10 years, Ms. Castellón has worked alone as a merchant selling especially gold and silver jewelry, which are in the most demand.  Her goal is to have a store and buy her own merchandise, as this would make her costs more manageable.

Another member is Liliam Suárez, 39 years old, who sells clothes and cosmetics, as well as other items requested by her customers.  Her dream is to have her own location from which to sell merchandise.  The other member, Rosana V., is 31 years old.  Ten years ago, she started a small business that grew until she converted it into a general store.  Her goal is to make the store bigger.

loans.use: To purchase gold and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Louis

texts.fr:
monsieur de 48 ans, celibataire et pere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 21 ans,il commence ce commerce en 2002 Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente et est tres gentil envers ses clients..  En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours

Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer en achetant des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des sanitaires,des robinets,des ampoules.
A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise en Afrique de l'ouest. 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
Louis is 48 years old, single and the father of three children between the ages of 5 and 21 years old. He started his hardware business in 2002 in order to take care of the needs of his family.

He has many sales strategies and is very nice to his customers. On average, he sells between 5,000 and 50,000 francs of goods each day. With this loan, he will increase his stock by buying switches, fuses, toilets, faucets, and light bulbs. In the future, he hopes to enter the wholesale business and with his savings he will open a large store; he will travel to West Africa to purchase his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase toilets, faucets and light bulbs.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
To accomplish her retail business plans, 35-year-old M. Safina has gone to extreme lengths to give a good, hard work account of herself in a highly competitive business genre for the last sixteen years in Central market –Jinja. Diligently and with time, she has gotten half way to the point where she envisaged she would be at the threshold of this business. She says she wanted to be self reliant, and at present, in many respects, she can bank on this business to solve most, if not all of her family’s needs. 

Safina is a married woman with four kids. She also has a rental business. Approximately $45 is what she makes in a week. She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase more general merchandise retail stock such as sugar, soap, maize flour, etc. to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more general merchandise retail items such as sugar, soap, etc. for resale

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: El Señor Fortunato vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposa y sus dos hijitos, comenzó siendo chofer de una movilidad hace 23 años el cual le gusto y se compro su propia movilidad que fue un taxi  trabajo con este bastante tiempo, hace tres años se compro un minibús con el cual trabaja actualmente haciendo viajes a la localidad de Tunari por lo menos una vez por día. El señor necesita el crédito para la compra de llantas y así poder trabajar mucho mejor haciendo esos viajes tan largos el sr. Estaba muy feliz por el crédito y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Fortunato lives in his in-laws’ house, along with his wife and two little children. He started working as a driver 23 years ago, an activity that he enjoyed.  He bought his own vehicle, a taxi, which he worked with for a long time.  Three years ago, he purchased a minibus.  He still uses it currently, and makes trips to the Tunari locality at least once per day.

He needs a loan in order to buy tires, so he can work better and make those long trips.  He is very happy to have credit, and thankful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: To purchase tires.

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Femme commercant de 44 ans, mariee avec 2 enfants dont l'age varient entre 23 ans et 8 ans, et tous vont au lycee, au college et a l'ecole primaire, connaissant sa charge , pour palier a la misere elle s'est lancee dans la vente de vaiselles en 2000 pour aider a ameliorer les conditions de vies de sa famille .
Elle vend en moyenne 15000f a 50000 f par jour.
avec le pret qu'elle souhaite recevoir elle tient a renforcer so commerce en achetant de la porcelaine de Chine; de Sevres; des flutes a champagnes, des verres en cristal; des produits qui marchent bien , puisque sesclients lui demandent ses produits durant les festivites de mariage et differentes ceremonies.

Tres strategique,elle est parfois ambulante ou fait des depots dans les administrations pour accroitre ses revenus, malgre la crise , elle s'efforce a trouver de nouveaux creneaux de vente pour joindre les bouts du mois; et aider sa famille pour subvenir aux etudes des enfants qui sont a l'universite. 
tres connu dans le marche, elle a une bonne reputation.
texts.en:
This 44-year old businesswoman has two children of 23 and eight years old, who are at secondary and primary school respectively; aware of her responsibilities and in order to appease her poverty and improve her family's living conditions, she set herself up selling crockery in 2000. She has an average turnover of 15,000 to 50,000 francs a day. 

With this loan that she is hoping to get, she is keen to strengthen her business by buying china, porcelain, champagne flutes, crystal glasses, products which sell well, since her customers request these products for marriages and various other ceremonies.

Her strategy is to sell on a door-to-door basis or deposit her goods in government buildings in order to increase her income. Despite the crisis she is making an effort to find new places to sell in order to make ends meet each month and to be able to help her family cover the costs of the children who are at university. She is very well known in the market and has a good reputation.

loans.use: Purchase of pots, plates and glasses

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a sembrar pastos que son utilizados como forraje para el ganado que posee; asimismo siembra papa, arveja zanahoria y papa. Esta actividad lo trabaja en compañía de su esposo y de sus hijos, quienes siempre la apoyan. Una vez llegada la temporada de cosecha llega a venderlo en los mercados de su ciudad, de esa manera logra generarse ganancias y recupera lo invertido. Ella le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que la venta de pasto le es bastante rentable, debido a la demanda que tienen por parte de sus vecinos, ya que la mayoría posee animales y no tiene con que alimentarlos. En adelante desea extender el área de cultivo para tener una mayor producción. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y espera como otras veces ser cumplida en los pagos. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Elsa is 46 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home.  For the past ten years, she has dedicated herself to planting grasses for her livestock to graze in.  In addition, she plants potatoes, peas and carrots.  She carries out these activities in the company of her husband and children, who always support her.  Once the harvest season arrives, she will sell her product in her city’s markets to generate income and recoup what she has invested.

She likes her work a great deal as the sale of grasses is very profitable.  It is in high demand by neighbors, given many of them own livestock and don’t have the means to feed them.  In the future, she would like to extend her cultivation land so she can yield more products.  

This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very glad to know that she has financial support.  She hopes to again comply with her installment payments, as she has other times.  In addition, she enjoys being part of a cooperative bank because all the members are very responsible and united.  She thanks those of you who might contribute toward her loan, as it will be very helpful in growing her business.  She will use the funds she is requesting to purchase sacks of fertilizer so she can continue planting.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Boanerge Campo

texts.es:
Boanerge de 45 años, elabora panes en su casa para venderlos en un triciclo en las calles del suburbio. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Aprendió a ser panes desde muy pequeño, cuando se caso necesitaba tener ingresos para su familia el comenzó su negocio de venta de pan hace 10 años.
