Desde ese tiempo ha venido trabajando haciendo panes y vendiéndolos en su casa y recorriendo las calles del suburbio, trabaja desde las 06h00am en su casa y en la tarde desde las 14h00pm recorre las calles del suburbio vendiendo panes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, mantequilla para hacer mas panes y tener así mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y comprar un horno para tener mas capacidad de elaborar panes.
texts.en:
Boanerge is 45 years old and makes bread in his home to sell from his tricycle in the streets of the suburb. He lives in an urban zone called a suburb and it is known for having most of its residents work independently in sales.

He learned to make bread when he was very young. When he got married he needed a source of income for his family and he began his business selling bread 10 years ago. Since then he has worked making bread at home and then selling it in the streets. He starts working at 6:00 am at home and then sells bread on the streets in the afternoon starting at 2:00 pm.

He wants to use the loan to buy flour and butter to make more bread and have a higher income. In the future he wants to expand his business and buy an oven to be able to make more bread.

loans.use: Flour, butter

loans.name: Hazel

texts.es:
Hazel es una  mujer, dedicada al comercio,  de venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada, en su casa de habitación, desde hace dos años, iniciando con dinero propio de su liquidación como conserje de un hospital. Pues por ser de edad avanzada renuncio, con el objetivo de poner su propio negocio.
Pues siempre ha tenido otros ingresos ya que lleva varios años alquilando un cuarto, lo que ha ayudado a sus cuatro hijos. 
Para aumentar la inversión busca financiamiento, lo que ha venido a comprar más ropa variada, como suéteres, sabanas, que se vende mucho por tener un precio accesible y por ser de buena calidad.
Afodenic ha sido quien ha dado la oportunidad de crecer en venta, lo que se ha beneficiado ya que ha logrado el crecimiento. Con este préstamo comprara dos pacas de ropa y ropa interior nueva.
texts.en:
Hazel is a business woman who has been selling clothing both new and used from her home for the past 2 years. She started out with her own capital funds, from a separation package she received from her past work as a janitor in the hospital.  Given her advanced age she quit that job and set up a business of her own instead. She has always had other sources of income. She has many years renting out a room in her house and this have helped to provide for her four children. 

She wishes to expand her business and to this end she seeks a loan. She will purchase a variety  of clothing items such as sweaters and shirts, items that sell very well for its comfortable  pricing and good quality. 

Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) has given her the opportunity to increase her sales and it has been of great personal benefit. This loan will be used to purchase two loads of clothing and new undergarments.

loans.use: To purchase two loads of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Bassajja Mivule Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
It is ten years now since 34-year-old S. Henry began his charcoal selling business in Kazinga-Mukono.  Henry, needless to say, has been able to bank on this business to support his kids in their education and also to start up some other small business ventures. 

Henry got interested in this business after he witnessed the gradual improvement in the circumstances of his close friend who was plying the same trade. Prior to this he was operating a small hotel. He also ekes out side profits from a small flour milling enterprise he began after his charcoal sales business stabilized. About $66 is what he makes in a week. 

Henry, who makes common cause with the Bassajja Mivule Development group-Mukono, says with this loan he is going to buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Brield Silve Garclem

texts.fr:
homme de 28ans célibataire sans enfant. après ses études universitaire n'ayant eu du travail, il se lance dans la vente des ustentils de cuisine.ses ventes sont de 15000frs à 40000frs.

avec ce pret il va renforcer son commerce en achatnt des ustentil de cuisine pour céromonie.

il à un bon étallage de ses marchandises et est tres acceuillant.
 il aimerait vuyager afin d'importer la marchandise et deveir le plus grand fournisseur de brazzaville.
il veut fondé une famille aisi que être capable de bien nourrir ses enfants dans le futur.
dans son entourrage on dit qu'il est courageux si bien on l'appelle par monsieur "toujours combatu mais jamais abattu".
texts.en:
This is a 28-year-old man who is unmarried and without children.  Having no work following his university education, he embarked on the selling of kitchen utensils.  He has a nice display of merchandise and is very accommodating. His sales range from 15,000 francs to 40,000 francs. With this loan, he is going to bolster his business by buying kitchen utensils for special events.  

He would like to go abroad in order to import merchandise, and he would like to become the biggest supplier in Brazzaville.  He wants to start a family, as well as to feed his future children well.  Those around him say he is so courageous that he is called "Mr. Always-Embattled-But-Never-Beaten."

loans.use: Buying kitchen utensils

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es:
El grupo Restauración está conformado por tres personas esforzadas, emprendedoras y luchadoras quienes trabajan arduamente con el fin de salir adelante. La coordinadora del grupo es Ángela U. Ramírez de 26 años quien desde hace 10 años por las mañanas realiza tortillas bastimento por excelencia en la dieta nicaragüense y por las tardes desde el 2008 vende café con pan. 

U. tiene tres pequeños de los cuales la mayor ya va a la escuela y su sueño es mejorar su negocio e invertir en otros rubros para darles todo lo posible a sus hijos. Ella invertirá el crédito en maíz y leña.
Los otros integrantes son Maryuri Dayana Guevara de 24 años desde el 2,000  vende verduras como papa, cebolla, chiltoma, tomate, yuca etc. negocio que aprendió para salir adelante y Eddy José Enriques Calderón desde hace ocho años comercializa discos.
texts.en:
The Restoration Group is made up of three dedicated entrepreneurs who are working arduously with hopes to improve their lives. The coordinator of the group is Angela U. Ramírez is 26 years old and for the last ten years has worked preparing tortillas, the base of the Nicaraguan diet, and in the afternoons she sells coffee and sweetbreads. 

U. has three children, the oldest of whom has already started school. Her dream is to improve her business and invest in other areas in order to give everything she can to her children. She will use the loan to purchase corn for tortillas and firewood.

The other members are Maryuri Dayana Guevara, who is 24 and for the last 10 years she has worked selling vegetables like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and yucca and Eddy José Enriques Calderón who has been selling CDs for the last eight years.

loans.use: En maiz, leña, café y pan

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Maria del Carmen R. tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, Maria vive en Jicaro Galan Nacaome y se dedica desde hace 3 años a la comercializacion de ropa nueva, vende  ropa interior, faldas, pantalones, blusas y mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de jeans, camisas, camisetas y blusas.
Sus puntos de venta son las colonias aledañas a su domicilio, 
su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Maria del Carmen R. is 43 years old, she is a single mother and she has 2 children who still depend on her. Maria lives in the community of Jicaro Galan Nacaome and for the past 3 years she has been selling new clothing, undergarments, skirts, slacks, blouses and more. She will use her loan to purchase jeans, shirts, t-shirts and blouses. She makes her sales in the neighboring regions. Her greatest dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, t-shirts, and blouses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jimmy Randy

texts.es: El señor Jimmy Randy L. B. se dedica a la venta de ceviche hace más de cuatro años aproximadamente, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en calle Ayacucho Ica lo cual es alquilado. Vive con sus padre no tiene carga familiar es soltero le ayuda a sus padres a solventar los gastos familiares. Solicita el crédito por que quiere ampliar su negocio comprando muebles y otros inplementos,el cliente sueña con tener su propio local por tal mótivo se propone otorgarle el crédito y también por que en la evaluación se indago buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Jimmy Randy L. B. has been selling ceviche fore more than four years. His business is located on Ayacucho Ica street. He rents the space. He lives with his parents and he doesn’t have any family responsibilities. He is single and he helps his parents with the family’s expenses. He requests a loan to expand his business. He will purchase furniture and other implements. He dreams of having his own restaurant. To this end he has been granted access to a loan. He has received good references, both personal and from his work.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Santos Felix

texts.es:
el señor Santos Felix A. A. tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la sra. Elia Nuñez y tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos, su esposa se dedica a la venta de refrescos y coronas, juntos los dos se ayudan con los gastos del Hogar.
Santos se dedica a la elaboracion de quesillo en su casa de habitacion.
El proceso de elaboracion de este producto se detalla a continuacion: don Santos Felix compra la leche a los ganaderos de la region, se echa en recipientes adecuados y luego se le coloca la pastilla para cuajar, se deja reposar por un determinado tiempo, luego se le quita todo el suero que trae la leche, despues se cocina en un recipiente a temperatura de unos 200 grados, se continua moviendo la cuajada dentro del recipiente hasta obtener el producto terminado llamado en nuestro pais quesillo,  que se utiliza para hacer tortillas con quesillo que es una golosina tipica muy sabrosa y ademas para hacer pizzas de quesillo y las famosas pupusas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leche y leña.
su mayor anhelo es tener un mayor numero de clientes y asi tener majores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Felix A. A. is 43 years old and he is married with Mrs. Elia Nunez. They have three children together who still depend on them. His wife sells soft drinks and snacks and together they contribute towards the household expenses. 

Santos makes cottage cheese in their home. The process to make this product is as follows:  Santos Felix purchases milk from the farmers in the region. It is placed in containers and a cheese enzyme is added. It is allowed to rest during a certain time after which all of the whey is removed. The remaining product is cooked at a temperature of about 200 degrees while it is stirred constantly until the finish product is obtained. In their country it is called quesillo and it is used to make tortillas. Quesillo is also used in a very tasty and very traditional dessert, in pizzas, and in very famous pupusas. The loan will be used to purchase milk and firewood. His greatest dream is to have a larger number of clients and improve his profits.

loans.use: To purchase milk and firewood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 46 años, vive con sus 4 hijos  en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas pero desde hace más de 15 años decidido dedicarse más a la ganadería ya que diariamente vende leche que extrae de las vacas que posee, asimismo vende los becerros, de esa manera se genera más ingresos. En ocasiones recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, ya que en sus ratos libres la ayudan en esta actividad. Actualmente siembra papa y maíz pero en menores proporciones, ya que le sirven para su propio consumo. Eva ha comprobado lo rentable que suele ser la venta de leche, es por eso que desea ampliar su establo y mejorarla. Es el segundo crédito que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, asimismo manifiesta se cumplida con sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, que son responsables y muy solidarias. En tanto agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa y pasto que servirá de alimento para sus animales.
texts.en: Eva is 46 years old and she lives together with her four children in their own home. Almost her entire life she has been involved in agricultural activities, but more than 15 years ago she decided to specialize to be milk farmer instead. She obtains milk every day from the cows she has and she also sells the calves to generate more earnings. Sometimes her kids help out in their spare time. She has been sowing potatoes and corn in small amounts but they are used mostly for their own consumption. She has seen the milk sales are very profitable and it is for this reason that she wishes to expand her stable and improve it. This is the second loan accessed through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very grateful for the financial support and she is committed to the loan terms. She also enjoys taking part in her community bank because all of the members are known to her and they are very responsible individuals and are team oriented.  She is grateful to all of those individuals that will contribute to the loan she requests. The loan will be very helpful in the progress of her business. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer to plant alfalfa and grass.  These will be used in producing feed for her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer to grow feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Heart Of Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este comité  Corazón de Jesús es un comité  que está en el quinto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya cuenta con 16 integrantes.
La Sra. Veronica P. quien trabaja dentro del comité posee un pequeño puesto de venta de frutas sobre una avenida muy concurrida en ciudad.
Para contar con mercaderías frescas ella va al mercado de abasto a comprar las frutas.
Ella vende además jugos naturales, tiene clientela formadas con el ingreso que ella lo realiza día a día ayuda al marido, ingreso en el comité con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas como plátanos, naranjas, manzanas, piñas, peras.
Es un comité donde las integrantes tienen  muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is named "Heart of Jesus" and it is currently on its fifth loan cycle, working together with Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner). There are 16 members in the group. 

Mrs. Veronica P. is a member of the group and she has a small stand from where she sells fruits. The stand is located on a very well traveled street in the city. 

In order to acquire fresh produce, she goes to the market. She also sells fresh fruit juices that she sells to an established client base. With the profits that she earns she helps her husband day after day. She joined the group with the idea of expanding her small business. She requests a loan to purchase fruits such as bananas, oranges, apples, pineapples, and pears. The group collectively has a great desire of self-improvement.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: Andres Crisostomo

texts.es:
Andrés de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. Tiene una pequeña tienda surtida. 

Hace 11 años atrás el comenzó con la tienda para tener mas ingresos y poder mantener a su familia. En la actualidad trabaja en su tienda medio tiempo y es operador de maquina pesadas para tener mas ingresos. Trabaja desde las 08h00am en la tienda hasta que sale a operar la maquina. En el tiempo que el no se encuentra la esposa la atiende hasta que el regresa y la tiene abierta hasta las 21h00pm. Vende víveres y películas en cd. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y snack para surtir mas su tienda. En el futuro quiere agrandar la tienda y construir una casa para segurar la vejez de el y su esposa.
texts.en:
Andrés, age 52, lives in an urban area called Suburbio.  Most of the inhabitants there are informal merchants.  He has a small, stocked store.

He started the store 11 years ago in order to get more income and to be able to support his family.  He currently works in his store half time.  He is a heavy machinery operator so that he can have more income.  He works from 8:00 a.m. in his store until he leaves to operate the machinery.  When he is not in the store his wife takes care of it until her returns.  The store is open until 9:00 p.m.  He sells groceries and movies on CDs.

With the loan he wants to buy drinks and snacks in order to better stock his store.  In the future he wants to expand his store.  He also wants to build a house in order to ensure his and his wife’s old age.

loans.use: Drinks and snacks

loans.name: Denis Alberto

texts.es:
Denis de 39 años de edad, su familia la conforma su esposa Blanca Rosa Espinoza Blandon que es ama de casa y la misma se encarga de cuidar a los niños. 

Don Denis es agricultor, recibe ingreso de venta de leche y de la comericalizacion del ganado, de igual forma posee su área de raices y tuberculos y de esta manera garantiza la alimentacion familiar.  Solicita el segundo crédito a la institución de AFODENIC mediante kiva, para ser invertido en siembra de pasto, su garantía, titulo de propiedad de una parcela de 12  mzs, localizada en la comarca Guinea Vieja, con excelentes condiciones  técnicas para desarrollar las actividaded agricola, y con la mejora del Pasto se prepara para que en tiempo de verano el Ganado cuente con la alimentación necesaria, de esta forma mantener su hato ganadero en buen desarrollo y mejores rendimiento en carne y producción de leche.

Su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario y llegar a ser un alto Ganadero para garantizar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Denis is 39 years old.  His wife, Blanca Rosa Espinoza, is a housewife, and she takes care of the children.

Denis is a farmer.  He receives income from the sale of milk and from selling livestock.  He also has an area where he grows roots and tubers, which guarantees food for the family.

He is requesting his second loan with the AFODENIC institution through Kiva.  He will use the loan to plant fodder.  His guarantee is the title of a 12 “manzanas” (a manzana is a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters or 1.728 acres) piece of property located in the Guinea Vieja region.  This property is in excellent condition for farming.  

With the improvement of growing fodder he is preparing for the summertime so that the livestock can have the feed they need.  This way his livestock herd will have good growth and render improved meat and better milk production.

His biggest dream is to increase his inventory and to become a rancher of high stature in order to guarantee better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: siembra de pastos

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bottled juices, soda, peanuts, oil. salt, lotions, perfumes, etc., to resell.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Producción San Roque de Caaguazú  esta integrada por 20 señoras, tiene 2 años de funcionamiento como comité poseen una huerta ecologica de donde se proveen de verduras para el consumo de cada familia, aparte cada una tiene un trabajo diario.
Las mismas tuvieron conocimiento del Programa de Comité de Mujeres através de las promociones realizadas por la zona, las mismas necesitaban de un pequeño capital para invertir en sus labores y asi obtener mejor calidad de vida. 
Son personas humildes, muy unidas y desean un futuro mejor para todas, y tienen certeza que lo van a lograr gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nemesia quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en ferias que el comite realiza en las semanas.
Por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos que ella desea utilizar en la huerta para las verduras que van a cultivar.
texts.en:
The San Roque de Caaguazú Communal Bank is comprised of 20 women, and they have been together for two years.  As a group they have an ecological garden that provides vegetables for the consumption of each family.  Each member also has their daily work.  The members found out about the Programa de Comité de Mujeres through the promotional activities in the area.  

The members need a small amount of capital to invest in their work in order to have a better quality of life.  They are humble people.  They are very united, and they wish for a better future for all.  They are sure that they will manage that thanks to the help from the Fundación Paraguaya.

Nemesia, one of the members, sells fruit and vegetables at the group’s weekly fairs.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies that she wishes to use in the garden to grow vegetables.

loans.use: Buy garden supplies like seeds, fertilizer, hoses for watering, and others

loans.name: Yanelisa

texts.es:
Yanelisa es una microempresaria dedicada las ventas de ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos, carteras entre otros. Su negocio se encuentra en la ciudad de Hato Mayor, una ciudad dedicada a la agricultura al noreste del pais. Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque necesitaba invertir en su negocio Es una joven soltera que vive con su madre, con la cual comparte su tiempo libre y apoya economicamente. Nos dice que su reto mas dificil por cumplir es poder terminar la universidad, pero que mientras se esfuerza para lograrlo, disfruta de la lectura y salir a pasear.

Yanelisa está muy emocionada de recibir su quinto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 5 años, el cual inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Productos Miscelaneos (zapatos, carteras, ropas, cosmeticos). Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y ahorrar. Su sueño es poder convertirse en profesional.
texts.en:
Yanelisa is a small business woman who sells clothing, cosmetics, shoes and wallets among other items. Her business is located in the city of Hato Mayor. The city is primarily made up of a population of agriculturists and it is located in the northwest region of the country. She is a member of Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) and she joined having seen the need to invest in her business. She is a young, single mother who lives with her Mom, with whom she spends her time and supports her financially. She states that her goal is a very challenging one, in that she dreams of completing her university studies. She also enjoys reading and touring. 

Yanelisa is very excited to be in receipt of a fifth loan from Esperanza International, having repaid the previous loan successfully. With the help of the past loan she took one step forward in the development of her business. She has had the business for about 5 years. She started the business with her first loan from Esperanza. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of miscellaneous products (shoes, wallets, clothing, and cosmetics). She will use the profits to reinvest back into the business and to put away in savings. Her dream is to have a professional career.

loans.use: To purchase miscellaneous merchandise.

loans.name: Milton Obed

texts.es:
el joven Milton Obed E. tiene 24 años de edad, esta recien casado y no tiene hijos, vive en la aldea Altos de la Cruz de la comunidad de San Lorenzo.
Milton tiene tres años de dedicarse al oficio de soldadura elaborando ventanas, puertas, verjas y techos metalicos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar el metal, electrodos y pintura para elaborar sus productos.
su meta es mejorar su equipo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The young Milton Obed E. is 24 years old and he is a newlywed. He has no children and he lives in the village of Altos de la Cruz of the San Lorenzo community. 

Milton has three years' experience in his welding business where he makes windows, doors, gates, and metal roofing.  The loan will be used to purchase metals, electrodes and paint to make his products. His goal is to update his work equipment.

loans.use: To purchase electrodes, metals and paints.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
El señor Cristian A. de 28 años de edad, está soltero.
   Don Cristian se dedica a la venta de repuestos y servicios técnicos para motos hace más de 10 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.000; el comenzó trabajando con su padre en el negocio, se recibió de técnico en la especialidad industrial,  área mecánica,  en la actualidad tiene 2 personas que están trabajando para él, y una gran clientela formada en su comunidad. 
   El utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías, (pistones, bobinas, bujías, juntas, cubiertas, cabos, aros, etc.).
texts.en: Cristian A. is 28 years old and he is single. Cristian has been involved in motorcycle repair, sales and services for the past 10 years; since approximately the year 2000. He started out working with his father until he graduated as an industrial technician and mechanic. He has 2 people employed in the business and he has a large client base in his community. He will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as pistons, bobbins, spark plugs, nuts, and bolts, etc.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Kady Jahoska

texts.es:
Kady Jahoska de 27 años de edad, vive en la zona # 1 frente a la casa de la mujer en Nueva Guinea, con su esposo Roger Javier que le ayuda con los gastos basicos del hogar, tienen dos hijos menores de edad: Daniela estudia 4to grado de primaria y Roger de 3 añitos estudia preescolar primer nivel. 

Kady, finalizó la carrera de admnistración de empresa, se dedica a la venta de ropa y comesticos, para ayudar a desarrollar su propia económia familiar,donde ya tiene su propia clientela, actividad que realiza desde pequeña.  Solicita el 2do crédito a AFODENIC mediante la ayuda de Kiva para construir el dormitorio de los dos niños, ya que actualmente duermen en el mismo cuarto de ella. 

su  mayor sueño es crecer en el mercado del comercio de esta manera obetner mayores Ganancias y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, para que sean personas honestas como ella, preparadas y puedan depender de ellas mismas en el futuro.
texts.en:
Kady Jahoska is 27 years old and she lives in Zone #1 in front of La Casa de la Mujer in Nueva Guinea. Her husband, Roger Javier, helps with the basic expenses of the household. They have two young children together: Daniela is in 4th grade and Roger is 3 years old and is in preschool. 

Kady finished her training in business administration and now she sells clothing and cosmetics. She contributes to the family's economy with the help of her business and she has won herself a good client base. She has had the business since she was very young. She requests a second loan from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) to build a bedroom for their two children. Currently they all live in one room together. 

Her greatest dream is to expand in the market and improve her profits with the goal of improving the living conditions for her children. She wants to see them grow up to be honest individuals as she is. She wants to see them ready to support themselves in the future.

loans.use: To build a bedroom for the kids.

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
La señora Efigenia B. de 61 años de edad vive en concubinato hace 31 años con el señor Claudelino Benitez de  55 años, la pareja tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales tres viven en el extranjero trabajando y los otros dos de 29 y 27 años viven con sus padres.
La señora Efigenia está trabajando como confeccionista de ropas hace 46 años , es decir, a los quince años termino su estudio y desde esa fecha siempre se dedicó a esta actividad y con eso ayudaba a cubrir los gastos de la unidad familiar siempre respaldado por su marido que es carpintero. Durante todo este tiempo llegó a formar muchos clientes a quienes le confecciona sus ropas.
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos de varios tipos, cierre, para realizar confecciones para la temporada como  camisas, manteles , remeras y otros articulos . 
De esta forma tendrá la posibilidad de tener otros ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Efigenia B. is 61 years old and has lived with her partner Claudelino Benitez (aged 55) for 31 years. The couple have five children, three of whom live and work abroad. The other two, aged 29 and 27, live with her parents.
Efigenia has worked as a seamstress for 46 years, having worked in this business ever since leaving school at 15. The work allowed her to contribute to the family’s expenses, supported by her partner who is a carpenter. Over this period, she has attracted many clients for whom she makes clothes.
The client is requesting the loan to buy fabrics, different types of thread, and zips. These will help her make seasonal clothes like T-shirts, tablecloths and other items.
This will allow her to earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy different types of fabric, including chiffon, linen, and organza.

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Carmencita es una de los miembros del Grupo Fe y accion 3 y 4, son microempresarias dedicadas a las ventas de ropa, productos misceláneos, zapatos, artesanía, etc. Sus plazas se encuentran en la ciudad de Hato Mayor, una ciudad dedicada a la agricultura al noreste del pais. Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenia el deseo de invertir en su negocio. Es madre soltera con 2 hijos, que aun viven con ella, por los que se esfuerza y se dedica a trabajar. Nos dice que su reto mas dificil es construir su casa, siendo este tambien su mas anhelado sueño. Disfruta cuidar y estar con sus hijos.

Carmencita está muy emocionada de recibir su  préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 3 años, el cual inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de ropas como faldas, pantalones, camisas, etc. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para ir construyendo su casa ya que su sueño es poder vivir comoda y sin pagar alquiler.
texts.en: Carmencita is a member of the Faith and Action 3 - 4 Group, all microentrepreneurs selling clothing, shoes, handicrafts, and miscellaneous products.  Her plazas are located in the city of Hato Mayor, an agriculture-based city in the northeast of the country.  This member of Esperanza started with us because she wanted to invest in her business.  She is the single mother of 2 sons, both still living with her.  It is for them that she works so hard at her business.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge is the construction of her house, which is also her most cherished dream.  She enjoys caring for her children and being with them.  Carmencita was very touched to receive her loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her former loan and having taken a break to grow her business.  She has had this business for about 3 years, started with the first loan from Esperanza.  She will invest her new loan in clothing such as skirts, pants, shirts, etc.  She will use her earnings to continue the construction of her house, since her dream is to be able to live comfortable without paying rent.

loans.use: To purchase skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.es:
Elearzar S., de 35 años, habita en la comarca Santa Rosa, casado, integra el núcleo familiar Josue de 3 añitos, Anielka de 1 añito y Roberto de 13 años estudia 6to grado, despues que realiza sus estudios ayuda a las actividades del campo en coordinanción con su papá y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar los niños. 

El Sr. S. es dueño de una propiedad de 50 Mzs, en la comarca Santa Rosa, del Serrano, la cual tiene buenas condiciones técincas para el desarrollo del inventario ganadero, posee un corral, areá de pastos divididas en pequeñas areá, aguaje de todo tiempo, ademas es dueño de su inventario ganadero, obtiene su ingreso durante el año por medio de la venta de leche, comercialización de ganado y venta de queso, también recibe otros ingreso de productos de la finca como es de raices y tuberculo y granos basicos, solicita su segundo crédito a la institución de AFODENIC por medio de Kiva para compra de 2 vacas paridas, siendo su garantía prendaria 6 carta de venta de vacas paridas,  este cliente tiene capacidad y voluntad de pago, en su crédito anterior cancelo en tiempo y forma, esta agradecido con la institución y espera continuar siendo beneficiado. 

S u mayor sueño es crecer en su inventario de Ganado para obetener mayores ganancias y de esta manera brindarle majores condiciones de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Elearzar S., 35 years old, lives in the region of Santa Rosa. He is married and his family includes Josue, three years old, Anielka, one year old and Roberto, who is 13 years old and is in the sixth grade. After his studies, Roberto helps his papá with the household chores and takes care of the kids. 

Señor S. is the owner of a property 50 Mzs, in the region of Santa Rosa in Serrano, which has good technical conditions for the development of his inventory of cattle. There is a corral, a pasture area divided into smaller parts, and Aguaje fruit all the time. Also, Elearzar is the owner of his cattle, he earns his income throughout the year through the sale of milk and cheese and by marketing his livestock. He also receives income from other products from his ranch such as roots, tubers and basic grains. He is seeking his second loan from the microfinance institution, AFODENIC, through the Kiva program in order to by two cows for milking, he is using six cows as collateral. This client has the capacity and willingness to pay, he completed his previous loan in a timely manner. He is grateful to the institution and expects to continue to benefit.

His greatest dream is to increase his inventory of cattle to earn greater income and in this way to bring better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: To buy two cows for milking

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
el sr. Guadalupe A. C. tiene 34 años de edad,  esta casado con la sra. Sandra Cristina Aguilar
con quien a procreado dos hijos, en su casa de habitacion tiene su pequeño taller en donde hace trabajos de balconeria, ademas tambien se dedica a la recolecion de botellas plasticas para reciclaje, producto que vende a clientes que lo compran para transformarlo en materia prima que se utiliza para fibra. 
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de electrodos, hierro y pintura.

su meta en estos momentos es terminar los trabajos que tiene en una iglesia en donde el asiste.
texts.en:
Mr. Guadalupe Álvarez C., 34, is married to Mrs. Sandra Cristina Aguilar.  They have two children.   He has his small metal shop located in their home.  He makes iron railings but also collects plastic bottles to recycle.  He sells the plastic bottles to customers that buy it to use as raw material in fiber making.

He will use the loan to buy electrodes, iron and paint.

His present goal is to finish projects he has for the church he attends.

loans.use: To buy electrodes, iron and paint.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La  señora Hilda de 63 años de edad, es casada, con el señor Canuto González tiene cuatro hijas  todas mayores están casadas, Gloria de 40 años, Ramona de 38 años, Nancy de 37 años y Esmilce de 35 años.

Hilda  se inició en este rubro  aproximadamente en el año 1995, ella era ama de casa pero con la necesidad de ayudar a su familia y poner su granito de arena, con el dinero que tenia ahorrado compro varias mercaderías y empezó a dedicarse a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad.

Solicito el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera  como fiambre, harina, carne, verduras necesidad ya que a fin de año tiene mas ventas.

La cliente espera un futuro mejor para nuestro pais con mucho trabajo y progreso.
texts.en:
Hilda, 63, is married to Mr. Canuto González.  They have four adult, married daughters: Gloria, 40, Ramona, 38, Nancy, 37 and Esmilce, 35.

Hilda started this business around 1995.  She used to be a housewife, and she wanted to do her part to help the family.  With savings she had she bought some merchandise and started to sell basic need items.

She asked for the loan to buy basic need items like: cold cuts, flour, meat and vegetables because sales increase at year’s end.

She hopes for a better future for our country with lots of work and progress.

loans.use: To buy cold cuts, flour, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una microempresaria dedicada las ventas de refrigerios, jugos, sandwiches entre otros. Su negocio se encuentra en la ciudad de Hato Mayor, una ciudad dedicada a la agricultura al noreste del pais. Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque necesitaba invertir en su negocio. Vive con su esposo, ya que sus dos hijos ya son adultos y no viven con ellos. Nos dice que su reto mas dificil es mantener su negocio estable, en estos momentos de tanta inestabilidad economica. Su actividad favorita es asistir a la iglesia y pasar tiempo junto a su familia

Maria está muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 4 años, el cual inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en su cafeteria, la cual vende todos tipos de productos comestibles, sea para refrigerios,o dulces. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y ahorrar y poder terminar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a small businesswomen engaged in the sale of snacks, juices, and sandwiches, among other things. Her business is located in the city of Hato Mayor, an agricultural center in the northeast of the country. Her association with Esperanza began because she needed to invest in her business. She lives with her husband. Since their two children are adults they do not live with them.

She tells us that her most difficult challenge is maintaining a stable business in these times of so much economic instability. Her favorite activities are attending church and spending time with her family.

Maria is very excited about receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza International after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loans and having taken steps towards the growth of her business. She has had her business for about 4 years. It began with the first loan she took from Esperanza.

She is going to invest her new loan in her cafeteria, which sells all types of edible products. The loan is for snacks and sweets. She is going to use her profits in order to continue investing in her business and for saving to be able to finish her house.

loans.use: Bread, sweets, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 26 años vive con su hija en casa de sus padres, disfrutando de la compañía de ellos. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la venta de animales, siendo los fines de semana que se dirige a la feria ganadera de su localidad para comercializar el ganado que posee. Sin embargo en los demás días de la semana se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva, en esta actividad su madre la ayuda en el negocio, siendo la principal diseñadora, por lo que logra siempre cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. María se siente muy satisfecha con las actividades que realiza ya que así puede cubrir las necesidades que tiene en su hogar. Ahora lo que más desea es incrementar su capital de trabajo e intensificarse más en ambos negocios. Es su quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero por ello cumplirá con la cuotas pendientes, por otro lado, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ella se siente muy agradecida de aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cerditos, así como telas para seguir  confeccionando ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
María, 26, lives with her daughter in her parents’ house enjoying their company.  For over 5 years she has sold animals.  It is during the weekends that she heads to the local livestock fairs to sell her cattle.  However, the rest of the week she manufactures sportswear.  Her mother helps her with the latter activity, she’s the main designer, and this insures her always filling her customers’ orders.

María feels very satisfied with the activities she engages in because she’s able to meet household expenses.  What she most wants now is to increase her working capital and become stronger in both businesses.

This is her 5th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and will repay her installments.  On the other hand, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She thanks all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested loan to buy piglets as well as fabric to continue making sportswear.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Bessy Roxana

texts.es:
la sra. Bessy Roxana M. G. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para dama y caballero, tambien trabaja como Impulsadora en una fabrica.
sus clientes son empleados de la fabrica y otras personas que les vende sus productos los fines de semana, su mercaderia la vende al credito, en estos momentos tiene un pedido grande de ropa interior y se esta preparando para la epoca navideña.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bessy Roxana Mejía Gómez, 29, lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood and sells ladies and men’s underwear.  She also works as Sales Agent for a factory.

Her customers are employees of the factory and other people she sells to on weekends.  She sells her merchandise on credit and right now she has a large order to underwear and she’s preparing for the Christmas season.

She will use the loan to buy underwear.  She needs the profits to cover household expenses.

loans.use: To buy underwear for women and men.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
señora Luz M. de 31 años de edad, está casada hace 6 años con el señor Derlis Caceres de 30 años, el matrimonio cuenta con 2 hijas, una de 3 años y otra de 3 meses,  cabe mencionar de que es una mujer muy trabajadora, empieza su actividad a tempranas horas a ordeñar sus vacas y luego distribuye su producción usando como medio de transporte su moto.
	La señora cuenta con 7 vacas lecheras y tiene una producción diaria  entre 40 a 50 litros diarios que los pone a la venta, su terreno es de 6 hectareas y alimenta a sus animales con balanceados, caña dulce y pasto camerun, que ella misma cultiva. 
	Su marido se dedica a comprar queso y luego comercializa en la capital, aportando de este modo a la economia familiar.
	Esta mujer emprendedora solicita el credito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con eso aumentar su producción diaria y mejorar su ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Luz M., age 31, has been married to Derlis Caceres, age 30, for six years.  They have two daughters: a three-year-old and a three-month-old. Luz is a very hardworking woman; she starts her work early in the morning to milk her cows and later delivers the milk using a motorcyle as a means of transportation.

Luz has seven dairy cows which allows her to produce and sell between 40 and 50 liters of milk daily; she feeds her animals a balanced diet of sugar cane and grass which she grows herself in her six-hectare plot of land. Luz's husband buys cheese and then takes it to the capital for retail sales; this way he contributes to the family budget.

This entrepreneurial woman is asking for a loan in order to purchase an additional dairy cow which would allow her to increase her daily production and improve her monthly income.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Elias Samuel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Elías Samuel está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, forzadas y emprendedoras  provenientes de la Pilas Orientales, Masaya. Ellos han sido beneficiados tanto por los créditos como por las capacitaciones las cuales según comentaron son muy buenas porque les aconsejan a cómo invertir sus ganancias. 

El coordinador del grupo es el señor Mauricio Jerónimo C. de 39 años quien se dedica al comercio de granos básicos. Él comercializar dichos productos de manera ambulante en mercado de Masaya  desde hace 3 años aproximadamente en los cuales asegura que este trabajo le ha sido difícil porque genera desconfianza andar ofreciendo de esta manera y es por ello que su meta es poder tener su propio tramo. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María S. de 30 años tiene una tortillería negocio en el que le va muy bien porque ya que este bastimento es muy buscado y además vende frijoles cocidos, y Gilma Antonia Velásquez de 23 años comerciante de granos básicos desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The Elías Samuel group is composed of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising people from Pilas Orientales, Masaya.  They have benefitted both by the loans and the training which, according to their comments, are very good because they advise them on ways to invest their profits.

The group coordinator is Mr. Mauricio Jerónimo C., 39, who sells basic grains.  He has sold in an ambulatory way in Masaya’s market for about the last 3 years.  He states that the work has been difficult because selling this way generates distrust and this is why he’d like to have his own market stall.

The other group members are:

María S., 30, who has a tortilla shop and does well thanks to this product being much sought after, she also sells cooked beans; and Gilma Antonia Velásquez, 23, who has sold basic grains for the last three years.

loans.use: For basic grains.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, es una mujer bondadosa de 46 años, que está casada con su Andrés de 36 años, con quien tiene 1 hijo; José de 5 años; los 3 viven en la zona cuenca alta de la Selva Central (Localidad de las Palmeras). Hace 4 años que viene dedicándose a la siembra de piña, cítricos y cacao; desde muy temprano se levanta para poder limpiar sus plantaciones de la maleza que crecen constantemente en sus campos; gracias a los cuidados que le brinda; toda su cosecha, son reconocidas por su buena calidad y en temporadas de cultivo los mismos comercializadores visitan su terrenos agrícolas para comprar sus productos. Ahora dentro de muy pocos meses cosechará varias hectáreas de piña; los cuales ya tiene comprador. Viendo la demanda de sus productos Delfina está pensando adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con los que podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y con ello logrará adquirir mayor rentabilidad para potenciar la calidad de sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y está muy entusiasta porque le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal ya que la gente que lo integra es responsable, puntual y honrada. Delfina, tiene pensado comprar con el crédito que obtendrá, bolsas de abono natural para asegurar el crecimiento de sus cultivos de piña.
texts.en:
Delfina, 46, is a very kind woman.  She’s married to her Andrés, 36, and they have a 5 year old son, José.  The three of them live in a community called Las Palmeras located in the highland Central Jungle.  

For the last four years she has been farming pineapple, citrus fruits and cacao.  She rises very early to clear weeds that grow constantly in her fields.  Thanks to the care she provides, her crops are renowned for their good quality.  At harvest time wholesalers visit her fields to buy her products.

In a few months now she will be harvesting several hectares of pineapple for which she already has a buyer.  Seeing the demand that exists for her product, Delfina is thinking about acquiring more farmland in order to meet the demand from her customers thus earning higher profits to increase productivity.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She is very enthusiastic because she likes working in her communal bank because the members are responsible, punctual and honest.

Delfina plans to use the loan she’ll get to buy sacks of organic manure to insure the growth of her pineapple crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Familia Cristiana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Familia Cristiana está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Eremita de Jesús Aragón quien hace mas de 30 años se dedica al comercio de ropa, zapatos, perfumes, joyas etc. 
Ella inicio vendiendo ropa usada con sus ganancias y los préstamos invirtió en otros productos y empezó a desarrollar su negocio. Aragón con el préstamo invertirá en mercadería en ropa y perfumes y con las ganancias espera mejorar su casa.

Los otros integrantes son Rufino Nery Córdoba Navarro hace 10 años inicio con la venta de ropa usada en el mercado oriental en la actualidad gracias a su trabajo arduo y los préstamos él comercializa perfumes y ropa; y Fatima A. de 31 años inicio como sus compañeros con el comercio de ropa usada y una pequeña venta de chiverías en su casa, hoy en día comercializa ropa, zapatos y comida.
texts.en:
The Familia Cristiana (Christian Family) Group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people. One of them is Eremita de Jesús Aragón, who has worked selling clothing, shoes, perfume, and jewelry for more than 30 years.

She began selling used clothing with her earnings and used the loans to buy other products and thus began to grow her business. She will use the loan to buy merchandise like clothing and perfume and with her earnings hopes to improve her home.

Another member is Rufino Nery Córdoba Navarro, who began selling used clothing 10 years ago in the Oriental Market. Thanks to his hard work and the loans he currently sells perfume and clothing. The other group member is 31-year old Fatima A.. She began like her colleagues selling used clothing and food and now sells clothing, shoes, and food.

loans.use: Clothing and perfume

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 30 años, convive con Elmer, de 30 años; ambos tienen 1 hijo, Jimmy de 11 años, al que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (localidad las Palmas). Desde muy niña se dedica a la agricultura y como conocedora de sus cuidados y técnicas; hace ya 10 años se dedica a sembrar sus propios terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra una variedad de cítricos; pero no solo a eso se dedica Gladys, ella también participa activamente en el trabajo que desarrollo su gobierno local; en algunos meses terminó con el proyecto de alfabetización apoyando a los pobladores de su localidad; ahora el nuevo proyecto que tiene es de defensa ribereña (proyecto para que el caudal del agua de los ríos no afecten a la población). En adelante ella quiere abrir un restaurante, donde pueda vender comida típica de la selva peruana; sus cosechas de cítricos le dan mucha rentabilidad y con el dinero que gana en los proyectos del estado espera reunir el capital que requiere para su nuevo proyecto. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y está segura que con el apoyo de su banco comunal y las personas que confían en ella, podrán salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono orgánico (abono natural), para los cítricos que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Gladys, 30, cohabits with Elmer, 30.  They have a son, Jimmy, 11, who they care for and educate in their own home located in Las Palmas in the Peruvian jungle.

From a very young age she has been farming so she is quite knowledgeable about farming techniques and proper crop care.  She has been farming on her own fields for 10 years now.  She grows a variety of citrus plants.  However, this isn’t Gladys’ only occupation.  She is also quite involved in the work of her local government.  A few months ago she completed an alphabetization (literacy) project providing support to residents in her area.  Now, the new project she’s involved with is a riverbank protection project, a project designed to protect villages from river overflows.

In the future she’d like to set up a restaurant where she can sell dishes typical of the Peruvian jungle region. Her citrus crops are quite profitable and added to the money she earns on the government projects she hopes to gather enough capital for her restaurant.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is sure that with help from the communal bank and people who put their trust in her she will be able to continue forward.

She will use the requested funds to buy organic manure for the citrus crops which will be harvested in a few months.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products and a sack of rice.

loans.name: El Almendrito Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Almendrito está conformado por cuatro féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas. Una de ellas es Mayra del Socorro E. Romero quien se dedica al comercio de verduras, actividad económica que aprendió de la señora Ángela Hernández, integrante del grupo quien le ayudo desinteresadamente.Ella a sus 39 años es soltera y madre de 5 hijos de los cuales los dos menores están a su cargo ellos están en la secundaria. E. con el crédito comprará ayote, quequisque, chiltoma, pipian etc. 

Las otras integrantes son Ángela del Socorro Hernández de 60 años quien en un inicio solamente vendía lo que cultivaba en unas pequeñas parcelas que ella alquilaba actualmente compra cosechas, ya que necesitaba más productos para comercializar en el mercado mayoreo, Managua; Patricia de los Ángeles C. vende frutas desde 1995, ella compra dichos productos en Masaya y las vende en Managua mientras Jenny del Rosario Valera hace 4 años aproximadamente tiene una pulpería la cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo.

Ellas han sido beneficiadas tanto por los servicios financieros y no financieros los cuales le ha sido de mucha ayuda, ya que por medio del crédito han podido invertir en sus negocios y con las capacitaciones han aprendió como administrarlo.
texts.en:
The “Almendrito” (Little Almond Tree) group has four female, hard working, enterprising, dedicated members.  

One of them is Mayra del Socorro E. Romero who is a vegetable merchant.  She learned this skill from Mrs. Ángela Hernández, another group member who unselfishly helped her.

She is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children.  The two youngest still depend on her.  They are in middle school. She will use the loan to buy chayote, peppers, “quequisque “(taro-like tuber), squash, etc.

The other group members are: 

Ángela del Socorro Hernández, 60. At the beginning she only sold what she grew on small plots that she rented.  Currently, she buys crops because she needed more products to sell at the Managua wholesale market.

Patricia de los Ángeles C. has sold fruit since 1995.  She buys the fruit in Masaya and sells it in Managua.

Jenny del Rosario Valera has had a grocery store for about four years that has gradually been growing.

They have all been benefitted both by financial and non-financial services that have been of great help to them because through the loans they have been able to invest in their businesses and the training sessions have taught them how to run them.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
la sra. Gumercinda C. V. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica al comercio vende productos de uso personal como ser cosmeticos, cremas, prefumes, lociones etc.
los fines de semana se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de donas y pastelitos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cremas, perfumes, lociones y cosmeticos. desea tener un inventario mas grande y asi tener mayores ventas y mas ganancias las cuales necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Gumercinda C. V. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Flor del Campo.  She dedicates herself to selling personal products such as cosmetics, creams, perfumes, lotions, etc.  On weekends, she makes and sells donuts and cakes.  

She will use the loan to buy creams, perfumes, lotions and cosmetics.  She would like to have a larger inventory, in order to increase her sales.  This will augment her income so she can cover the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has been running his car transportation business for the past seven years.  Currently, he is receives jobs through brokers and then coordinates drivers to deliver the cars. He has created a network of drivers but has been be unable to operate outside of brokers because he does not have a personal trailer. This forces him to pay a 15% commission to the brokers for every delivery. Never the less, his business has become successful enough that he has been able to purchase and pay off his own truck and is currently in the process of saving for another truck. He enjoys having his freedom to operate his own business and provide for himself. His biggest challenge has been learning how manage his time table of deliveries and making sure that drivers have the right amount of time to arrive at their final destination before the deadline. 

This is Jorge’s first loan with ACCION USA. With this loan he will be purchasing a trailer so he no longer has to pay the broker fees and he will be able to seek clients outside of brokers, avoiding fees.  This will substantially increase his profits and allow him more freedom in his business.

Jorge hopes that the purchase of a new trailer will lead to more business and with the help of ACCION USA he will also be able to purchase another trailer in the future. This is also going to increase his standard of living and allow him to grow as an independent businessman.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for car transportation service

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 24 años, convive con Eradio, de 29 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos todos ellos menores de edad; a los cuales cuida y educa en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). Hace ya 3 años, que se dedica, a la siembra de diversos  frutos que crecen en la selva; pero el fruto que le da mayor ingreso económicos a Karina, es la piña, ya que siembra en más de 9 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivo; los cuales cuida y cosecha constantemente, ya que según menciona; las malezas que crecen en su alrededor no les permiten crecer. Lo que más le molesta a ella es tener que cuidar sus plantaciones con abundante ropa, para evitar que ingresen las espinas de este fruto al cuerpo; “con el intenso calor de la selva, no se puede trabajar”, menciona. En estos meses cosechara 3 hectáreas de piña y esta planeando viajar a la capital para negociar a un mayor precio sus cultivos y más adelante convertirse en proveedor mayorista del país. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y está segura que con el apoyo que siempre brinda su banco comunal; podrá concretar su objetivo. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono natural para la piña que ya muy pronto cosechará; con ello quiere lograr productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Karina, 24 years of age, lives with Eradio, who is 29, and their 3 small children that they care for and educate in a rented home located in the Peruvian jungle (the Las Palmas community).  For the past 3 years, she has dedicated herself to planting various fruits that grow in the jungle.  However, the fruit that generates the most income for Karina is pineapple as she now plants it on more than 9 hectares of farmland. She tends and harvests her crops constantly, and she mentions that the plagues that exist around her can stop her plantings from growing.  

What is most difficult for her is the need to tend to her crops wearing abundant clothing, in order to stop the fruit’s thorns from piercing her skin.  “With the intense heat in the jungle, it is impossible to work,” she mentions.  During these months, she will harvest 3 hectares of pineapple, and the plan is to visit the capital to negotiate a higher price for her products.  In the future, she would like to become one of her country’s pineapple wholesalers.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is sure that, with the support that her cooperative bank always provides, she will be able to meet her goal.  She will use the loan she obtains to buy fertilizer for the pineapple, which will be harvested very soon.  With it, she would like to yield a high quality product.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Pura Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pura Vida conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Yamileth del Carmen S. comerciante de frutas y verduras. Esta actividad que inicio vendiendo las cosechas que se producían en la finca de su abuelo pero luego este murió y ella empezó a comprar por su cuenta. Ella sueña con mejorar y que su negocio prospere.

Las otras integrantes de grupo son  Francisca de Ángeles C. quien vende leña desde hace 8 años actividad que inicio con una cuñada hoy en día trabaja individualmente y María Margarita O. vende frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años, ella inicio con el comercio de lo que producía en su pequeña huerta este era poco así que empezó a comprar cosechas para aprovechar las ventas. 

Ellas han sido beneficiadas tanto con los servicios financieros y no financieros ya que les ha permitido mejorar su negocio primeramente por que cuentan con capital y los conocimientos para administrar, invertir y desarrollar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Pura Vida (pure life) group consists of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women; one of them is Yamileth del Carmen S. who sells fruit and vegetables. She started this business by selling the harvests produced in her grandfather's farm, but later he died and she started to work on her own. She dreams of expanding her business and making it prosperous.

The other members of the group are Francisca de Ángeles C. and María Margarita O..  Francisca has been selling firewood for eight years; she started this line of work with her sister-in-law, but now works independently. María Margarita has been selling fruit and vegetables for seven years; she began by selling the produce from her own small garden, but this was not enough, so she started purchasing harvests elsewhere to increase her sales.

The group members have benefited greatly from the availability of financial services, including in a non-financial sense, since it not only provided them with working capital but also with the knowledge necessary for administration, investment, and development of their businesses.

loans.use: Capital to purchase harvests

loans.name: Donata

texts.es: Donata de 50 años, convive con Marco, de 51 años de edad, ambos trabajan con un buen equipo, de esa manera sacaron adelante a su 5 hijos de los cuales, solo viven con uno de ellos, Roqui, de 14 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). Sus años de esfuerzo y sacrificio, dedicados a la agricultura dieron su resultado, hace ya 2 años que abrió un pequeño restaurante, donde ofrece los ricos potajes de la selva peruana; a los pobladores de su localidad le gusta su comida y todos los días saborean sin falta sus ricos platos. Le va tan bien que ahora dejó de sembrar para dedicarle más tiempo a su restaurante. En su casa propia que esta ubicada en una zona céntrica, Donata encontró una gran oportunidad, por ello instaló una tienda de comestibles, donde vender gas por balones, arroz y diversos productos de primera necesidad; que por la lejanía del lugar, no pueden viajar constantemente a la ciudad para adquirir dichos productos. Ahora ella quiere expandirse más y está planeando surtir más su bodega de comestibles. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y desea seguir trabajando con su banco comunal, porqué le demostró apoyo y progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en: Donata, 50-years-old, lives with Marco, 51-years-old, and together they work with a good team, which is how they've gotten themselves and their 5 children ahead. They live with one child, Roqui, 14-years-old, in their own house in the Peruvian jungle (the community of Las Palmas). Her years of hard work and sacrifice working in agriculture paid off two years ago when she opened a small restaurant where she offers delicious vegetable soups popular in the Peruvian jungle. The people in her area like her food and every day without fail they savor her delicious dishes. It's going so well that she's left her agriculture job to dedicate more time to the restaurant. In her home, which is centrally located, Donata found a great opportunity. She installed a food store where she sells gas for balls, rice, and various essential items. Because of the distance she's not able to travel constantly to the city to purchase her products. She wants to expand more and is planing to stock up her store with more food. This is her third loan with MFP and she wants to keep working with her communal bank because it has shown her support and progress. With this loan she will buy more merchandise for her food store.

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her store

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: Darío, de 62 años, es un hombre ambicioso y trabajador, vive con Basiliza, de 40 años; ambos tiene 5 hijos, todos menores; a los que crían y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa de Centro Pumpuriani). Hace ya 15 años que se dedica a la siembra de café, plátano, maíz y yuca (productos agrícolas); los que constantemente cuida y abona en sus terrenos de cultivo; donde después de cada cosecha se siente satisfecho de tantos meses de esfuerzo; porqué la calidad de sus productos le generan buenas ganancias. Los que más le divierte de su trabajo es poder negociar la venta de sus cosechas; ya que según afirma, es muy bueno para las ventas. Gracias a su banco comunal el pudo obtener muchas cosas y optimizar tiempo; con lo que puedo ahora contratar operarios para que le puedan ayudar en su terreno de cultivo. En adelante quiere abrir una pequeña bodega de comestibles, para poder incrementar sus ingresos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y le gusta el trabajo que realiza con su banco comunal; ya que le ayuda aumentar su producción; con las capacitaciones y el apoyo monetario. Darío, tiene pensado comprar con el crédito solicitado en semillas de maíz híbrido, que sembrará en sus nuevas hectáreas de terreno de cultivo que hace algunos días rozó (proceso de quema de plantaciones, para una nueva siembra).
texts.en:
Darío, 62, is an ambitious, hard working man.  He lives with Basiliza, 40.  They have five minor children that they raise and educate in their own home located in the Peruvian jungle in an indigenous community in Centro Pumpuriani.

He has been a coffee, banana, corn and manioc (agricultural products) planter for 15 years.  He constantly cares for and adds manure to his fields where he is always very satisfied at each harvest after so many months of hard work because the quality of his products brings good profits.

What he most enjoys about his work is being able to negotiate his crop sales because, according to him, he’s very good at sales.

Thanks to his communal bank he was able to obtain many things and optimize his time; he was able to hire laborers to help him in his fields.

In the future he’d like to open a small grocery store to increase income.

This is his 5th loan with MFP.  He likes the work he does with his communal bank because it helps him increase production through the training sessions and the financial help.

Darío plans to use the requested funds to buy hybrid corn seed that he will plant in his new hectares of planting soil which he prepared a few days ago (using a slash and burn technique for new planting).

loans.use: To buy hybrid corn seed.

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
el sr. Agapito S. O. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica a la fabricacion de mosaicos, mantiene clientes fijos que le realizan pedidos todos los meses, debido a que siempre tiene bastantes pedidos tiene la ayuda de dos empleados.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de Cemento y arena.
en estos momentos tiene un pedido un poco grande y necesita comprar los materiales para tener mas produccion, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Agapito S. O. is 59 years old and lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood.  He works manufacturing tiles.  He has regular customers who place orders every month, and because he has enough orders, he has the help of two employees.  

He will use the loan for the purchase of cement and sand.  He currently has a large order and he needs to buy materials to increase production.  

His earnings are necessary to cover household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of cement and sand

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es:
el sr. Oscar Orlando R. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la Aldea la Cañada y se dedica al servicio de transporte de personas TAXI, presta sus servicios en el MALL LAS CASCADAS  desde hace tres años, el credito lo utilizara para poder realizar cambio de placas al vehículo y poder ofrecer sus servicios fuera del Mall y tambien para alquilar un numero de taxi.
esta muy contento ya que hace poco adquirio su carro y le esta sacando el mayor provecho que necesita.
texts.en:
Oscar Orlando R. is 36 years old and lives in Aldea la Cañada.  He drives a taxi and has been providing service in Mall Las Cascadas for three years.  He will use the money from this loan to change the license plates and pay for a new taxi number for his taxi.  This will allow him to provide services outside of Mall.

He is very happy because he recently got his car and it is providing him the benefits he needs.

loans.use: Register his taxi

loans.name: Linda Mary

texts.es:
Linda Mary C., mujer trabajadora, esforzada, emprendedora y con iniciativa ella inicio hace dos años con el comercio de ropa, está actividad la empezó con la venta de unas cuantas piezas de ropa la cantidad que ha aumentado gracias a los préstamos. Ella es madre y padre de dos niños de 12 y 8 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente para que ellos estudien y se preparen.

 C. está muy a gradecida con adim por los beneficios que le ha proporcionado tanto en crédito como en capacitación lo que le ha permitido primeramente mejorar su autoestima, ha invertir y administrar su negocio.
texts.en:
Linda Mary C. is a hard working, struggling, entrepreneurial woman.  Two years ago, on her own initiative, she began selling clothing.  She began with a few articles and has been increasing her inventory, thanks to her loans.  She is both a mother and a father to her two children, ages 12 and 8 and she works hard so that they can study and prepare themselves.

Ms. C. is very thankful to Adim for the benefits they have provided her, both in loans and in training.  This has allowed her to improve her processes, and invest into and manage her business.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ortizer

texts.es: Ortizer es un hombre honesto lleno de amor, tiene 51 años y vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Pumpuriani; con su esposa Gloria de 48 años y los hijos de ella, Cecilia de 15 y Excer de 11 años a los que quiere como si fueran suyos. Hace 5 años, que se dedica a sembrar plátano, café, carambola, maíz y yuca y demás productos que crece en la selva, lo que gracias a su calidad, los vende en su propio terreno a los compradores que le visitan constantemente. Lo que más le gusta de la actividad que desempeña es rozar (quemar las plantaciones antiguas, para poder sembrar otras), ya que está seguro que le darán buenas cosechas, ahora con la ayuda de su banco comunal puede sembrar sus propios terrenos, “ahora ya no soy peón de nadie”, afirma. Dentro de sus planes futuros piensa cultivar sus terrenos agrícolas, que por falta de dinero dejó abandonados, además participará de un proyecto de reforestación por lo que plantará plantas ornamentales y maderables para trabajar correctamente con el permiso del Estado peruano. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son cumplidos, agradecen por el apoyo, a todos los intermediarios, que les ofrece una nueva vida con oportunidades. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 7 sacos de abono orgánico (abono natural), además de decenas de plantas de café que plantará en sus terreno agrícola que recientemente habilitó.
texts.en:
Ortizer is an honest man full of love.  He is 51 years old and lives with his wife, 48 year old Gloria and her children, 15 year old Cecilia, and 11 year old Excer, whom he loves as if they were his own.  They live in his own home, located in the native community of Pumpuriani.  Five years ago he decided to plant bananas, coffee, star fruit, corn, yucca, and other crops that grow in the jungle.  Thanks to their quality, he is able to sell his harvest to buyers who visit him constantly on his own land.

What he enjoys most about his work is burning his fields after the harvest. (This removes the old growth to make way for new plantings.)  He knows that this will provide him a good harvest.  With the help of his communal bank, he is able to plant on land of his own.  He tells us, “Now I am nobody’s farmhand.”

His future plans include planting on the rest of his land, which he had abandoned due to his lack of funds.  He will also participate in a reforestation program and will plant some other ornamental plants and trees so that he can work properly and with the permission of the Peruvian state.

This will be his fifth credit through MFP and together with the other members of the communal bank, he is grateful for the support of all the intermediaries who have offered them new lives with opportunity.

He will use the money from this loan to buy seven sacs of organic fertilizer (natural fertilizer) and scores of coffee plants that he will plant on his farmland that he recently prepared.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Juana Lesbia

texts.es:
Juana Lesbia C. de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y esforzada quien se dedica a la producción y comercio de ropa, gabachas, blusas, faldas etc. desde hace 9 años. Ella inicio está actividad porque es costurera y con unas piezas de ropa que hizo le fue muy bien, en la actualidad ella tiene dos colaboradoras quienes realizan la ropa mientras ella se encarga de venderlas.

C. sueña con tener un taller grande que preste las condiciones adecuadas para producir en grandes cantidades y tener una distribuidora de ropa. Ella con el préstamo invertirá en telas y aplicaciones especialmente para la realización de togas, birretes, estolas, uniformes por las promociones tanto de preescolar, de sexo grado y quinto año de secundaria.
texts.en:
Juana Lesbia C. is 42 years old and is a hard working entrepreneurial woman who’s been making and selling clothing, blouses, skirts, etc. for the past nine years.  She began doing this because she is a seamstress and things went well for her when she made a few articles of clothing.  Now she works with two other ladies who make the clothes and she is in charge of sales.  Ms. C. hopes to someday have a large workshop with adequate space for producing large quantities of clothing and also serve as a distribution point.

She will use the money from this loan to invest in fabric and accessories for making togas, school caps, stoles, preschool uniforms, and uniforms for sixth grades and junior high school students.

loans.use: Fabric and supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Z. T. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la Colonia La Era de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, las cuales las vende en su casa de habitacion de Lunes a Domingo de 6:00am a 7:00pm. tiene muchos clientes los cuales son sus vecinos y tambien por pedidos grandes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, cal, harina de maiz y agua, ya que ahora sus clientes le piden mas y su produccion no cubre con todos los pedidos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Señora Gloria Z. T. is 42 and lives in La Era in the city of Tegucigalpa and makes a living by making and selling corn tortillas.  She sells them in her home Monday through Sunday from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m.  She has a lot of clients who are her neighbors and also fills large orders.  She will use the loan to buy firewood, lime, corn flour, and water, since her customers are asking for more tortillas, and her current production does not cover all of the orders.  She needs the profits to cover her living expenses.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn flour, lime, and water.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, de 30 años, es un hombre honesto y trabajador, convive con Yohana, de 30años, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores; a los que educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa de centro Pumpuriani). Desde hace 7 años que se dedica a la agricultura, todas las mañanas de levanta muy temprano, para ayudar a los operarios que contrata constantemente para limpiar sus plantaciones de plátano, yuca y café; ya que sin ellos no podría limpiar y mantener, sus más de 3 hectáreas de cultivo. Lo que más le gusta a Wilmer es poder ver los frutos crecer, fuertes y nutritivos; ya que el constante quillo (maleza que crece entre los sembríos), afecta su producción y no le permite crecer; por ello tiene que estar todo él día cuidándolos, así asegurará, la rentabilidad de su sembrío, sin embargo Wilmer está trabajando muy duro para poder tener productos de calidad, y de esa manera adquirir mayor ganancia; para construir una casa más segura y confortable para su familia. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está muy agradecida, con el apoyo que en todo esté tiempo recibió, asegurando, que sin su banco comunal, no podría lograr los cambios que obtuvo. Wilmer, tiene pensado comprar con el crédito que solicita, abono orgánico (abono natural); para sus plantaciones, como también invertirá en el salario de los peones que contrató.
texts.en:
